Title: Senior Data Analyst - 297937
Description:
Senior Data Analyst
On behalf of our client in the Professional Services Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Senior Data Analyst.
Senior Data Analyst – Job Description
Understands the business and works to deliver business monitoring analytics
Drives independent or team-oriented business analytic projects that address reasonably complex business questions
Exercises independent judgment in leveraging business domain knowledge and selecting the analytical tools and programming required for insight generation (e.g., customer profiles, conversion funnels, web behavior, customer product experience)
Supports the identification of new technical requirements, and the testing/ troubleshooting of new product data capture functionality
Educates and provides guidance to business stakeholders on how best to harness available data in support of business needs
Applies and conforms to existing standards and quality criteria to monitor and ensure system reporting quality
Contribute to data standards to improve quality of data and speed of analysis
Executes routine data capture processes
Creates software programs of moderate complexity for acquisition, processing, and management of massive quantities of data (big data) using high-level programming languages, Analytical query and test results
Cleansed/transformed data from raw data inputs
Standard business report findings (e.g., monthly, quarterly, annual)
Data specification, flow mappings, and business logic documentation associated with new or modified product data capture requirements
Testing scenarios for PoC and quality product functional testing of capabilities
Design and code documentation
Senior Data Analyst – Mandatory Skills
5+ years of experience in a senior data analyst role
Strong in the following: ETL, SQL, Tableau
Strong problem-solving skills & a quick learner
We would like to see candidates coming from tech companies.
Expert in technical database skills (such as SQL, Hive and others), data automation tools, scripting languages (such as Python, Scala and others) and distributed data systems (such as Hadoop).
Experienced in building data processes including data modelling and ETL processes
Prepared data sets and reports to support more complex analysis
Proficiency in data visualization using tools like Tableau or Qlikview
Analytical and detail-oriented mind-set with an eye for details
A strong client partnership or consulting mindset to interact effectively with technical and non-technical partners
Ability to work independently, under pressure with a strong sense of urgency to meet deadlines and influence change
Outstanding team player who is able to work seamlessly with cross functional stakeholders and analytics team members
Very organized approach to managing workload with ability to multitask, prioritize and meet deadlines
Awesome communication skills, with the ability to clearly present complex data, the context surrounding it, and the implications to business stakeholders
Undergraduate degree a must
Senior Data Analyst – Nice to Have Skills
Experience using AWS Product suite
Python experience
MBA or Masters’ in Mathematics/Stats/Engineering disciplines preferred
Senior Data Analyst - Assignment Start Date
ASAP – 6 months to start
Senior Data Analyst - Assignment Location
Mississauga, ON – Work Remotely

Title: Digital Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Digital Marketing Data Analyst, Dieppe NB
When you see numbers on a page, does a story unfold before you?
When people around you have competing opinions, you let data decide.
Your data-driven insights and reports will help our team make better decisions. This will allow us to predict, optimize, execute, and measure the impact of our growth initiatives so we can champion 10x more consumers with every product, feature, and piece of content we create.
Who we are
Proudly based in Atlantic Canada, WeyMedia has become a leading expert in financial advice for Canadian and US consumers through our two core brands: HowToSaveMoney and creditcardGenius.
With 280,000 monthly readers, 38,000 email subscribers and more than 20,000 registered users, WeyMedia is looking for a proven business analyst to help fuel our growth.
Our mission? Make money easy and fun for everyone.
If you want in on that mission, then read on…
Who we need
We need an analytical and action-oriented Digital Marketing Data Analyst to work with our leadership team and liaise with our cross-functional teams.
You'll sharpen each decision we make with your data-driven research and reports.
You'll design an ever-evolving suite of experiments to drive company-wide changes.
You'll track results using leading edge analytics tools, spot emerging trends, and answer important questions in order to maximize opportunities and results.
You’ll collaborate with internal teams to provide insight and analysis and formulate data-driven solutions to support improved performance of company initiatives.
You’ll collect, analyze and interpret marketing and business data sets to gain quantitative insights that will enhance decision making in the organization.
You'll develop and improve a robust set of real-time dashboards using modern business intelligence tools so we'll always have our finger on the pulse of our organization.
You'll champion growth so each decision we make will impact as many consumers as possible.
You'll stay up to date with IT and industry advancements and share your knowledge with the team.
You’ll foster a culture of data-driven decision-making by leading analytics projects of varying sizes and complexity that incorporate best practices in data visualizations and story telling.
You'll support stretch projects and assist the team as needed.
You'll wear many different hats in a lean, agile, and fast-paced culture.
Who you are
You care about your work, you know your stuff, and you go the extra mile.
You're no ordinary analyst: you bathe yourself in data letting it speak to you until you've proven what's true without a shadow of a doubt.
You have a Bachelor's degree in Business, Data Analytics, or equivalent.
You have at least 4 years of progressive experience working with in-depth data.
You love numbers, spreadsheets, business intelligence tools, and Big Data doesn't scare you.
You can find anything online using advanced search features and unconventional keywords.
You love technology, live in the cloud, and can learn and adapt quickly.
You know HTML, CSS, WordPress, and maybe a little bit of coding.
You're a voracious reader, always hungry to learn.
You're a proud resident of Atlantic Canada (or willing to move here).
Tech we use
Always expanding our tech and data analysis stack, we make sure we're using the right tool for the job. You should be familiar with several of the following and similar technologies:
Google Analytics, Data Studio, G Suite, Search Console, Trends, and Optimize
Julia, Python, and their integrated stats packages
SEMRush, SERPStat, and Alexa
Social media ad platforms
Kibana, and Elasticsearch
What you'll get
We take care of our team. Here's a quick list of benefits you'll get working with us:
Competitive salary starting at $60K annually based on experience
Profit sharing
Health, dental, LTD, and life insurance
Vacation you're encouraged to use
The right tools & training
Make a real difference
Do interesting work
Team building fun
Regular team lunches
Healthy snacks
Mobile phone allowance
Let's talk
If you think this is you, say hello and send your resume.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: From $60,000.00 per year
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Work remotely:
Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Analyst, Meter Data Management
Description:
INDEPENDENT ELECTRICITY SYSTEM OPERATOR
Analyst, Meter Data Management
Location of Position: Mississaug a
The Analyst, Meter Data Management will report to the Supervisor, M eter Data Management
Job Summary:
The role is accountable for performing analyses and preparation of metering data for settlement of the IESO administered market, as well as various provincial electricity programs and policies, under the Market Rules and established service level agreements. This involves managing the meter data management processes relating to maintaining the metering database and supporting the metering registry. The responsibilities include processing/analyzing metering data (validation, estimation and editing), resolving meter trouble reports with external contractors, managing meter registration activities, monitoring contractor compliance, reconciling data and resolving issues with jurisdictional counterparts, supporting various audit activities, and providing technical and analytical support to both internal and external customers. The role also requires assisting in the development and maintenance of appropriate processes, systems, procedures and standards within the Meter Data Management department of the Settlement Division as related to maintaining the metering registry and the metering database.
General Accountabilities:
Register and de-register wholesale meters with the metering registry. Collect metering and operational data, test for completeness and accuracy, estimate and edit invalid data and adjust for site-specific losses and site-specific error corrections. Conduct the Meter Service Provider (MSP) trouble call resolution process Contribute to the development of new business processes, tools and training packages for MPs.
Key Responsibilities:
Receive notification of the provision of metering services from MPs and respond to associated queries and information requests. Maintain associated record systems and confirm with MPs on a timely basis.
Receive notification of MSP registration. During ongoing operations, monitor conformance to the obligations specified in the Market Rules and report non-conformance. Respond to queries and information requests from MSPs. Maintain associated record systems and confirm with the MSP.
Participate with MSPs in the end-to-end testing of new metering installations to verify access and quantities prior to placing in-service. Register all such metering installations with the metering database including set-up of metering points in IESO data management tools, updating tables and getting MP/MSP concurrence; verify the accuracy of the registration data that has been entered so as to avoid adverse impact on the MP, the MSP, and the IESO. Maintain an accurate polling list.
Administer the data collection schedule. Implement approved validation and estimating routines and checks, including the application of redundant or check metering data as well as estimating and replacing suspect data, where available. Accurately apply editing routines as defined by the Market Rules, loss adjustment routines, and physical allocation routines. Perform all such activities in accordance with the timelines defined in the Market Rules and to meet IESO obligations. Maintain the metering database and VEE log. Determine if retries are required to collect necessary meter data. Synchronize meter clock times.
Monitor equipment condition, self-diagnostic error messages, instrument transformer alarms, etc. and issue resulting trouble calls in accordance with the defined timelines and to meet IESO obligations. Progress the resolution of each trouble call, and monitor the associated response time. Check the status of the trouble call resolution to determine if alternate means of collecting data are required or if the details of a resolution need only to be obtained and recorded.
Perform periodic testing and verification of metering installations, including the overall reconciliation of metering installations and assisting in metering audits, in accordance with IESO obligations. Maintain a record of routine testing and notify the MPs and MSPs of non-conformance to the relevant Market Rules.
Process queries and Notice of Disagreements. Provide input to arbitration cases, depending on the requirements, complexity and/or resources available.
Contribute to the development of new business processes and training packages for MPs.
Perform other duties as required.
Competencies:
Good analytical and communications skills.
Strong interpersonal skills.
Ability to work with minimal supervision.
Ability to work in a team environment.
Deadline oriented individual.
Proven excellent customer service skills.
Demonstrated organizational skills.
A strong personal commitment to customer needs.
A strong commitment to meeting corporate objectives.
Education:
Requires knowledge of electrical principles, terminology, function, and interpretation of electrical measuring instruments.
Requires knowledge of data processing and computer processing operations to understand programming operations and the effects of program faults. Requires knowledge of mathematics and statistics to perform studies and calculations involving electrical load and energy measuring theories and formulae, and to select, analyze, and synthesize data.
This knowledge is considered to be normally acquired through the completion of Post-Secondary education or by having the equivalent.
Experience :
Requires familiarity with the various types of electricity measurement/ recording meters and their performance characteristics under various conditions.
Requires familiarity with the market rules and other technical data relating to settlement activities.
Requires experience in the management and maintenance of record systems.
Requires experience with various types of computer operation, computer data conversion, data processing and database operation, including manipulating data.
Requires experience in communicating with external parties on technical matters.
A period of over 4 years, up to and including 6 years, is considered necessary to gain this experience
What the IESO Offers:
Competitive market wages
Comprehensive benefit programs
Programs and policies to support a balanced lifestyle
A challenging fast-paced team environment
Opportunity to work with some of the brightest people in the industry
While we appreciate your submissions, we regret that we can only contact those candidates selected for interviews.
We thank all candidates for their interest in opportunities with the IESO. Be sure to follow us on LinkedIn .
The IESO is an equal opportunity employer.
Please note the successful candidate must be eligible to work in Canada and will be subject to a background check.

Title: Data Analytics & Business Insight Analyst
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

In support of Operational Excellence, the Data & Business Insights Analysts
will be responsible for interpreting cleansed, mined data into a consumable format for the business. They will leverage discovered patterns and insights into actionable intelligence that can be clearly communicated to all levels of the organization’s leadership structure to aid in the overall corporate strategy.

Reporting to the AVP, Business Intelligence & Data Analytics, this position will work with all business units across the FGL banner to provide analytical interpretation; analysis, presented recommendations and consultative services to assist with new initiatives, day to day business, or to solve pressing business problems. The Business Intelligence group will also work to provide ad-hoc data when that data is not accessible by the business.

What you’ll do
Support the business with a full analytical services offering. Including developing operational reporting and executive dashboards, providing analysis, conclusions and recommendations for the business
Support of any departmental analytical team with augmented analysis and consultation for their new initiatives, day to day business and problem solving
Present findings to all levels of the organization’s leadership in an understandable and compelling manner
Take an active role in understanding the each department’s activities and strategies to gain a deeper understanding of the business
Optimize tasks to increase efficiency and accuracy, include driving the design of automation for the business.
Champion the Data Science capabilities and service offerings within the organization
Support the business with ad-hoc data requests to help them answer questions or to satisfy audit requirements.
Who you are
We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment
Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business
Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business
Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward
If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

What you bring
5+ years of experience in a retail analytics or corporate retail environment.
Proficient with statistical methods and mathematical techniques including predictive modeling, regression, AB testing, cluster analysis, etc.
Ability to formulate or quickly understand business problems, find patterns and insights within structured and unstructured data.
Ability to clearly communicate results to technical and non-technical audiences.
Demonstrated experience in exploratory data analysis and data mining process of large, complex data sets (i.e. “Big Data”)
Comfort manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources
Hands-on experience using business intelligence and statistical analysis tools such as R, Cognos, Micro Strategy, etc.
Familiarity with relational databases and SQL
Have a good eye for and an understanding of visual report design principles
Ability to execute multiple projects and drive key business results under tight deadlines.
Self-starter attitude with willingness to learn and master new technologies
Ability to work independently and in an ambiguous environment


About Canadian Tire Corporation
Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies.

Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

Title: Data Design Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.
Job Description
Job Overview
The GWAM Chief Data Office in close partnership with key business stakeholders, GWAM Operations and will support the transformation of the organization to ensure data is leveraged as a strategic asset supporting our business goals. The group’s charter is as follows:
Manage the Investment Division Data Lake (IDDL) as the single, central source for data which is easy to access and describes how the data was obtained
Monitor IDDL Data quality continually monitored and accuracy improved
Ensure Common standards for IDDL Data
Enable flexible reporting tools to access data in the IDDL, adapting to changing business or regulatory requirements
Reporting to the AVP, Data Design and Investment Division Data Lake (IDDL) Business Support, the Data Analyst, Data Design will be a key member of a team of data professionals responsible for establishing the data quality program for Manulife GWAM. They will couple their data analysis experience with a solid understanding of the Investment Division’s business and operations to implement the data strategy.
Key Responsibilities:
You will work with Global Wealth Asset Management Operational Business &Technical Support teams, GWAM Reporting Teams and the GWAM Chief Data Office to support the Investment Division Data Lake [IDDL] Daily Production activities to ensure data is available, reliable, consistent, accessible, secure, and timely through daily Data Issue Identification, Analysis and Action Planning
You will partner with the GWAM Chief Data Office Data Governance and Data Analytics, support on-going IDDL process improvements, including enhancements to GWAM Operational Capabilities, GWAM Data Quality Monitoring and Controls and GWAM Meta Data Management Tools such as the Business Glossary and Data Lineage
Working with GWAM Operational teams, support IDDL Design and Development for GWAM Strategic Initiatives
Education, Experience & Skills:
Highly analytical with strong consulting and problem-solving abilities; tenacity to identify the root cause of problems and utilize innovative approaches to solve business data problems
Strong service orientation
Take personal accountability for issue analysis and resolution
Asset management or financial services industry experience
Previous experience in the management of large, firm-wide processes
Strong communication skills
Constructive challenge and influencing skills
Experience in translating between business and technology worlds
Champion of change and effectively managing the implementation of new ideas / improvements
Confident when dealing with investment professionals, senior management and other stakeholders
Knowledge and experience with asset management systems and platforms such as trading/order management, portfolio accounting, client reporting, performance analytics and master data management
Technical Skills, such as knowledge, of SQL required to perform data analysis
What about Perks?
Manulife has lots of perks including, but not limited to:
Competitive compensation
Retirement Savings Accounts including a RPP (Pension Plan), RRSP (Retirement Savings Plan), and TFSA (Tax Free Savings account)
Manulife Share Ownership Program with employer matching
Customizable Benefits Package including Health, Dental, Vision, and 100% of Mental Health expenses
Financial support for ongoing training, learning, and education
Monthly Innovation Days (Hackathons)
Wearing jeans to work every day
An abundance of career paths and opportunities to advance
A flexible work environment with flex hours, work from home arrangements, distributed teams, and condensed work week arrangements.
This is a full-time permanent role located in Toronto, Ontario. Successful candidates may be considered for our Boston, MA location as well.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

If you are ready to unleash your potential it’s time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.
About Manulife
Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2019, we had more than 35,000 employees, over 98,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving almost 30 million customers. As of June 30, 2020, we had $1.2 trillion (US$0.9 trillion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $30.6 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.
Manulife is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention and advancement and we administer all of our practices and programs based on qualification and performance and without discrimination on any protected ground.
It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request any accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
WHO WE ARE:
Canadians spend over $70B annually on their homes - whether it’s major renovations, or small repairs and maintenance work. This journey often starts by finding the right contractor. HomeStars is the leading platform in Canada, helping homeowners with their home renovation needs by allowing them to search our database of companies and hundreds of thousands of reviews.
Every month over half a million homeowners visit HomeStars to research and connect with the best rated home professionals near them. Home Professionals advertise on HomeStars to tell their story, and grow their business with highly qualified connections. HomeStars has recently been acquired by ANGI Homeservices Inc., the #1 marketplace in the US for helping homeowners connect with the best home service providers.

WHY JOIN US:
HomeStars is looking to continue to build a positive, winning culture and that starts with hiring great people like you! If you are looking to work or be a part of an organization with an exceptional environment, we want to hear from you!
HomeStars embraces and celebrates the uniqueness within our work community. We believe our greatest ideas come from a diverse mix of mindsets, backgrounds, and experiences. The HomeStars organization is committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment where all of our employees feel welcome, comfortable, and have the opportunity to thrive.

Perks of working at HomeStars:
We are growing fast. HomeStars is part of the ANGI Homeservices Inc. family which is public and includes top home service brands like Home Advisor and Angie’s List.
Excellent Benefits Package. We want a healthy and productive team.
Company wide social events and team building activities.
December Break. The office is closed the week before New Year’s.
Personal Growth. We seek to provide employees with constructive feedback to foster their career growth.
Beautiful brick & beam office in the heart of the entertainment district in Toronto.
Rec room with lounge, ping pong, darts and foosball.


ABOUT THE ROLE:
You seek to intimately understand our business, product, and customer and be able to translate that into actionable reporting and insights from data to unlock others to make critical decisions.
You enable our Product team to measure the impact of what we ship, and uncover actionable insights from our data to help product teams deliver even better products in the future.
You work hand-in-hand with Product Managers and other stakeholders through planning, execution and delivery of new features to develop a set engagement key performance indicators and ensure we’re able to understand those KPIs as soon as we launch
You work closely with developers to make sure we’re collecting and storing the information that will let us track and measure those key performance indicators, and you leverage modern data and analytics tools to develop dashboards and conduct case studies that effectively tell the story of our data.
With your help, Homestars’ business and customers will use data and analytics to drive more informed decisions.

OPPORTUNITY:
Understand the data that drives our product success, and deliver curated dashboards & reports that help our team deeply understand our Product
Build-out analytics reporting across our existing products & features to surface insights about our key performance indicators and identify opportunities for improvement
Partner with Product Managers to ensure we have well defined KPIs and reporting for new products and features before we launch them, so we can generate and respond to insights in market quickly
Work with our Engineering team to ensure we have the right instrumentation and data structure to answer our most pressing questions
Proactively make recommendations based on the insights you uncover from new product features, changes in user experience, or your own exploration and curiosity
Focus on the highest priority questions and ensure that your deliverables are easily digestible, visually appealing, and can effectively tell the story of our data
Provide guidance on what type of data and analytics support is required, whether it be building a set of dashboards, conducting a case study, or a combination of both
Requirements
Proven working experience as a data analyst or business analyst, with specialization in data visualization or dashboard development - a focus on product analytics a plus
Hands-on-keyboard experience with modern data visualization platforms (Tableau, Google Data Studio, Looker, etc...) and databases (MySQL, Google BigQuery, etc...)
Ability to work with data engineers to ensure we process the right data, and structure it in a way that enables you to build dashboards & reporting that help our product team deeply understand our product through data
Well-versed writing SQL queries to curate data sets and quickly respond to ad-hoc inquiries from the a variety of stakeholders
Able to design experiments, measurement plans, dashboards, and case studies that enable us to make decisions backed by data and analytics
Able to communicate insights from your findings, not just relay the data itself. You champion your findings, document your insights and share this across the company
Education in business, economics, mathematics, computer science or a mix of relevant work experience in the field of data and analytics
Benefits
We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate based upon race, religion, colour, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Title: Data Governance Analyst
Description:
Our multinational pharmaceutical client is looking for a Regulatory Data Governance (DG) Data Analyst to join the team. He/She will be responsible for driving Data Governance Requests to completion for changes to Regulatory data, formats, standards, and controlled vocabularies within Regulatory systems including full impact analysis of changes including impact on related systems and projects.
This is a 1 year full-time contract opportunity with a potential for extension, located in North York, ON.
Responsibilities
Coordinates with Data Owners, System Owners, vendors, ITS, and Data Governance teams to investigate and analyze the request, impacts, and related issues.
Prepare analysis for Data Owners, & works together to resolve DG Request. Data Steward either implements the change directly or coordinates with ITS to implement. Monitors regulatory & industry standards for changes.
Enforces and Supports DG processes & works to ensure DG Requests are resolved, and the details are fully documented in the DG request tracker and other reference documentation.
Works to ensure quality, compliance, and operational efficiency.
Supports system integrations with Regulatory systems, including providing mapping of data and terminologies between systems and resolution of data-related issues between systems.
Governs the data business rules, objects and fields, formats, definitions, and dictionaries, picklists, controlled vocabularies.
Promotes data literacy and understanding of our data, definitions, and standards with Data Owners, Regulatory Affairs, and other organizations.
Governs and supports business data models, data flow, and data lineage mapping for Regulatory data.
Investigates industry and regulatory standards & requirements related to data formats and controlled vocabularies.
Works to ensure Regulatory data formats & dictionaries stay current and compliant.
Maintains Regulatory Information Management (RIM) dictionaries in the system.
Documents DG recommendations and decisions for DG Requests, and maintains DG documentation.
Maintains and prepares documentation of RIM dictionary content.
Authors, maintains and reviews Data Governance Job Aides describing detailed Data Steward activities.
Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Science (BSc.), Pharmaceutical Regulatory Affairs
3-5 years' experience in an analyst role/function
Pharmaceutical Regulatory Affairs
Experience with Pharmaceutical Regulatory Data and standards preferred
Background in Pharmaceutical Regulatory Affairs and Quality Operations
Excellent documentation and communication skills are critical
High attention to detail
Good presentation skills
Experience and understanding of the importance of data quality
Self-driven, conscientious, and able to work within a collaborative work environment
Familiarity with ITS service/ticket systems
Job Type: Contract
Work remotely:
Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Energy Analyst I or II (Data Focus)
Description:
Position Title: Energy Analyst I or II (Data Focus)
Start Date: Nov 19th, 2020
Wage: varies based on level experience demonstrated
Duration: 40 hrs per week
Location: Calgary (will consider Vancouver, Edmonton, Toronto, or Montreal)
If you have a good understanding of building sciences or experience working in trades as well as possess a passion for sustainability and wanting to make a mark on the way Canadian businesses operate, you will likely be a good fit with our team. The SPG team focuses on energy assessments, implementation of energy efficiency technologies, and corporate sustainability planning; your role on our team will be working with our Energy Team to assess and apply new technologies and principals to buildings that will directly impact how Canadian companies operate.
The Energy Analyst I or II will work directly under the supervision of the Energy Team Manager and assist in all tasks associated with identifying and executing energy efficiency projects. A focus will be placed on lighting, HVAC, control systems, water efficiency and solar projects. This position will be based primarily in the office and will focus on the energy analysis, energy modelling, benchmarking, carbon emissions calculations, and report generation from the energy audit findings.
The ideal candidate will have up to 2 years of direct educational or work experience in energy auditing, energy management, engineering, or building operating. However, other highly technical individuals who can prove a high aptitude in organization as well as interest in sustainability projects may be considered.
Beyond the technical aspects of the job, the candidate will be given training on energy efficiency and sustainability concepts, technical report writing, managing client relationships and interviews, and managing relationships with vendors and contractors. SPG provides in-house training for industry specific knowledge and will host leadership training through a curriculum given by a private provider.
Responsibilities
Complete the utility analysis, building energy model, energy performance metrics, and generate a report from the data collected from ASHRAE Level Audits
Evaluate building drawings, schematics, schedules, and shop drawings to support building energy modelling and project design stages in the energy auditing process
Utilize and provide system improvements to digital energy and lighting assessment tools to identify energy efficiency projects and complete energy models through eQuest and CANQUEST modelling software
Calculating energy reduction and carbon emission reductions, complete energy benchmarking using Energy Star Portfolio Manager
Assist in the design of energy production projects (geothermal, solar thermal, solar photovoltaic, etc.) by determining system specifications and quantifying energy consumption and savings
Assist in the identification of energy efficiency projects and create proposals which include scope of work, technologies used, annual energy or water savings, carbon emission reductions, and project life
Required Skills
Exceptional attention to detail is a must
Excellent organizational skills and a remarkable ability to demonstrate focus
A very quick learner and highly motivated to actively seek out answers to questions
Flexible problem solver and creative in their approach to completing a task
Proven ability to work independently; though oversight will be provided, and you will be working in a team environment, the current state of the environment may require a temporary remote work setup
Several of the positions being hired with this title are partially funded through ECO Canada's Digital Skills for Youth program. If you meet the following criteria, please highlight this on your application:
- must be Canadian citizen, permanent residents, or persons who have been granted refugee status in Canada
- must be unemployed, under-employed, or hold part-time employment
- must be between the ages of 15-30 years old
As we are receiving an in-ordinary amount of applications, please provide specific examples that demonstrate how your personality, experiences, and abilities meet the requirements outlined in this application. Point-form and concise applications are much appreciated.

Title: Associate Information Analyst, Data Management & Stewardship...
Description:
Associate Information Analyst, Data Management & Stewardship (Permanent/Contract)-0002X8
Description

Export Development Canada (EDC) is Canada’s export credit agency, offering information, knowledge and innovative commercial solutions to help Canadian exporters and investors expand their international business. We take on risk so Canadian businesses can take on the world.

When you join our team, you’ll be helping Canadian companies bring their vision, passion and innovation to the global marketplace. Your knowledge and expertise will support more than 13,000 Canadian companies and their customers in as many as 200 markets worldwide. You’ll work shoulder-to-shoulder with the best and brightest in an inclusive, collaborative environment that fosters professional development and success. And you’ll know that you’re making a difference every day—for companies, for Canada and for the people you work with.

Year after year, EDC has been recognized as a Top 100 and Top Family-Friendly Employee.

Team & Job Overview

The Data Management and Stewardship (DMS) team is looking for motivated team players to join its growing team. The DMS team is responsible for the governance of information on all companies that are relevant to EDC’s business as well as the people who are associated with those companies. DMS Associate Information Analysts (level 1 or level 2) are responsible for company and individual records from the time that they are created through to the end of their lifecycle.

Discipline Summary
Provides timely delivery of information services;
Develops and manages information policies, practices and procedures;
Conducts research, analysis, diagnostics and provides recommendations with respect to information issues and practices;
Determines the need for and provides the required information/data to the requester;
Ensures the functionality, security, availability and accuracy of the information provided to end users of information.
Key Responsibilities
Responds to inquiries for information services and responds or redirects as appropriate;
Provides training for internal users of information;
Researches acceptable sources to identify and capture correct company and individual information (legal name, address etc.);
Ensures the proper linking of related companies and their principles and owners;
Participates in information management projects;
Identifies and resolves information issues;
Identifies root causes and brings forward solutions to resolve data quality issues.
Qualifications
Screening Criteria
Completed an Undergraduate degree in Business Administration, Library and Information Science, Information Management or in a related field
Minimum 1 year (level 1) or 3 years (level 2) of experience in information management or related experience
Basic knowledge of information/knowledge management principles and practices
Asset
Bilingual in both official languages (French and English)
Salary Range*
$45,700 - $68,500 (for permanent position only: plus performance-based incentive)
$53,400 - $80,200 (for permanent position only: plus performance-based incentive)
We will consider candidates at the different levels below depending on the incumbent's qualifications.

Location
Please be advised that this position is based at our Head Office in Ottawa. Relocation assistance is available for eligible candidates.
How to apply

Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Application deadline: Friday, November 13, 2020 11:59 p.m. EST on www.edc.ca/careers

EDC is committed to employment equity and actively encourages applications from women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and visible minorities. If selected for an interview, please advise us if you require special accommodation.

Candidates must meet the requisite government security screening requirements.

Primary Location: Canada-Ottawa
Schedule: Full-time
Job Type: Permanent

Title: Data Analyst, Security - 297742
Description:
Data Analyst, Security Procom KW is seeking a Data Scientist with strong Security Analytics experience for a contract role with one of our global clients in the financial services sector.
Data Analyst, Security Job Details
The data scientist will help discover the information hidden in vast amounts of network and security log data, and help the client improve monitoring and control of advanced cyber threats and implement User and Behaviour Analytics (UEBA) solutions.

The primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building high quality prediction systems integrated with our products on AWS.

Success for this role will be achieved by identifying previously undiscovered intrusions or by improving the organization’s security posture or the measurement thereof. The goal is to create new strategic and tactical value from security-relevant data through the dedicated exploration, analysis and investigation of that data using leading edge analytic technologies and techniques.

Data Analyst, Security Responsibilities
Cyber security use case requirement gathering, perform large-scale data analysis and develop effective statistical and machine learning models for improving Cybersecurity at Sun Life
• Extending company’s data with third party sources of information when needed
• Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems
• Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
• Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner
• Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance
• Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques
• Data mining using state-of-the-art methods
Data Analyst, Security Must Have Skills
Bachelor’s Degree in a highly quantitative field (Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Statistics, Mathematics) and 3+ years’ experience in data science and predictive modeling OR Phd/MTech/MS in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning, Mathematics or Statistics and 1+ years’ experience in data science and predictive modeling
• Experience using Python and/or R
• Previous experience in a ML or data scientist role and a track record of building ML or DL models
• Experience with Tableau Desktop
Data Analyst, Security Nice To Have Skills
Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
• Experience with Data Visualization and Reporting tools (Tableau Desktop, Power BI)
• Experience with machine learning or statistical libraries: SparkML, scikitlearn, caret, mlr, MLlib
• Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
• Effective communication and strong collaboration skills
• Commercial security solutions such as web application firewalls, IDS/IPS, SIEM, DLP, DDOS mitigation
• Implementation experience with enterprise security solutions such as WAF, IPS, Anti-DDOS, and SIEM
Data Analyst, Security Start Date
Immediate

Data Analyst, Security Assignment Length
6 month initial contract, likely extension beyond

Title: Analyst, Data Management - Contract
Description:
Are you looking to further your career with an industry leading, global children's entertainment company?

At Spin Master, our unwavering commitment to open mindedness, integrity and innovation is a great part of what has made us an industry leader. How do we stay ahead of the pack? By hiring the best and brightest minds—and that’s why we want you!

What's it like to work here?
Spin Master is a fast-paced, hands-on organization that provides many great opportunities for impactful decision-making; we are building a legacy and welcome individuals with a proven track record of driving results.
Job Description:
Working as a member of the IT Business Office within the Global Office of Information Technology for Spin Master Ltd, the Data Management Analyst will have responsibility for ensuring and maintaining the quality of information in SAP as part of a global initiative to create an accurate master data source.
This individual will join an enthusiastic, fast-paced and dynamic team at Spin Master. Sustained exceptional performance, innovation, creativity, insight, good judgment and attention to detail are daily requirements. Please note: this is a 3 month contract.

What we can expect from you:
Manage daily requests for new data creation, raise questions or concerns with the business units, log issues with the data provider, confirm issue resolution.
Perform data quality scans on various master files.
Provide recommendations for improving maintenance processes.
Manage production support tickets for business critical issues.
Raise issues identified within the global master files to business units for
resolution.
Work with SAP functional experts to review findings of new data requirements for resolution and/or documentation in business requirements.
Monitor and prioritize ticket queue to ensure requests are resolved in timely and efficient manner.
Supporting the end to end lifecycle of a material, from concept to dropped.
Provide data management support to business units for new and ongoing projects.
Perform mass maintenance to cleanse data in the material master.
Actively work with cross functional business units to ensure data standards are follows, and assist with policy inquiries.
Shared responsibility for Data Governance inbox management.
Who's a good fit for this role:
Fundamental knowledge of SAP Material Management.
Experience with the Product Development life cycle.
Passion for technology, and implementing technology for process improvement.
Quality orientated, takes pride in their work.
An ability to quickly grasp new subject matter
Strong interpersonal and organizational skills
Flexibility, energy and ability to work well with others in a team environment
You should apply if you have the following:
Experience with SAP or similar ERP system
Proficient in Excel
Experience in Toy Industry an asset in any of the following areas: customer service, marketing or sales support, operations, finance
What you can expect from us:

Our mission is to Make Life More Fun with a vision to push the boundaries of innovation, creativity, and fun. From top leadership to new and veteran team members alike, everyone at Spin Master embodies our Core Values:
Integrity
Open Mindset
Innovation
Partnerships
Collaboration
Driving Results
Entrepreneurship
Follow us on Instagram and Twitter @SpinCareers to stay up to date on Spin Master career opportunities.

Title: Data Analyst (HR Systems)
Description:

Our client uses Peoplesoft as their HRIS so experience with this system is highly valued. The ideal candidate will have experience running Peoplesoft queries as well.

Technology doesn't change the world. People do.

As a technology staffing firm, we can't think of a more fitting mantra. We're extreme believers in technology and the incredible things it can do. But we know that behind every smart piece of software, every powerful processor, and every brilliant line of code is an even more brilliant person.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (20-022)
* Full-time Contract (35 Hours/week)
If you want to work with a community leader in mental health and addictions services, then come work with us! As a recovery-oriented and people focused organization, we utilize evidence-based and best practices, through a psychosocial rehabilitation approach. We are proud of our positive and fair work-place culture, where staff have opportunities for learning and development. We are looking for motivated team players with a desire to make a difference!
RESPONSIBILITY:
Reporting to the Program Coordinator, duties will include but are not limited to analyzing and compiling data from a variety of sources into meaningful information and reports to support informed, evidence-based, operational and strategic decisions. The data analyst will work collaboratively with the Coordinator to support the electronic records management, accreditation requirements and continuous quality improvement initiatives of the organization.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Education requirements:
Completion of a degree, preferably in health, business, information management or quality improvement.
Language requirements:
Fluency in English is essential. Fluency in French is an asset.
Priority will be given to candidates who are bilingual in French and English as per our French Language Service Plan.
Experience Requirements:
Minimum of 1 year related experience in the provision of decision support in a community service or health care organization.
Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office and Excel is required, and experience with additional statistical analysis software is preferred. Experience with Microsoft Power BI would be considered an asset.
Well-developed abilities in data management, analysis and report generation.
Well-developed interpersonal and communication skills
Demonstrated understanding of the quality improvement, program evaluation or Lean methodologies would be considered an asset
Demonstrated understanding of community-based mental health services
Demonstrated ability to function as a team member, as well as independently as needed
Excellent organizational and project management skills
Ability to perform effectively in a fast-paced environment with multiple and competing demands

All employees are eligible to participate in the Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan (HOOPP), a defined benefit pension plan. We offer a comprehensive group benefit plan.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us :

Established over 30 years ago, Medcan is a global leader in assessing clients' overall well-being and inspiring them to live well. Medcan has a comprehensive range of diagnostic assessments, which, in combination with innovative programs tailored to specific needs, are designed to successfully reach improved health outcomes.
Over 80 physicians and specialists, alongside a broad roster of complementary health care disciplines, provide health and lifestyle management services on site and by video consult for individuals, families and organizations. Our team of 550 staff see clients physically and virtually from our downtown Toronto location.
The Role
The Data Analyst is accountable for supporting Medcan’s data cleansing and data migration efforts. The key outcome is to have reliable data and data integrity to apply to our new infrastructure and systems.
The candidate will play a key role in supporting the development of the newly redesigned data architecture, data validation, ensuring the appropriate data points are available for reporting, and supporting the development team in readying data for system loads.
The Accountabilities
Entering data into system [Salesforce] based off revised data model and new business requests in an accurate and timely manner
Identify and support fixes to structural errors, data parsing, transformation, and duplicate elimination
Entering customer and account data from source documents – referencing legacy systems and new systems for validation and verification as well as identifying areas of missing data
Compiling data, verifying accuracy and sorting information to prepare source data for entry
Ability to validate/ challenge data model and requests. Ability to have conversations focused on verification with key business stakeholders
Support additional data auditing and workflow specifications associated to data integrity
Assist in other data entry, data-cleansing duties as required and requested
Connect and collaborate with Analytics team to ensure data sources for reporting requirements available and accurate
Keep information confidential. Comply with data integrity and security policies
The Requirements
1+ years’ experience as a Data Analyst, Business Analyst, or similar role
Ability to QA data (post-processing and additional cleansing processes), fix structural errors and data integrity issues.
Strong attention to detail
Ability to work in fast-paced environment and on project with tight delivery windows
Well versed in Microsoft Excel and data programs, experience using Salesforce is a plus
Ability to learn new systems quickly
Self-sufficient individual with the ability to work well in cross-functional teams
This is a short-term full-time contract opportunity. Preference will be given to those able to start immediately.
In your cover letter please include why you wish to align yourself with Medcan and how you believe you can add value to our organization.
We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for an initial interview will be contacted. No phone calls and no agencies please.

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Data Science Analyst,Customer Analytics/CRM
Description:
Location:
1 Presidents Choice Circle, Brampton, Ontario, L6Y 5S5
The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.
Why is this role important?
The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.
Why is this role important?
Are you at the top of your game? Bring your expertise and knowledge to Canada’s largest retailer. We are looking for smart, curious, and nice people to help bring our Data, Insights & Analytics game to the next level. This is an exciting time to join our team – we are changing the game in a big way!
If you are looking to join a company that offers unlimited opportunity, excellent leadership, world-class training and makes a big impact on the community – this is the role you’ve been waiting for!
The Data, Insights & Analytics team at Loblaw is hiring an Data Science Analyst. Reporting to the Senior Data Scientist, Data, Insights & Analytics, the incumbent will use advanced techniques in obtaining and analyzing data to drive insights and develop analytic capabilities to support business objectives in a time-efficient manner. This role will have the opportunity to support various unique projects and enterprise-wide transformational analytical initiatives.
What You'll Do:
Be end-to-end responsible for multiple Data Science projects. Deploy/Automate Predictive/Optimization models or workloads; be responsible for project pipelines/model documentation and maintenance.
Responsible for the extraction and analysis of complex information from a variety of databases as well as gathering unstructured data through web-scraping and other sources.
Translating learnings from the Decision Insights team’s data sciences initiatives into standardized data science product prototypes. Data science initiatives can be strategic in nature or of a tactical focus, including but not limited to customer genome/customer attributes building, consumer path analytics, product associations and recommendations, marketing campaigns, consumer based predictive models etc.
Analyze data to help determine insights to solve business problems; simplify and optimize the decision-making process through data products development and automation.
Research, develop and scale our data-driven systems particularly on customer-centric ML models and attributes.
Design and build interactive and static data visualizations to provide insights and enable strategic business decisions
Act as gatekeeper with regards to security and confidentiality of data obtained through all sources . Strictly adhere to legal and compliance guidelines; regarding access and exposure to sensitive and confidential information
What You'll Bring:
BS (2+ years of industry experience)/MS in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or other relevant fields.
Programming skills with SQL, Python, PySpark/Scala.
Strong knowledge with applied understanding of statistical modelling, machine learning and data mining.
Expertise in software engineering at scale, along with proficiency in using industry-standard development tools such as Git.
Software/data engineering or analytics experience with a focus on algorithm implementation, code deployment and productionization is preferred.
Experience with deep learning is an asset.
Knowledge of NLP is an asset.
Knowledge of data management practices and standards.
Understanding of Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Azure Data Engineering Stack, and other big data tools/technologies (HDFS, HBase, Spark, Kafka).
Experience with Teradata, Databricks and Google Cloud platform is an asset.
Retail analytics experience with a marketing focus is an asset.
Ability to take initiative, be responsible, accountable and multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment.
Strong detail orientation is essential in this role.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
A team player, self-starter, dynamic problem solver and data science enthusiast.
What You Can Expect:
We are a team of diverse and ambitious analysts, who cultivate a friendly and inclusive work environment where you can be yourself. Our employees’ development is at the core of our business, offering endless possibilities for growth, learning and mobility. Let us help grow your skills through one of our many resources including the Loblaw Virtual Learning Centre, where you have access to hundreds of learning tools, or through casual coffee chats with our leaders who were once in your shoes.
Other perks of joining Loblaw:
Competitive compensation and benefits package
Office with incredible amenities including an on-site gym, volleyball court and basketball court (turned ice rink in the winter!) with flexibility to work elsewhere
A flexible work environment which values balance
Colleague Discount Program
Tuition reimbursement Program
Employee Share Ownership plan
Pension Plan
If the above sounds like a great fit, then we would love to hear from you! Apply today, and get the process started. If you meet the above requirements, expect a call from one of our recruiters, followed by an in-person interview. Our recruitment process will allow you to meet and interact with colleagues at various levels of our business to give you a great perspective of life at Loblaw.

We thank all candidates for their interest but please note, those candidates who meet the minimum requirements for the position will be contacted.
How You’ll Succeed:
At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.
If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.
In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a passionate Data Analyst to turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.
You will conduct full life cycle activities to include requirements analysis and design, develop analysis and reporting capabilities, and continuously monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements. Day-to-day responsibilities will include:
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and “clean” data, and review computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities


Required Skills
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (databases, programming, etc.)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
Advanced Tableau skills


Required Experience
5+ years of experience as a data analyst
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing large data sets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc.)
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics
Apply today to join our dynamic team! CTDI offers an excellent compensation and benefits package and has been a growing leader in the telecommunications field for over 40 years. Come put our successful history behind your career!
EOE, Gender/Minority/Veterans/Disabled

Title: Senior Statistical Data Analyst

Reporting to the Program Manager, Data Services, is responsible for leading statistical data and research projects and supporting the Commissioner, Director and Community and Health Services Department program staff on data related initiatives; providing analysis and application of statistical data to Community and Health Services Department programs and services including compiling, analysing, interpreting and presenting statistical data; writing Departmental reports; and designing and developing complex spreadsheet and database applications.
Qualifications
Successful completion of a University Degree in Social Sciences or related field or approved equivalent combination of education and experience.
Minimum five (5) years experience in statistical data analysis including survey development, data analysis, visualization and interpretation, project management, database design or report writing.

Title: Data Analyst, Foundry
Description:
Reporting to the Research Manager, Foundry and providing support to the Evaluation Lead, Foundry, the Data Analyst works as part of a team, collaborating and providing support for research and evaluation for Foundry – a provincial initiative with the goal of providing youth and young adults with enhanced access to integrated services, thereby easing transition points for youth and their families. The Data Analyst will work in close collaboration with Foundry Central Office evaluators and researchers in the development, management and analysis of various datasets. The Data Analyst summarizes and collects data from multiple databases to develop and deliver datasets and analytical outputs; including understanding the project requirements, validating variables for errors and missing data, ensuring the integrity of data and writing codes and complex statistical macros to merge/ link data. This position will evaluate the data process, liaise with researchers, evaluators, and stakeholders, and make changes to the process and delivery of data as required.
Skills
Demonstrated high proficiency with SAS, R, Stata, and SPSS software.

Demonstrated ability to work with relational databases, large data sets and multiple data sources.

Demonstrated ability to work with large data sets and extrapolate conclusions from large data sets.

Demonstrated ability working with information systems and data files, including large and complex files: analysing file structure, transforming raw data into finished products.

Knowledge of data administration and management functions (collection, analysis, distribution etc.), with attention to security and confidentiality.

Knowledge of modern database and information system technologies.

Ability to validate and audit data.

Demonstrated proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Access, Power Point, Word etc.).

Demonstrated ability to work both independently, and collaboratively within a team environment.

Ability to self-motivate, with managerial, leadership and project management skills.

Excellent oral and written communication, organizational, multi-tasking and problem solving skills.

Ability to apply decision making, analytical and problem-solving skills.

Ability to prioritize, plan, coordinate, and organize work under pressure and meet deadlines.
Education
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Epidemiology, Mathematics, Medical Health Information or an equivalent combination of education training and experience.

Undergraduate or graduate coursework in statistics, data analysis or research methods.

Three (3) to five (5) years’ recent related experience providing data management and analysis support , including supervising and managing large complex datasets.

Experience handling sensitive and confidential information, including client information, in a trusted and responsible manner, in adherence with organizational standards and relevant privacy legislation.

Experience working with population level data sets such as health (and/or other) administrative data sets considered an asset.
Duties
Prepares reduced datasets specific to the project by understanding project requirements, needs and restrictions, ensuring data is clean and accurate. Collects variables from multiple databases to create datasets.

Codes and develops relevant statistical macros (SAS, SPSS, Stata) to merge data and provide linkages from a variety of databases/ data sources.

Develops complex statistical macros and scripts, datasets and reports for internal stakeholders.

Evaluates data quality, applications, and functions, makes changes to the output process when necessary.

Contributes to the development of new datasets. Evaluates process and provides improvement in data delivery and presentation.

Engages with relevant staff members and stakeholders during the evaluation and research processes, to determine their data needs and advise on data structure, restriction and creation of the novel variables.

Works closely with data stewards and researchers/evaluators to understand data definitions and standards in order to support the development of accurate data access requests, data linkage processes, and the extraction of appropriate data for the defined analysis plan.

Monitors records in various databases. Reviews data by performing data validation, looking for missing variables, errors, communicates with relevant staff members/researchers and updates existing datasets as required. Confirms integrity of data before presenting findings.

Follows privacy and research ethics protocols (where applicable), maintaining confidentiality.

Ensures that the development and execution of data analysis plans comply with organizational standards and best practices, including any relevant data governance policies or agreements such as information sharing agreements.

Performs other related duties as required.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst Intern
Description:
The Edmonton Public Library (EPL) is pleased to be a part of the Computers for Schools Plus Intern Program which is funded by the Government of Canada. Computers for Success Canada (CFSC-OPEC) is supporting opportunities for individuals to engage with their community while developing valuable work experience and skills needed to actively participate in a digital economy.

What we're looking for:

Are you a Data Detective? EPL is looking for a creative marketing data analyst to join our team! This is an exciting intern opportunity for a recent post-secondary graduate who is passionate about using real-life data, finding ways to automate reporting using the latest analytic tools, and evaluating processes to find efficiencies for ongoing reporting. If you love working with various reporting tools, like to identify trends, inform change, and give analytical guidance with those you work with, this job is for you!

Under the direction of the Manager, Marketing and Communications and Manager, Research and Assessment, you will help to develop, plan, implement and deliver analytics in a new way. Working with EPL staff, you will explore ways to automate data wrangling and cleaning from diverse data sources, look for ways to enhance and efficiently deliver data analysis to quickly identify insights and trends, and compile statistical reports. The successful candidate is technical and detailed-oriented, and will be responsible for marketing campaign analytics. You will assist stakeholders to better understand data by delving deeper into it, conducting research to find more robust reporting tools, and continually striving to improve processes to make workflows run as efficiently as possible.
Job Requirements:
Recent graduate with a related degree (e.g. statistics, mathematics, computer science related field) including coursework in research methodology and data analysis from a recognized post-secondary institution.
Experience in qualitative/quantitative data analysis and assessment, and performance measurement.
Experience utilizing a range of qualitative and quantitative research methods, designing research projects, and reporting results is preferred.
Computers for Success Canada (CFSC-OPEC) and the Computers for Schools Plus Intern Program requires that the successful candidate meet the following criteria:
Be between 15 and 30 (inclusive) years of age at the start of the internship.
Be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident or person who has been granted refugee status in Canada.
Be legally entitled to work in Canada.
Must not be in receipt of other employment benefits (EI) during the internship.
This program is funded by the Government of Canada. EPL is committed to building a skilled, diverse workforce that is reflective of our community. We would like to give applicants an opportunity to voluntarily indicate if they identify as: Indigenous, visible minority (including Black and People of Colour) or persons with a disability when applying for an intern position.

What do you need to bring to this position?
Customer service orientation.
Ability to effectively communicate information and statistics to diverse internal audiences, both verbally and in writing.
Strong attention to detail.
Advanced skills in data collection, data analysis, and data interpretation and visualization by using tools such as Python, R, Excel, Microsoft Power BI, Java Script, Google Analytics, etc.
Ability to effectively apply data wrangling and cleansing techniques to varied data types and sources to derive useful business information.
Superior skills with web-based technologies and demonstrated aptitude with information and communication technologies in general.
Demonstrated problem-solving ability, including the ability to evaluate, assess and problem-solve using logical, fact-based reasoning even when information is difficult to obtain, complex or ambiguous.
Ability to contribute positively and work effectively within a team environment.
Ability to access live reporting to easily identify market trends and meet customer demands and measure performance of campaigns while in market whenever possible.
Project management skills (e.g. research and implement new tools to support our promotional projects.
A commitment to uphold the Canadian Federation of Library Associations position statements on Intellectual Freedom and Diversity and Inclusion.
Who we are:
The secret ingredient for making EPL a magical place is no secret at all; in fact, it's very simple: We share. We share stories, ideas and experiences. We share with our customers, our communities, and ourselves. We are Edmonton's largest lender of all manner of information and entertainment.

Hours of Work: 35 hours per week.

Pay Band: $24.85 - $31.72 per hour*
Approximately $45,400 - $57,952 per annum based on a 35 hour work week.
