Title: Data Analyst, Business Analytics (BI)
Description:
Picture the early nineties where everything that was done on a computer was new, unheard of, revolutionary even. Technological advancements went by leaps and bounds, and everyone scrambled to get their share of this exciting new market. It was during that very exhilarating time that Tangerine Software came to be and was built from the ground up as one of the best (ERP) Solutions providers around. We even collaborated to give life to an incredible BI solution called Nectari. Since then, Tangerine and Nectari have continued to grow, reaching International Software and Technology markets. We walk side-by-side with each of our business partners, solution resellers, and of course teams, as we collaborate in continue moving towards unprecedented levels of success, and this, worldwide.
We did this by maintaining a warm familial environment, while always staying at the forefront of the industry, growing the team to nearly 80 astounding individuals. Each with their own unique set of skills and talents, growth, and development goals, all of which were taken seriously right from the start of their onboarding process.
Today, our Tangerine and Nectari family continues to expand, and we’d love to hear from you if, being part of something global, with a locally grown twang is something that feels right to you!
The position:
Reporting to Nectari’s Professional Services Manager, the Data Analyst (Templates team) must analyze and understand business needs as well as the underlying data structure of various enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems to produce optimized templates for each system.
The candidate must be passionate about his/her expertise and want to play a role in the success of many important projects. He/she will be expected to develop a deep understanding of multiple data models, therefore, experience in working with data models, SQL and ETLs is required.
Your everyday life will consist of:
Analyzing the business requirements to produce templates and business processes that properly address the needs
Designing, developing & maintaining ETLs to extract, transform and load the data into the existing data warehouses
Developing & maintaining reports and dashboards across multiple business domains
Ensuring data accuracy and completeness
Developing & maintaining template and ETL documentation & training material
Setting up & maintaining new ERP development environments (on premises and cloud)
Promoting respect of BI norms and standards
Must Have:
Strong understanding of SQL and ETL tools
Experience with SQL Server and/or Oracle databases
Ability to understand various conceptual data models
Bilingual (English and French)
Knowledge of ERP systems (Sage, Acumatica, MS Dynamics, etc.) an asset
Creative, independent and motivated critical thinker
Analytical, well organized with strong attention to detail
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously
Ability to integrate and work comfortably in a team
With Tangerine Software you’ll enjoy:
A flexible 37.5 hours/week schedule
Ability to work in your comfy clothes from home, well, when the project allows for it of course (working 100% remotely until further notice, and an average of 50% starting spring 2021)
A comprehensive group insurance plan and retirement savings plan
Extra days off at Christmas!
Because our winters can get a little creative, enjoy free covered parking
All work and no play makes… well you know the rest, experience really fun social events. Archery anyone? Or when working remotely, playing video games as a team?
And much more!
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Experience:
Business Analyst: 3 years (Required)
Data Analyst: 3 years (Required)
ERP: 1 year (Required)
Language:
Français (avancé) (Required)
Anglais (avancé) (Required)
Work remotely:
Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Data Integrity Analyst Bariatric Clinic
Description:
Position Profile
Build your career – at the hospital that’s built for the future

We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Full Time Data Integrity Analyst to work with our Bariatrics Program.

Reporting Relationship: Manager, Bariatrics

Hours of Work: Days, Monday to Friday

Hourly: $33.895 - $42.370

Responsibilities:

Prepare and submit monthly Activity Level Reports (ALR) in collaboration with IS&T/Health Records
Develop quality flow and reporting processes (e.g. QA process map) in consultation with Manager
Analyze and coordinate changes to meet newly updated reporting requirements\
Update data elements file and data source maps in database
Adjust data with Manager approval to respond to issues
Discuss changes to funder strategic plans with Manager to analyze impact and transfer knowledge of changes
Creating meaningful utilization reports using various systems (WTIS, iport, Meditech, abstracted and financial data) to package key monitoring information that would be user friendly and available in real time.
Providing regular statistical and narrative data on Wait Time activities with interpretation to support the various clinical programs.
Providing regular statistical and narrative data on Decision Support activities with interpretation to support the various clinical programs.
Educating health care providers in the benefits of appropriate documentation and identifying the impact of documentation gaps as it relates to wait time and financial Information.
Assisting in the procurement, testing and implementation of valid and reliable tools for clinical resource utilization monitoring and analysis
Working in collaboration with the Information Systems Specialist to maintain/update/change dictionary entries of Wait Time Information System as required.

Requirements:
Completion of diploma or degree in health sciences, health administration, epidemiology, information management, or related programs. A combination of experience and education will be considered.
Minimum three years experience in database systems and activity level reporting.
Sound knowledge of medical terminology and documentation systems an asset.
Demonstrated report writing capabilities.
Demonstrated computer knowledge/expertise in MS Office i.e. Power point, Excel, Access, Word - spreadsheets, graphs and databases with report writing skills.
Experience in CIHI data and ICD-10 coding preferred.
Ability to facilitate, deliver and evaluate training programs.
Excellent interpersonal, written/oral communication skills, organization and problem solving skills.
Demonstrated ability to work with hospital staff of all levels and specialties in a positive, cooperative manner.
Demonstrated ability to prioritize workload and function in a changing and sometimes stressful work environment.
Ability to work independently and as a member of a team.
Location: Humber River Hospital – Wilson site

Employee Group: Non Union

Why Humber? Why Now?
Humber River Hospital is on an exciting transformation journey of redefining patient care as we leverage the most advanced technologies to enhance all aspects of delivering high-quality, safe care. We continue to build a people-centered workplace with excellent staff and physician engagement by hiring passionate, diverse and inclusive healthcare professionals. People who care and live our values of Compassion, Professionalism and Respect. People who are committed to making a positive difference.
We are a Studer Group hospital, focused on building our evidence-based leadership practice and hardwiring a culture that WOWs.
Why? Because at Humber River Hospital, we know it’s our people and our ability to innovate that allows us to consistently deliver a great patient experience and the best quality outcomes. After all, we are the hospital that believes exceptional care...healthier community.

This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by the employee within this position. However, the actual responsibilities, duties, qualifications and experience may vary. Employee may perform other related duties as required to meet the ongoing needs of the organization. Information contained in this job posting/description is subject to change.
Humber River Hospital is committed to inclusion and diversity. We believe that diversity drives our culture of innovation. By bringing together a variety of different perspectives, it fuels our creative thinking, generates new ideas and creates solutions designed to address tomorrow's healthcare challenges today. We take pride in providing professional development and career advancement opportunities for our employees including minorities, women, veterans and individuals with physical and developmental disabilities. We also provide accommodation to applicants and all of our employees - from hire to retire.
Let us know what we can do to help you be successful during your recruitment experience at Humber River Hospital.

Title: SAP Data Analyst
Description:
Introduction
As a Package Consultant at IBM, get ready to tackle numerous mission-critical company directives. Our team takes on the challenge of designing, developing and re-engineering highly complex application components and integrating software packages using various tools. You will use a mix of consultative skills, business knowledge, and technical expertise to effectively integrate packaged technology into our clients' business environment and achieve business results.

Your Role and Responsibilities
IBM Global Business Services (GBS) helps our clients fundamentally redesign experiences to create new sources of value, digitally reinvent their operations for great efficiency and transform their entire enterprises through cognitive. We invite you to consider joining IBM's global reach, outcome-focused methodologies, domain skills and deep industry expertise that are helping transform the way we live and work.
IBM's state-of-the-art Client Innovation Centre (CIC) opened in Nova Scotia in March 2013 and is the first of its kind in Canada. The Centre weaves together IBM’s business insights and industry-leading software portfolio and is ideally suited for any client that needs flexible access to emerging or niche skills that may not be cost effective to grow internally. In addition, our focus on our team is unparalleled as demonstrated by the following:
The CIC NS is one of IBM’s highest performing delivery centres worldwide – for retention, client satisfaction and utilization. Our employees are empowered to stay and grow within IBM.
We are very focused on continuous skill development – staff training is our third largest annual Centre investment. Employees are immersed in a culture of learning and constant growth.
Investment in key partnership with universities, government and private sector groups which has resulted in IBM having a key influencing role in Nova Scotia’s ICT industry, especially in talent development.
We are currently recruiting for top talent in SAP Practice - SAP Data Analyst. If you are on top of your profession and possess the following key skills, we invite you to apply to our openings.
SAP data analysts are responsible for analyzing data for business intelligence and connections. They are in charge of processing information, monitoring performance tools, administering databases, managing costs, and modifying users as needed.
Complete Conversion Design Document (CDD) and a part of the project during the Design Phase,
Financial Data Object research, conversion design, and development parameters.
Capture the requirement for data migration, identified legacy source system, approximate volumes, recommend ETL method, data relevancy/retention criteria, data harmonization, de- duplication strategy, data profiling rules, and test plan.
Experience using SAP HANA Studio, HANA Workbench to develop Smart Data Integration (SDI) / Smart Data Quality (SDQ) flowgraphs using the EHUB methodology and best practices to load data through Data Migration Cockpit (DMC), Business Objects Data Services (BODS) to prepare data to be loaded using IDOCs or Basis and Migration Object Modeler (LTMOM) in SAP to modify migration objects getting loaded through Data Migration Cockpit (DMC).
Develop and support Analytics Governance implementation and underlying organization model

Work authorized in Canada

Must hold Secret Security Clearance



Required Technical and Professional Expertise
5 years’ experience in implementing SAP Analytical/Reporting for various industry sectors

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
7 years’ experience in implementing SAP Analytical/Reporting for various industry sectors

About Business Unit
IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

Your Life @ IBM
What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

Location Statement
This role will involve working with technology that is covered by Export Regulations sanctions. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following US sanctioned countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, and Syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Title: Restaurant Team Data Analyst
Description:
We have something other delivery apps don’t have: exclusive partnerships with some of the largest and most popular restaurants in Canada. More and more brands each day, both independent and national chains, choose to deliver with Skip. With your passion for building and managing long-lasting relationships, you’ll help us continue to expand our reach while setting our partners up for success. You’ll also create continuous, irresistible value that keeps everyone satisfied.

Description:
Skip continually looks for high performers who are excited to join our entrepreneurial team to revolutionize food ordering and the delivery industry. We are a technology and logistics company that partners with restaurants across North America to provide access to top restaurants. Skip simplifies this process and provides an exceptional experience to users by leveraging leading-edge technology and an extensive courier network.
As a data analyst on the Sales Enablement Team, you will be responsible for a variety of data and insight related tasks that are an integral component of the success of our Restaurant Team at SkipTheDishes.
Here at SkipTheDishes, we thrive in a high growth environment and we are looking for top-performing individuals to take on a role with expanding responsibilities to further increase our capabilities and efficiency.

What’s On Your Plate:
Optimizing efficiency with data, process, and data accuracy
A combination of long-term projects and repeated data input/output tasks
Working with and administering data and project management software
Design and manage processes and workflows
Design, develop and present reports to management
Recipe for Success:
Skilled in Excel or Google Sheets for data analysis.
Ability to prioritize multiple projects at once.
Fast learner, organized and reliable.
Strong problem-solving skills and high attention to detail.
Self-motivated with a drive to learn and improve.
Ability to shift priorities quickly and effectively in a time-sensitive environment.
Results-oriented, be ready to help out wherever you’re needed to move the team forward!
What It's Like to work At Skip:
Picture this: You, dressed in your fave casual attire, amongst a diverse team of friendly and passionate colleagues. Where we work to make sure all voices are heard, all differences valued, all people treated fairly. You take pride in knowing your input and uniqueness are not only embraced but make an impact on a national food delivery platform with deep Canadian roots and its satisfied customers.
As the company grows, so do you — not only do you meet and surpass new challenges every day, but you have the opportunity to get involved, making a real difference in your and Skip’s future. With committees like Skip’s BIPOC (Black, Indigenous and People of Colour) Network and Women In Tech alongside our CSR (Corporate Social Responsibility) work with organizations like Pride and United Way Winnipeg, you have the opportunity for not only your voice to be heard but for your actions to make an impact, joining a cause that you’re passionate about.
That’s just a small taste of what it’s like to work at one of Canada’s leading tech companies. If you’re hungry for opportunity, growth, and something meaningful in a dynamic environment, we’d love to hear from you.
Skip The Dishes is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We are committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment activities and will work with all applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.
Note: All employees will be asked to sign a Consent for Disclosure of Personal Information in order to complete a background check. Job offers will be conditional upon results that the Company determines to be satisfactory.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Be a part of a dynamic and growing team at Special Risk Insurance Managers Ltd, a leading Canadian provider of niche and specialty Insurance products. We currently have an opening for a Data Analyst.

Design, develop, compile and prepare reports.
Provide timely analytics to leadership team to assist in decision making and identify gaps.

Actuarial knowledge & experience
Excellent time management, organizational, and problem solving skills.
University degree preferably in IT, Math, Finance or Business.

Title: Data Analyst, Banking and Financial Services
Description:
We are a global IT and business consulting services leader, and after 40 years, we're still growing! Join Canada's largest IT Company in our Global Wealth and Banking Services Division in Toronto.?

CGI supports our members’ career aspirations, offering learning initiatives and provides access to our global health and wellness program. We also offer competitive compensation and benefits such as our share purchase plan, a profit sharing program, flexible schedules that guarantee a good work-life balance!

Innovation, technology and service delivery are our focus. Our goal is to ensure our clients remain ahead of the competition. We provide a full spectrum of services from Business Consulting and Systems Integration to Managed Services and IP Solutions that are transforming our clients’ operations and helping them to succeed.?
Build your career with us.

It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

No unsolicited agency referrals please.

CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.
Your future duties and responsibilities
Collaborate with Product Owners and other Analysts to understand business requirements and define technical solutions.
Knowledge of liquidity risk, asset and liability management risk, Benchmark reform rate would be a big advantage.
Design and develop conceptual, logical and physical data models for the operational and analytical databases.
Maintain technical and business metadata.
Build source to target mappings, transformation and architecture artefacts.
Work closely with the technical, application architects, developers and DBAs to implement the solution architecture and database implementation.
Document data flows, identify appropriate data sources and manage redundancy.
Manage data integrity and data quality.
Provide support in the implementation of processes within the QA and production environments
Ability to translate business source-to-target mappings to relevant technical source-to-target mapping.
Demonstrates good understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle.
Troubleshoot production support issues post - deployment and come up with solutions as required.
Required qualifications to be successful in this role
Minimum 3 years+ experience in Data Analytics, preferably within financial and banking.
Education: College/Bachelor in Information Technology/Computer Science. Recent training or certifications in relevant discipline preferred.
Strong SQL, Hive/Beeline skills preferred.
Previous experience of working in an Agile Development environment.
Ability to Work well in a challenging environment.
Previous experience of working in an Agile Development environment.
Ability to Work well in a challenging environment.
Strong troubleshooting skills
Excellent writing skills, oral communication skills, Strong process skills, and leadership ability.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Role
Do you want to work closely with the data and processes of a successful e-commerce business? We’re looking for a Data Analyst to transform insights gained from data into actionable recommendations to drive sales and profit. In this role, you’ll be working to analyze & improve the way we do things, by defining requirements, and then creating solutions.
The Team
Our Analytics team prides itself in providing everyone at Cymax with timely, accurate, and actionable information. Our hardworking team makes this possible by collecting, analyzing and reporting data to give insight into the big picture. Whether through Business Intelligence, Data Science or Operations Research, we use our expertise in big data to facilitate business decisions.
What you’ll do:
Gain a deep understanding of the business by seeking information beyond the surface level. You’ll investigate the source, the definition, and foundational roots of a data element in order to synthesize valuable information for the business.
Work with internal stakeholders to determine business requirements and deliverables on an on-going basis, to help the business make data-driven decisions.
Collect, clean, validate and analyze complex data from multiple sources. You will be responsible for detecting patterns and problems within data and suggesting improvements.
Actively using data to determine market and business trends, identify potential problems and provide recommendations (pricing optimizations, etc.) for increasing profit and sales.
Working closely with Data Engineers and BI Analysts to improve data accuracy and completeness, reports usability and generating more actionable insights.
Summarizing findings and supporting presentation materials for communication with internal and external stakeholders.
Who you are:
Advanced experience and knowledge in SQL
Intermediate to advanced experience of Excel
Experience with data warehouse concepts and foundations
Excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to communicate ideas in both technical and user-friendly language
Ability to balance multiple demands and work both independently and as part of a team
Creative problem solving skills with excessive attention to detail
Passion for the data analysis and visualization
Experience working in a fast-paced environment with SCRUM/Agile methodologies
Prior experience working within an Ecommerce environment would be an asset
Nice to have:
Familiar with Data Mining, Statistical and Quantitative Analysis
Experience with scripting languages (Python/R) and functional programming
Experience with visualization tools like Microsoft Power BI or Tableau
Experience in Data Analysis Expressions (DAX)
Why work here!
Based in Burnaby, BC, Cymax Group is one of North America’s largest e-commerce furniture retailers with over 230,000 furniture SKUs - making us a leader in online sales for all items home and office. We pride ourselves on our unique culture, consisting of impressive team members from all walks of life working together to contribute to the amazing growth we’ve seen. With regular company socials and tons of opportunities to learn, we strive to be the most engaging office in Canada.
We’re looking to hire talented people (like you!) to join our passionate team that will support you as you continue to advance your career.

Title: Analyst, Data Mining
Description:
For 70 years, Charles River employees have worked together to assist in the discovery, development and safe manufacture of new drug therapies. When you join our family, you will have a significant impact on the health and well-being of people across the globe. Whether your background is in life sciences, finance, IT, sales or another area, your skills will play an important role in the work we perform. In return, we’ll help you build a career that you can feel passionate about.
Job Summary
We are seeking an Analyst, Data mining to support our Client Services department for the Laval and Senneville sites. This role is temporary, possibility of teleworking and the schedule is determined between the candidate and the manager (between 15 to 37.5 hours per week). We are therefore looking for a candidate or intern highly motivated by this spontaneous challenge.
Main responsibilities
Provide competitive analysis on competitor companies and identify market trends
Analyze business opportunities that support company objectives
Monitor the international investment landscape within Biotech and identify relevant venture companies to build relationships.
Use online market research and catalogue findings to databases
Discover and identify patterns within data
Produce reports and presentations outlining the research and analysis and results
Provide insight and recommendations to management
Remain fully informed on market trends

Qualifications
Completion of post-secondary studies in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or related programs
1-3 year’s working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst (an asset)
Advanced level knowledge of MS Office applications
Keen analytical skills and ability to interpret large amounts of data
Attention to detail, understanding of statistical analysis
Strong verbal and written communication skills

About Corporate Functions
The Corporate Functions provide operational support across Charles River in areas such as Human Resources, Finance, IT, Legal, Sales, Quality Assurance, Marketing, and Corporate Development. They partner with their colleagues across the company to develop and drive strategies and to set global standards. The functions are essential to providing a bridge between strategic vision and operational readiness, to ensure ongoing functional innovation and capability improvement.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
The Role
You are passionate about consumer products, consumer trends and digital products and you are a result-oriented professional. You are a product builder, who loves solving challenging problems and delivering powerful analysis that will help Moka reach new levels. We are looking for specialists who want to work on cutting-edge technologies, be part of a team behind one of the most popular Fintech apps in Canada, bring fresh ideas and want to see them come to life. As a Marketing Data Analyst, you will work with the Marketing team critical to Moka's needs and have opportunities to develop your skills.
You will develop a deep understanding of all the data sources used by the team, perform effective data quality analysis, validation and troubleshooting. You will be responsible to maintain data accuractu of the data warehouse by implementing quality control measures, define and document best practices to reduce and resolve data anomalies. You will be highly involved in defining Consumer data governance rules, as well as assist in reporting, dashboard creation and participate in the development and implementation of new marketing initiatives involving Consumer Data.
Interested? We are looking for a bright individual who loves data and analytics and who demonstrates a willingness to go the extra mile, takes on the responsibility of doing what needs to be done, has a positive attitude and rolls with changes. This person will have a great opportunity to join a committed and talented team of data enthusiasts.
What You'll Be Doing
Ensure the accuracy of key funnel metrics and support marketing decisions by providing comprehensive reporting and analysis of data;
Support the Moka Executive team, Marketing team and BI team in a multitude of data related tasks including reporting, data extractions and data validation; Develop, monitor and maintain dashboards to help support the business;
Ensure appropriate monitoring and alerting is present to inform the team of unexpected variances in trends
Analyze current data to provide business units with additional insights on donors, their giving history and where possible, provide predictive statistics;
Mining and analyzing data from company's databases to make conclusions on how to make optimizations in company's product development and business strategies;
Frame problems then determine intended approaches and quantitative methods to develop solutions;
Use analytical rigor and statistical methods to analyze large amounts of data, developing actionable insights using advanced statistical techniques such as predictive statistical models, profiling and segmentation analysis, and data mining;
Receive short- and mid-term assignments that require the use of independent judgment outside of established procedures;
Skills
2+ years of relevant experience
Degree in marketing or business
Experience with data manipulation skills, especially using SQL language
Excellent problem-solving skills
Bonus Points
Experience with Tableau & Mixpanel or similar products
Meet Moka
Moka is on a mission to help Canadians achieve their financial goals. The Moka app makes it easy for everyone to save by automatically rounding up their purchases and investing the spare change, but roundups are just the beginning. To help our users across all aspects of their financial lives, we use data to develop personalized insights, recommendations and services. Now, we are looking for more great people who want to be part of a high-energy startup reshaping the financial services industry. If you want to work with talented people, solve big problems and make life better for hundreds of thousands of people, in Canada and beyond, come join us at Moka.
Why Moka?
Moka is Canada's fastest growing fintech, and we're just getting started. Since launching in July 2017, Moka has been downloaded over 750,000 times and has helped Canadians save and invest, many for the very first time.
We've been featured in major media (https://mylo.ai/press/) across the country, won a deal on Dragons' Den, and acquired an asset management firm with over $120M AUM. Our CEO Phil Barrar was nominated for EY Entrepreneur of the Year, made the Bay St Bull's 30<30 List, and has raised $14M in funding to date, most notably from NAVentures, the venture capital division of National Bank of Canada and Desjardins Capital, the venture capital arm of North America's largest association of credit unions.
What We Offer
In a short time, our team has grown from just a few to more than 50 people. At Moka, we value making an impact, asking the tough questions and being inclusive. Our people and their passion are what truly set us apart.
Open-concept offices in St-Henri (dogs are welcome!) with snacks and coffee provided
Comprehensive health benefits package including remote care and extras like subsidized metro/bus pass
Generous vacation policy as well as flexible work hours and location
Support for continuing your skills development, developing your industry knowledge and achieving your career and personal development goals
Team activities and get-togethers like game night and our annual holiday chalet getaway
A casual environment where you will work with smart and passionate people
We believe in being an equal opportunity employer and we celebrate diversity and differences of perspectives at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Systems Consultant and Data Analyst
Description:
EU Health and Innovation Inc is an e-commerce pharma/neutraceutical company based in Toronto. Our focus is to provide dietary supplements and natural products direct to health conscious consumers, supported by strong manufacturing and distribution networks. The Systems Consultant & Data Analyst will be required to identify, recommend, and integrate technologies within our core networks and products in order to increase our online presence and market share. They will also be responsible for conducting data analyses using various sources and grouping tools to identify trends, and design new processes to boost site traffic, internet sales, etc. This role has direct oversight of and responsibility for the critical data warehouse, software, and hardware capabilities of the business.
job duties:
Assess needs and provide advice regarding technology implementation including networks, workstations, internet, and hardware and software.
Maintain knowledge of emerging analytics tools and trends to assess and implement new processes as needed.
Maintain software and documentation libraries to generate maintenance reports, test, update and maintain programming library.
Perform testing of software functionalities on data warehouse and internal IT infrastructure.
Evaluate, implement and integrate new technologies while minimizing system outages.
Analyze data using statistical methods and create reports using analytics software including Microsoft Power BI, Python, Panda, and Excel VBA to present to management.
Review past sales data to determine and address data and reporting needs for marketing and sales strategies, supply chain efficiencies, or other company purposes.
Create statistical models and visualizations that depict trends in e-commerce sales.
Examine, validate and test data to assess model performance, making adjustments as necessary.
Determine the meaning of data and explain how it can be used to improve the efficiency and streamline business processes.
Document structures and types of business data.
Terms of employment: Full time, permanent position
Language of work: English
Wage: CDN $81,000, eligible for discretionary annual bonus and incremental salary increases in accordance with company policy
Benefits package offered: 10 paid vacation days.
Location of work: Vaughan, Ontario
contact information: Please direct any questions or your application to this position to info @ eheurohealthy.com.
Business address: 9131 Keele Street, Vaughan, Ontario L4J 0G7
Skills requirements:
Must have at least a bachelor’s degree or higher in computer science, software engineering, or a related field.
Must have at least 2 years of programming experience using Python with Pandas.
Must have at least 3 – 5 years of experience working in a computer systems analyst /IT infrastructure capacity.
IT infrastructure related certifications from Microsoft® and CompTIA® are considered an asset.
Previous experience working with data management systems / managed databases including Oracle; MySQL; MS Access; MS SQL Server, Amazon RDS (DBaaS), PostgreSQL database, POWER BI Development is an asset.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Education:
Bachelor's Degree (Required)
Work remotely:
Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Data Engineering Analyst - Rotation Program
Description:
Are you a fan of Big Data?
Are you familiar with SQL, Shell and Python?
Do you want to work with a team who is passionate about cutting edge technological tools?
Do you want to collaborate on projects that are at the heart of the Bank's priorities?
National Bank is looking for candidates to fill several full-time positions with the Data Engineering Analyst Rotation Program to work on innovative projects in advanced analytics.
We are looking for autonomous and creative candidates who are at ease in multidisciplinary teams and who excel at designing high quality technological solutions.

More details about your role:
Participate in the design and development of structured and unstructured data acquisition solutions
Have the opportunity to work in big data environments and distributed computing
Discover, structure, clean, enrich, validate, prepare and publish datasets in a format suitable for analytics, modeling and BI according to the needs of the business lines
Collaborate with data scientists and visualization experts to provide them with the correct data
Design, execute and operationalize machine learning and analytics solutions
Understand and determine the risks and issues related to the chosen technologies
Communicate and interpret complex technical concepts to users of analytical platforms
Coach your peers so that they can assimilate the bank's data environments
Work in an agile / iterative format

Qualifications:
Qualifications:
Proficiency in several programming languages, preferably SQL, Shell, Python and Javascript
Knowledge in databases technologies (e.g.: BigQuery, Hive, Hadoop, SQL Server)
Experience in data flow design and development
Experience processing big data for data valuation purposes
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g.: PowerBI, Tableau)
Knowledge of algorithms and machine learning (e.g.: training vs testing, model performance measurements, algorithm complexity)
Knowledge of Spark and Databricks framework is an asset
Knowledge of MLlib, sklearn, H2O frameworks is an asset
Knowledge of at least one Cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, Azure) is an asset
Requirement:
The candidate must be functional in French both orally and in writing.

Title: Junior Data Analyst – Industrial IT
Description:
Working for BBA means being part of a team of talented people who have the passion to succeed and the drive to excel in order to provide first-class service to clients.

Work location: Montreal

Skills

Committed to the firm's success
Honest and trustworthy
Respect BBA ethics and values
Hold functional and technical skills
Ability to absorb a great deal of information and prioritize actions
Ability to analyze and summarize
Results-driven
Adaptable and flexible
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to be self-reliant and to learn

Bachelor’s degree in applied mathematics, computer science or other relevant field of advanced data analysis.
Solid ability for problem-solving and to propose innovative solutions
Solid knowledge of data management (storing, visualization, modelling, extraction and manipulation of real-time data flows).

Good knowledge of the Python programming language and data analysis and machine learning libraries such as pandas, scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow.
Updated knowledge of current market trends in artificial intelligence and machine or deep learning
Experience with artificial intelligence, machine learning, natural language processing or other related fields

Asset: Bilingual (English and French) spoken and written

Title: Senior Analyst, Data Governance and Standards Office (DGSO)
Description:
Senior Analyst, Data Governance and Standards Office (DGSO)

Who we are
We are an organization comprised of industry thought leaders who are passionate about health data and want to make a difference in the health care field. We are an independent, not-for-profit organization and together with our partners we provide essential information on Canada's health systems, enabling decisions that lead to healthier Canadians. As a valued member of the CIHI team, you and your work will have a pivotal role in the evolution of Canada's health care systems.
CIHI is recognized as an exceptional place to work that embraces diversity, respect, integrity, collaboration and innovation.
At CIHI, we recognize what matters to our employees. Some of the benefits of working at CIHI include
Generous vacation days
Flexible benefits program from your first day on the job
HOOPP Pension Plan (Defined Pension)
Retirement Planning Program
Work-life balance
Career Planning Program
Learning and Professional Development Program



Why is this role important?
The Senior Analyst, Data Governance and Standards Office (DGSO) is part of a matrix team responsible for defining and implementing an enterprise-level vision and strategy to enhance data and information governance as well as master data capabilities for operational, analytical and reporting needs with a focus on key master data domains (e.g. geography, population, organization, and client).

There are multiple opportunities at the sr. analyst level available at this time. One position will have a focus on the core operational activities of the department including: support for components of the data and information governance program of work (e.g. standards development, business process redesign, support of corporate data projects like Hub and ODT, secretariat support for corporate DIG committees) and support for master data operational activities (e.g. regular updates to master data such as client or geography files, client support, education).

The other position will play a key role in the completion of the current phase of the Source of Truth for Organizations and Contacts (SOTOC) master data management (MDM) project. In particular, this person will support analytical and business process redesign activities for the master organization data across various systems at CIHI.

What you'll do
1. Performs support activities (incl. creating/enhancing usage guidelines, standards and documentation) in order to establish single corporate stewardship and accountability for data domains (e.g. for a role with a geography focus this would be related to geography information at CIHI such as Statistics Canada’s PCCF/PCCF+ files, CIHI’s Geography Dimension, and geography information in SAS files).
2. Collaborates with program areas to gather requirements related to the management and use of DGSO domain data (organization, geography, population, client) and works with the DGSO and Stewardship Council to establish and implement priorities.
activities for the Data Governance and Standards Office (e.g. in the current focus for the department is the Source of Truth for Organizations and Contacts development project and maturing the Data and Information Governance program of work).
4. Participates in the design of test strategies/test cases, develops code and scripts and provides analytical support to ensure accurate and comprehensive testing of upgrades and enhancements to master data solutions and downstream systems.
5. Participates in the identification and resolution of important issues relating to domain specific master data (e.g. organization related standards) to ensure effective operation, maintenance and standardized use. This may include assisting with the development of policies, business rules and documentation for data collection, quality assurance and data element definitions as well as policies for how to use master data in analysis and reporting.
6. Develops and maintains knowledge of CIHI’s data holdings and corporate master data sources including geography dimension, OI, client, & population data, CRM, Access Management System (AMS) and analytical tools (e.g. SAS, Excel, MicroStrategy) used at CIHI.
7. Supports proactive planning and implementation of the overall health master data strategy.
8. Provides regular updates to the relevant domain stewards Team Lead and Manager, as required.

What you'll bring to the table
Undergraduate degree in health information, mathematics/statistics or similar field.

Three to five years of experience in healthcare-related information management or processing environment.

Experience with CIHI databases, standards and health master data. Experience working with geography data (incl. PCCF/PCCF+, CIHI’s Geography Dimension, census geography), the Organization Index, CRM or AMS is an asset.

Experience related to indicator methodology and business processes associated with developing and reporting on indicators is an asset.

Demonstrated understanding of the Canadian health care system and of the importance of master data standards to support performance management and reporting.

Advanced knowledge and experience using SAS for data manipulation and/or statistical analysis.

Strong writing, interpersonal, problem solving and communication skills.

Excellent planning and organizing skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities.

Ability to work independently and under tight deadlines.

Experience with Informatica suite of tools (e.g. Informatica MDM) and/or geographic information system (GIS) software (e.g. ESRI, MapInfo) is an asset.

Fluency in both official languages is an asset.

Ability to meet travel requirements.


Basic Qualifications
Undergraduate degree in health information, mathematics/statistics or similar field.

Three to five years of experience in healthcare-related information management or processing environment.

Experience with CIHI databases, standards and health master data. Experience working with geography data (incl. PCCF/PCCF+, CIHI’s Geography Dimension, census geography), the Organization Index, CRM or AMS is an asset.


Closing Statement
To find out more about this role and other exciting opportunities visit our website at www.cihi.ca and check out our 'Careers' section.
We thank all those who apply, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.



Employment Equity
At CIHI we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Investor Relations Analyst, ESG & Data
Description:
OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY

As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.

The Opportunity

Location Flexible*

Data Analysis

University degree or College diploma

.

Title: Data Science Analyst
Description:
LIFE AT BRP

We create innovative ways to move – on snow, water, asphalt. In the air, on the ground and everywhere in between.

Built on a 75-year tradition of ingenuity and intensive customer focus, BRP is headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec and operates manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, and Austria. We have a total workforce of more than 12,600 driven, resourceful people.

Our portfolio of industry-leading and distinctive products includes Ski-Doo and Lynx snowmobiles, Sea-Doo watercraft, Can-Am on- and off-road vehicles, Alumacraft, Manitou, Quintrex, Stacer and Savage boats, Evinrude and Rotax marine propulsion systems as well as Rotax engines for karts, motorcycles and recreational aircraft. We support our lines of product with a dedicated parts, accessories and clothing business to fully enhance your riding experience.

Because it’s not about the destination. It’s about the journey. Yours.

We are passionate and qualified; by joining BRP, you will evolve within an experienced team that will welcome you with open arms.

www.brp.com.

Have you ever imagined becoming an expert in trade compliance data science? An ever-evolving world of opportunity awaits. Seize this opportunity!

WHY JOIN THE TEAM?

To have the opportunity to develop your leadership skills and your knowledge of data science directly related to trade compliance operations

To work with all sectors of the company’s international operations as well as the product development and distribution teams

To make a difference for our customers and suppliers by increasing awareness of our performance and the automation of some operations management processes and procedures to minimize trade issues ahead of the import-export cycle for parts and finished products

To work in an environment that promotes world-class professional development

To be part of a dynamic and passionate team that influences decision making in connection with other data science stakeholders

YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

As a data science analyst in the trade compliance team, your main responsibilities will include:

Helping to develop and support data science to optimize trade compliance processes

Working closely with other data scientists and the IS&T analytics team

Identifying and implementing new performance indicators

Developing requests, reports and complex dashboards

Identifying data and performance issues, and making improvements

Working with stakeholders impacted by data issues and collaborating with the transformation change management teams to align the changes to be made

Supporting operations and project teams with data management to ensure the integrity of data used for decision-making and to automate processes and procedures

YOUR PROFILE

University degree in a field directly related to information technology or business intelligence

Proficiency with Azure Data Lake, Power BI or an equivalent technology (required)

Capacity for analysis and synthesis

Ability to find solutions for optimization

Team player with solid interpersonal skills and a keen sense of leadership, curiosity and organization

Ability to put yourself in the position of stakeholders

Goal-oriented, efficient and able to work under minimal supervision

Mandatory bilingualism, written and spoken (English/French)

SAP (ECC, S/4, GTS) proficiency an asset

Experience in manufacturing an asset

AN EXCEPTIONAL AREA! >

Title: Data Analyst (Insurance)
Description:
Position Overview:
Totten is looking for a strong Data Analyst to provide data support and management through analysis and interpretation of raw data to various key stakeholders in Underwriting. The position requires an individual who is a self-starter and can work both independently as well collaboratively with Managers and Executive Management Team. This role is based downtown Toronto and reporting to the Chief Underwriting Officer.

This individual will be responsible for pulling raw data, from various systems, and work with stakeholders to analyze and interpret the raw data, to develop report templates to track performance and forecast future key performance indicators (KPIs). This individual should have a solid track record of solving business challenges by gathering data, and then recommending data driven solutions

This is a dynamic role and involves working closely with the Chief Underwriting Officer on special projects related to corporate strategy, contract compliance and underwriting. This role reports to the Chief Underwriting Officer. We offer an excellent opportunity to work for one of Canada’s Leading MGA’s and to become part of a dynamic and knowledgeable team.

Role Responsibilities:
Work with Totten’s management team to develop valuable monthly reports to monitor the impact of business decisions including rate, underwriting changes, territory, portfolio mix, etc. to ensure the results are in line with Totten meeting or exceeding their strategic goals.

Support regional teams in understanding their mix of business, retention, growth, profitability, and advising on adjustments as needed to support their business strategies.

Based on our various systems (TAM, EPIC, Policy Works, Lineage & claims data), they must have the ability to distill large amounts of data and then translate these findings into key insights, to illustrate how we are effectively managing the business for our insurer partners.

Work with the Actuarial Analyst to create and amend report templates including (but not limited to) to document formatting, creating and testing macros, and inputting formulas

This position also assists with the completion of reports for Lloyds of London (both brokers & syndicates) and domestic markets.

This role would also look for revenue enhancing opportunities to maximize Totten’s returns from our performance (i.e.: Commissions & Fees).

Identifies and researches business needs and determines solutions to problems using various research methodologies.

Updates data system for Totten monthly using accurate parameters.

Works with management team and Executive Management Team to develop valuable monthly reports.

Assists with special projects as required

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematical Science, Statistics and/or related fields

5+ years of relevant experience in a similar analytical or business intelligence environment

MGA experience an asset

Strong insurance reporting and research experience desired

Proficient in Microsoft Office: Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook

Advanced Proficiency in MS Access and MS Excel

Experience with Access and SQL or equivalent systems are an asset

Outstanding organizational skills with ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently in fast paced environment, while adhering to strict deadlines

Experience with TAM broker management system an asset

Effective communication skills (written and verbal).

Strong problem-solving skills to develop, test, validate, and maintain robust tools/models

Strong attention to detail and data entry skills.

Ability to work efficiently and effectively, utilizing good time management skills.

Strong teamwork and collaboration skills.

Core Values:
Entrepreneurship - encouraging innovation and educate risk taking

Integrity – doing things right every time

Teamwork – working together to maximize results Accountability – measure and take responsibility for outcomes

Service - serving customers, communities, and colleagues

Totten Insurance Group is Canada’s leading national MGA provider of niche products and innovative solutions. Totten Group is committed to servicing brokers across the country and is comprised of six divisions: Personal Lines; Commercial Property; Commercial Casualty; Hospitality; Construction and Professional Liability. With offices across Canada, Totten Group’s corporate office resides in Toronto ON, and has other locations in Oakville ON, Dartmouth NS, Winnipeg MB, Montreal QC, and Vancouver BC. Learn more at www.tottengroup.com .

Department Underwriting

Required Experience: 5-7 years of relevant experience

Required Travel: No Travel Required

Required Education: Bachelor's degree (4-year degree)

Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
About Behavox
Behavox is shaping the future for how businesses harness their most important raw material - data. Our mission is bold: Organize enterprise data into actionable information that protects and promotes the business growth of multinational companies around the world.
From managing enterprise risk and compliance to maximizing revenue and value, our data operating platform presents a widespread opportunity to build multilingual, AI / ML - based solutions that activate data for every function within a global enterprise.
Our approach is unique, and it's validated by our customers who tell us to keep forging ahead because no one else is aggregating, analyzing, and acting on data to uncover opportunities or solve problems quite the way we are.
We are looking for fearless innovators who have an insatiable appetite for building what no one has built before.
About the Role
Based out of Montreal and reporting into the Head of Global HR Operations, this role balances business acumen, exceptional analytical skills and technical expertise to lead projects and initiatives related to HR data, analytics, report design & creation, dashboards, data consolidation and scheduling of reports.
What You'll Do
You'll design and develop and automate operational reports, analytical dashboards, or deliver ad-hoc findings based on business requirements
You'll run, verify, and dispatch scheduled reports this may involve manual data extraction or making connections to available data sources on various platforms
You'll assist in setting up, administering and usage of local data sources and relational databases that facilitate report automation
You'll design and implement queries, including documenting procedures
You'll identify opportunities to standardize and scale reports, fine-tune dashboards and curate insights
You'll proactively identify and evaluate impact of changes on user requirements, within data warehouse environment and/or to source systems
What You'll Bring
Proven expertise and significant experience working in Data Science and HRIS or related field such as Finance, Statistics, Operations
In-depth knowledge of People Analytics
Expert knowledge of data ETL, data modeling, statistical analysis and predictive modeling
Proven project management skill
Prior BambooHR reporting experience strongly preferred
Experience with or knowledge of Robotic Process Automation desirable
Highly effective at communicating outcomes and analytical insights and recommendations to audiences at all levels
What We Offer
A truly global mission with a passionate community in locations all over the world
Huge impact and learning potential as our aspirations require bold innovation
Benefits include fully covered health coverage for employee and family
Generous time-off policy and flexible work schedule
About Our Process
We take Talent very seriously and we are building a community of extraordinary individuals working together in very high performing teams. We also know that the best Talent always has options so we believe that the process has to be a two way assessment - the company AND the candidate assessing the business needs alignment, the career next step alignment, and the cultural alignment.
During the process we will begin by exploring the core factors regarding salary and location along with core experience and skills and values alignment. We will then deep dive explore the critical technical competencies we have identified for the role, and then we will deep dive in behavioral competencies.
The most aligned candidate will then be asked to do a practical work task simulation activity so we can make sure that you will enjoy the kind of work the role requires, and this task will typically be presented and discussed with a group of colleagues and managers. Finally we will ask you to meet with a number of our senior leaders to make sure that you are making the most informed call possible.

We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

Title: Senior Treasury Analyst - Data Analysis
Description:
OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY

As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.

The Opportunity:
The Senior Treasury Analyst, reports directly to the Sr. Director, Global Treasury. The position will be responsible for analyzing, tracking, and reporting on credit card transactions processed for OT across the globe and assisting with special projects in the Treasury group.

You Are Great At:
Analyze, track, and report on key metrics related to accepting credit card payments from customers. Assist the Sr. Director, Global Treasury in identifying and implementing key products and services that will generate more effective processing and maximize the success of collecting payments from customers.
Identify, analyze, track, and report on key metrics related to payments made to suppliers via credit card. Insure that proper rebates are earned and paid by the bank.
Work with the banks to maximize utilization of the program.
Work with key card processors to learn and understand opportunities to improve processing.
Work with the various processing units within OT to help educate and implement key processes to improve success of card transactions.
Identify opportunities to improve revenue and reduce expenses related to credit card processing.
Assist with special projects in the Treasury group as they evolve. Projects could include initiatives across the Treasury Group working closely with the Sr Director, Global Cash Management and Snr Director, Corporate Finance & Risk including topics within Cash Management, Insurance, Corporate Finance, and Risk Management.
Contribute to the development of processes and best practices within treasury.
What It Takes:
Minimum of 2-3 years of experience working in a large company in the Finance Department or similar area.
Exposure to credit card activity is a plus
Undergraduate degree in Finance, Economics, or Accounting. MBA or other graduate degrees a plus.
Must have solid quantitative, analytical and problem-solving skills.
Advanced working knowledge of Excel with the ability to learn new applications quickly. Ability to prepare and present PowerPoint presentations.
Project management experience.
Strong interpersonal, communication and organizational skills and the ability to work within various group settings.
High degree of flexibility and creativity required; able to adapt to a continually changing environment and to develop financial procedures and processes to meet such changes.
Knowledge and experience with SAP is considered an asset.
