Title: Employer Data Analyst
Description:
Employer Data Analyst
Client Services – Employer Services & Data Management
(One Year Contract)


You are client focused with strong analytical and problem solving skills who can expertly reconcile employment history and financial data. In this role you will analyze, investigate and complete corrections to all rejected transactions received from Employer interfaces; determine information/data needed to correct member’s records; validate information using detailed/practical knowledge of pension administration requirements, human resources policies and Employer’s payroll procedures; validate information for the enrolments received from the Employer Portal; validate corresponding contributions and ensure it is received in a timely manner; identify any discrepancies and work with Employers to resolve them; conduct follow-ups by phone and portal messages on a timely basis. Resolve any data clean up identified by the automated processes for leaves, immediate pensions and pre-retirement termination cases. Establish and maintain good working relationships with internal business partners and designated Employer contacts. Provide on-going advocacy, information and education to Employers of our plan. You will follow established criteria to ensure the quality and integrity of the information used by Client Services, identify issues and trends, and make recommendations to improve efficiency and service. Working within a team, you will aim to meet or exceed client service expectations and provide data management support as needed.

Key Qualifications:
Working knowledge with federal tax legislation, the Pension Benefits Act, Public Service
Pension Plan Act and have a general understanding of the pensions industry. Your background will include processing client transactions in accordance with established best practices/policies and explaining complex issues through a variety of channels. You have strong knowledge and proficiency with MS Excel, Word and Outlook. You have strong mathematical, analytical, and problem solving skills and initiative. You are someone with excellent time management, strong communication, and interpersonal skills that embrace teamwork with the ability to meet established timelines and to process large volumes of detailed information with minimal errors. You are self-directed, but recognize the importance of relationship building with your team as well as with those across the organization.


Are you interested in this exciting opportunity?
If yes, please submit your resume by 5:00pm, November 9, 2020.


OPB is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities in its recruitment process.
Please advise OPB if you require an accommodation and we will work with you to meet your needs.
Candidates being considered for this position will be required to submit to a background screening.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Profile
"Reimagining the Way You Deliver". Drone Delivery Canada is a publicly traded, disruptive, pioneering, technology company focused on designing, developing and implementing commercially viable, drone-based logistics systems for government, commercial, industrial & retail customers globally. The Company’s patented, fully-integrated hardware/software platform is used as a managed service in a SaaS business model. Drone Delivery Canada is commercialized, operational and early-stage revenue-generating, with a robust sales funnel of global prospects.

TSX.V: FLT; OTC QB: TAKOF; Frankfurt: ABB.F
www.DroneDeliveryCanada.com

Our people are at the heart of the innovation process and joining us means you can build a career in a way no other company can duplicate! We are seeking entrepreneurial, smart, team-oriented people who have purpose and are committed to helping our team bring leading drone technology to businesses globally.
DDC is looking for a person to fill the Data Analyst role (3-month contract, part time or full time, with possibility of extension). You will make a difference everyday as you navigate the following duties and responsibilities:

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Gather requirements, analyze source data systems, interpreting data
Developing and implementing data analyses, data collection systems and other strategies that optimise statistical efficiency and quality
Work with team members across the company to understand how to interpret the data that will be incorporated into systems
Help perform ad-hoc analytics requests, analyze test results, draw actionable insights, generate reports and present findings internally
Define frequency of data collection, consistency
Perform other duties, as assigned

Education & Work Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Science or Math
Minimum 1- 2 years expertise in compiling raw data, and leveraging tools that extract and convey actionable insights from data
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge and experience with reporting packages, databases and programming
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings

Behavioural Competencies and Personal Attributes
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Able to work well with people at all levels
Results oriented and able to complete tasks on deadlines
Integrity, Empathy and commitment to excellence
High attention to detail and organisational skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Exemplary communication skills, verbal and written

Hours of Work, Work Environment and Potential Travel

3-month contract, with possibility of extension
Part time option – 20 hours p/week
Full time option - 37.5 hours p/week, 8:30am to 4:30pm
Position is predominantly a combination of in-office and remote

Diversity & Inclusion

DDC is committed to the creation of an exceptional work environment wherein we maintain values of mutual respect, integrity, dignity, and inclusivity; and encourage the open exchange of ideas and opinions. We are an equal opportunity employer that evaluates applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law.

If you require a specific accommodation because of a disability or a medical need, please inform the recruiter. This ensures that the appropriate accommodations are in place at time of your interview and before you begin your employment.

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data Quality Analyst to join our audience measurement team in our Montreal office. Our team is focused on adding value to Webcast Metrics (WMC) and Podcast Metrics, our cloud based digital audio monitoring and measurement services (radio, podcast, and online music services). WCM provides credible, validated data that enables live and on-demand audio publishers to quantify their audience at global, national, and local levels. Portions of our Webcast Metrics data are accredited by the Media Rating Council (MRC).
Our goal is to be the global leader in measurement, ranking and analysis in the digital audio industry, providing information and trends that benefit publishers. To achieve this, we rely on our mastery of "Big data" technologies and the outstanding talent of our team.
The Role
Reporting into our Measurement Product Manager, you will use your skills and experience to; build reports and tools that will improve the quality of our measurement services, verify and analyze data and ensure our clients and teams understand the data provided. You will be responsible for producing our monthly public rankers, for monitoring our services and for minimizing and simplifying the operational workload within the team. You will work with a highly skilled and motivated team where your efforts and expertise will have a direct impact on framing and solving some of the challenging devops problems we face. Data is at the core of what we do at Triton Digital, both in providing data-driven metrics to our customers, and in analyzing our user behavior to improve the product experience and enable us to better manage our business. We are open to junior applicants with relevant educational background and experience.
The Responsibilities
Data Analysis
Create global and regional digital audio listening rankers using podcast and webcast data.
Research insights about the digital audio industry and publish them in our monthly rankers.
Help internal & external clients to better understand their metrics and build value from them.
Quality / Operations
Perform daily maintenance/monitoring tasks including automatization and optimization of such tasks.
Perform quality assurance of all data.
Investigate, validate, analyze and communicate data issues, directly with internal and external clients.
Resolve any level three technical investigations/escalations related to data or distribute to the appropriate team member.
Think out of the box to help Triton to build and support the best digital audio measurement solutions out there.
Write /create/update documentation and procedure.
Assist product team as needed, to deliver quality product.
The Requirements
You must have:
Relevant experience in a data analysis, technical customer support or quality assurance role.
Relational database querying experience (SQL).
Strong skills in Excel (vlookups, pivot tables)
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English (French an asset).
Curiosity and interest in continued learning with a high level of autonomy and resourcefulness.
Strong attention to quality and details.
Strong client skills with ability to handle confidential information discreetly and maintain confidentiality.
What’s Nice to Have:
Having one or more of these skills is an asset:
Experience with AWS cloud resources.
Understanding of statistical principles.
Experience with quality assurance (QA).
Experience with BI tools (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI).
Experience in the media, digital marketing or measurement industry.

Title: Principal Data Analyst
Description:
About Behavox
Behavox is shaping the future for how businesses harness their most important raw material - data. Our mission is bold: Organize enterprise data into actionable information that protects and promotes the business growth of multinational companies around the world.
From managing enterprise risk and compliance to maximizing revenue and value, our data operating platform presents a widespread opportunity to build multilingual, AI / ML - based solutions that activate data for every function within a global enterprise.
Our approach is unique, and it's validated by our customers who tell us to keep forging ahead because no one else is aggregating, analyzing, and acting on data to uncover opportunities or solve problems quite the way we are.
We are looking for fearless innovators who have an insatiable appetite for building what no one has built before.
About the Role
The Data Science team at Behavox continuously delivers new machine learning services and applications for finding valuable insights in various communications, including text and speech. The quality of Data Science components is our key priority. Our Data QA team drives testing activities to ensure the quality of our ML services and scenarios and we need you to take us to the next level.
What You'll Do
Collect, research and analyze all telemetry data, test results and test metrics
Select relevant data and aggregate it into representative quality metrics
Design dashboards and visualizations to enable interpretation and monitoring of quality and health of all components
Create triggers to enable quick responses to issues detected in both development and production environments
What You'll Bring
8+ experience designing, building, and maintaining analytics pipelines within the technology field (data gathering & aggregation, analysis, dashboarding & comprehensive reporting)
5+ experience of working with large datasets and many different data sources
Practical expertise in statistical analysis with use of various statistical packages and tools including programming (Python)
Familiarity with software quality assurance processes and best practices is a plus
Familiarity with machine learning ecosystems (or interest in learning)
What We Offer
A truly global mission with a passionate community in locations all over the world
Huge impact and learning potential as our aspirations require bold innovation
Highly competitive compensation with 100% bonus pay already integrated
Benefits include fully covered health coverage for employee and family
Generous time-off policy and flexible work schedule
About Our Process
We take Talent very seriously and we are building a community of extraordinary individuals working together in very high performing teams. We also know that the best Talent always has options so we believe that the process has to be a two way assessment - the company AND the candidate assessing the business needs alignment, the career next step alignment, and the cultural alignment.
During the process we will begin by exploring the core factors regarding salary and location along with core experience and skills and values alignment. We will then deep dive explore the critical technical competencies we have identified for the role, and then we will deep dive in behavioral competencies.
The most aligned candidate will then be asked to do a practical work task simulation activity so we can make sure that you will enjoy the kind of work the role requires, and this task will typically be presented and discussed with a group of colleagues and managers. Finally we will ask you to meet with a number of our senior leaders to make sure that you are making the most informed call possible.

Title: Data Analyst , Investigation and Forensic
Data Quality and Management Analyst
Description:
Questrade Technology Group (QTG) acts as the back-bone for Questrade. They act as strategic partners with each business unit to help Questrade leverage technology to gain competitive advantage. The team is composed of very skilled, very committed individuals working collaboratively. They collectively create a unique work environment that is fast-paced and challenging, but also very open and supportive. So are they the serious, geeky-types? No way! Fun, freedom, flexibility is how QTG members describe the work culture here.
What’s it like working as Data Quality and Management Analyst at Questrade?
The position involves working with existing data management systems and processes to maintain high data quality levels. The person in this role interacts with multiple stakeholders and data owners to enact practices directed at improving and maintaining data quality.
Job Responsibilities:
Building and maintaining data quality reporting framework
Designing and implementing business rules in code for data profiling analysis
Preparing and publishing data quality reports
Performing root cause analysis of data quality issues
Working with data stewards on data quality goals
Administration of corporate reference data management system
Administration of corporate metadata management system
Evangelizing best data management practices throughout the company
Interacting with employees of all levels
Working with stakeholders on terminology and metric definitions

So are YOU our next Data Quality and Management Analyst? You are if you have
Degree in computer science/mathematics or related field
Minimum 3 years of experience working in data management/data quality field
Ability to classify and define data concepts
Experience dealing with business terminology and data dictionaries
Extensive experience dealing with data quality issues, understanding of types of data quality issues
Understanding of various data types and associated lifecycles (e.g. master data, reference data, transactional data, etc.)
Good knowledge of Excel
Knowledge of Power BI is a plus
Knowledge of T-SQL language
Understanding of relational and dimensional modelling concepts is an asset
Knowledge of MS SQL Server Master Data Services is an asset
Knowledge of Collibra Data Governance is an asset
Knowledge of banking business environment/operations is an asset

Title: Data Management Analyst
Description:
IKO Industries Ltd. is a market leader in the manufacturing of roofing and building materials. IKO is a Canadian owned and operated business with production facilities worldwide and has many years of unparalleled success in the roofing materials industry. Quality, integrity, and trustworthiness are the values that underlie this success, and we have built this company by hiring people who hold these values. People like you!

Job Description
Reporting directly to the Global MDM Manager, in this role, you will be responsible for the accurate and timely maintenance of North American master data (e.g. customers, vendors, items, etc.) within our 3 different ERP platforms; JD Edwards E1, Mapics, and Macola.
You will be expected to work closely with Business Process Experts in order to ensure data quality, completeness and compliance. Data maintenance is very time sensitive to the business; therefore in this role it is important to be able to operate within the SLAs established for the various data management tasks being undertaken.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Execute additions/changes to JDE master data (e.g. customers, vendors, items, etc.) as approved by the business
Perform mass data updates as required for time to time
Ensure data quality, compliance and consistency of master data across all businesses
Participate in projects and initiatives across multiple functional areas in order to develop and/or refine data collection processes
Work with business units and process experts to resolve master data issues
Perform periodic audits of master data to identify issues, inconsistencies or missing data
Support the business with required procedures and submit incidents and change request tickets when required
QUALIFICATIONS
University degree or College diploma in business, computer science or a related field
Minimum 2 years of previous master data management experience, preferably in JD Edwards
Strong skills in Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Analytically minded self-starter with proven problem solving skills
Familiarity with process driven environments
Very good interpersonal skills with a “can do” and customer service mentality
Previous experience working cross-functionally across multiple business areas
Deadline oriented with the ability to efficiently prioritize work and keep stakeholders advised on progress against SLAs (Service Level Agreements)
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Benefits of Employment: IKO recognizes that its success is due to the strength of its employees. A primary goal of IKO is to promote individual employee's sense of accomplishment and contribution so that employees enjoy their association with IKO. The Company invests in its employees so that they are the most knowledgeable in the industry, and undertakes great efforts to nurture loyalty to, and teamwork at, IKO. We are pleased to offer competitive compensation, health care, a progressive and challenging workplace and a commitment to teamwork and integrity.

Diversity and Equal Opportunity Employment: IKO Industries Ltd. is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to diversity and inclusion and are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without consideration to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status or disability. IKO Industries Ltd. encourages and welcomes applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Reporting to the Provincial Manager, Supply Chain Performance, the primary focus of the Data Analyst, Supply Chain Systems is to ensure that all supply chain and related applications are meeting the business needs of the organization, provide statistical performance reporting and application support for ERP Supply Chain modules. Responsibilities include systems analysis, design, development; implementation and maintenance of customized and delivered supply chain applications in addition to technical systems support services for Supply Chain staff and clients. The Data Analyst recommends improvement and standardization of business processes and ensures effective utilization of systems. This position is responsible for supply chain systems servicing all agencies, including training staff on the functionality of the systems. The Data Analyst works closely with the senior technical staff and leads responsible for the technical functions related to the applications.

What you'll do
Reviews systems use, identifies needs, and makes recommendations for reallocation or acquisition of systems or equipment to ensure appropriate utilization of computerized and manual systems as well as other departmental/divisional resources.
Participates in systems development and maintenance of the Supply Chain systems, including taking roles in developing and analyzing key performance indicators, needs identification, requirements definition, creating/ project work plans, and participate in system selection, development, implementation, documentation, interfacing and maintenance within established policies and guidelines in accordance with the Supply Chain strategic plan.
Provides recommendations for process improvement for the Supply Chain function and works with staff and managers to evaluate alternative procedural and systematic solutions which most effectively meet needs while maintaining acceptable business standards.
Supports report development based on needs of users including executive as well as agency management staff. Fulfils external reporting requirements as requested..
Performs data gathering and analysis for the Supply Chain function to facilitate operational activities
Maximizes systems functionality, integration and skill sets in user groups by analyzing processes using technological functionality and recommending/leading implementation efforts where appropriate.
Supports development and recommendation of procedures such as Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) standards to ensure security, integrity and accuracy of supply chain data.
Provides ongoing support and enhancement to all supply chain systems through training programs, one-on-one consultation, systems or procedural advice, specific problem resolution and troubleshooting, resolving or escalating system failures. Develops training materials required in providing customer support and user trainings.
Maintains application tables to keep them current and aligned with organizational needs.
Creates and maintains Business Resumption Plans and Disaster Recovery Plans.
Provides software support and maintenance by coordinating the set-up and installation of program with IM/IT.
Provides systems advice and expertise to areas external to the division having a significant supply chain systems impact.

What you bring
Graduation from a recognized degree or diploma program in a related field
Two (2) years recent related experience related to IT, Computer Science and/or Business Applications or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Ability to write programs in a variety of program languages
You can/have
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
Ability to deal with others effectively.
Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
Ability to organize work.
What’s in it for you
Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That’s why we’re focused on your care too – offering health, wellness, development programs to support you – at work and at home.
Join one of BC’s largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations – offering vast opportunities for growth and development.
Access to more than 2,000 in-house training programs.
12 annual statutory holidays with generous vacation entitlement and accruement.
Flexible work options including flextime, work locations and job sharing (eligibility will vary)
Perks include onsite fitness classes and discounts to 350 BC-wide recreational programs, travel, technology, car and bike sharing, and more.
Job type Temporary Full Time unitil March 2021
Wage $35.29/Hour + 12.6% in lieu
Location 1795 Willingdon Avenue, Burnaby
Hours/ Days of work 0800-1600, Monday through Friday
Reference number 099612E

What we do

Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA) plans, coordinates and evaluates specialized health services with the BC health authorities to provide equitable and cost-effective health care for people throughout the province. Our values reflect our commitment to excellence and include: Respect people – Be compassionate – Dare to innovate – Cultivate partnerships – Serve with purpose. Learn more about PHSA and our programs: jobs.phsa.ca/programs-and-services
PHSA is committed to employment equity and hires on the basis of merit, encouraging all qualified individuals to apply. We recognize that our ability to provide the best care for our diverse patient populations relies on a rich diversity of skills, knowledge, backgrounds and experiences, and value a safe, inclusive and welcoming environment.

Title: Initiative - Data Analyst, Digital Hub
Description:
Initiative is different to other media agencies.
We are not trapped by a legacy structure primarily centered on paid advertising. Instead, we are liberated by a new world structure designed to deliver highly differentiated and highly effective communications strategies for our clients.
We’re not the biggest agency in town. So rather than outsize our competitors we must outsmart them. That’s why we’ve built the strongest strategic capability of any agency in the market. Core to this strategic capability is an obsession with culture and how brands can pivot from brand advertising (which is forgettable) to cultural branding (which is memorable).
Our new world model is comprised of four central “craft centers” – Client Advice and Management, Strategy, Communications Design and Partnerships.

OUR BEHAVIORS
Initiative respects that everyone has something unique to contribute to the agency.
We are a bunch of eclectic and brilliant misfits with diverse backgrounds that represent the unique fabric of consumers and culture.
We want you to be yourself. We want to hear your opinions. We want to see your passion and energy.
If you disagree with something you see or hear then speak up. We will never punish or penalize you for bringing something important to our attention.
If you believe you can improve something in the agency then speak up. We will always listen to your ideas and suggestions.
We will not tolerate harassment, bullying or corporate politics. We will not tolerate discrimination of any kind. We expect you to be responsible on social media and remember that you represent the agency and should not bring us into disrepute.
We are committed to your learning and development. The agency will organize regular training to enhance and accelerate your career – we expect you to prioritize training and actively participate.
We strive for world-class work on every client, every time.
We believe that good enough is not good enough.

We are currently recruiting for a Data Analyst to join our growing Analytics team in Toronto. Analytics is the core of all decision-making at Initiative and as our newest Analyst, you’ll provide campaign intelligence to drive real business outcomes. We are looking for an analytical thinker with a love for using their technical knowledge to solve business problems and is experienced with KPI tracking/ reporting and data visualization techniques.

Position Summary:

The role of a Data Analyst is to provide business portfolio and digital media intelligence to make faster and more effective investment decisions to drive business outcomes.

Responsibilities:

Extract, review and prepare data on media campaign effectiveness to create regular client reports in Excel and Tableau, assisting in solving complex client problems
Design and build data visualizations and dashboards for the purposes of monitoring, understanding and optimizing media performance
Perform proactive and reactive analyses to ensure data integrity
Work closely with Business Intelligence team to continue to automate processes and ensure database architecture is adequate for growing client needs
Analyze data to recommend campaign execution and visualization improvements, based on data and observed trends
Use strong analytical skills, business acumen and attention to quality to provide data and analysis to assist in solving complex problems
Communicate insights and suggest improvements based on data and observed trends
Drive core insights from data to suggest, create and execute multivariate or a/b tests that drive fundamental improvements
Collaborate with Audience & Platforms team in developing advanced tagging strategies for measuring attribution and capturing multi-channel campaign performance across social, mobile, programmatic, managed service digital media, and e-commerce
Develop and present standard and ad-hoc reports and analysis to stakeholders across the organization
Work closely with Business Intelligence, to ensure timely and accurate maintenance of internal dashboards and data management
Perform proactive and reactive analyses to ensure data integrity
Create performance forecasts and track actual performance against forecasted plans

Qualifications:

BS/BA in Statistics, Economics, Math, Computer Science, Marketing or applicable experience
1-2 years of experience in an analytics based role
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Excel, SQL, or VBA
Knowledge of various measurement technologies: website traffic analytics software (tagging and log file based) such as Omniture (SiteCatalyst), Google Analytics, WebTrends, comScore, MOAT/ IAS, and social media analytics (Facebook Insights, Sysomos)
Experience working with MediaOcean Prisma and third-party ad-serving platforms (Sizmek/Campaign Manager)
Strong familiarity with using Tableau, Google Data Studio, DOMO or other reporting visualization platforms
Topline knowledge of social media marketing and programmatic buying
Strong problem solving, business analysis, and quantitative skills
Strong communication skills (verbal & written); ability to provide concise, clear reporting and actionable analysis
Ability to pull data from multiple sources and formulate comprehensive and actionable reports
Proven ability to self-check work to ensure results are error-free
Ability to plan, organize and work on multiple tasks simultaneously
Knowledge/ Familiarity of coding languages such as R, Phyton
Keenness to learn new platforms and technology
Mediabrands is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome and encourage applications from all interested parties. Accommodations are available, upon request, for those with a disability or medical need during any stage of the recruitment process. We thank all candidates for their interest in Mediabrands, however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Business Analyst
Description:
Bimbo Canada is a leading producer and distributor of packaged fresh bread and bakery products with brands such as Dempster’s®, Villaggio®, POM®, Bon Matin®, Ben’s®, Healthy Way® and McGavins®. Dempster’s is the national brand leader and a market leader in the health and well-being segment of bread products in Canada. The growth strategy is to focus on market leadership in all commercial bread categories. The company operates 19 bakeries and employs approximately 4,550 associates across Canada. It seeks to create value by leading innovation in products and service delivery in the bakery industry, enhancing distribution services and processes, and continuing to grow premium white and whole grain breads, tortillas, bagels, rye, buns, and rolls. As an independent business unit of Grupo Bimbo, Bimbo Canada seeks to grow value-added bakery segments by focusing on health and well-being and penetrating new bakery segments and channels of distribution. The business will continue to grow market leadership and margins by investing in the premium whole grain product category, and by delivering continued product innovation in other bakery and snack categories.

Bimbo Canada serves major grocery chains, retail outlets, and foodservice operations across Canada. The company distributes branded products in the discount, mainstream, and super-premium segments, and is the leading producer in most major bakery categories. It also produces private label products for grocery and foodservice outlet.

As part of Data Management office, this position is to assist the Data Management Office in the execution of data governance framework, policy and standards. The Data Business Analyst is responsible for the execution of the Data Governance Program, with a balance of meeting business needs and maintaining best practices and standards. The individual will work closely with Governance Council members, data governance stakeholders and software development teams to maintain currency of Enterprise Data assets including but not limited to: cross-functional alignment on business terms, cataloging self-serve data sets and metadata management.

Key Responsibilities:
Ensure master data integrity in key systems as well as maintaining the processes to support the data quality.
Identify areas for data quality improvements and help resolve data quality problems through the appropriate choice of error detection and correction, process control and improvement, or process design strategies.
Ensure quality of master data in key systems and develop/document processes with other functional data owners to support ongoing maintenance and data integrity.
In collaboration with subject matter experts and data stewards, define and implement data strategy, policies, controls, and programs to ensure the enterprise data is accurate, complete, secure, and reliable.
Develop scripts and/or processes based on the MDM business rules for each data quality dimensions such as completeness, uniqueness, consistency, integrity, accuracy, and timeliness as defined for each data element.
Work with Data owners and Stewards to define and create standard and custom data quality profiling rules and standard rules and set up for monitoring DQ on a regular frequency.
Ability to express oneself clearly in conversations and interactions with others. Tailors the content of speech to the level and experience of the audience.
Possesses excellent writing and grammar skills, including the ability to write concisely, clearly, and logically
Prioritize, multi- task and manage increasing demands
Understands the factors influencing our business and can integrate the various competing needs to ensure success for their group. Approach problems from a business perspective
Generates new ideas, challenges the status quo, takes risks, supports change, encourages innovation, solves problems creatively
Facilitate and participate in day-to-day data cleansing activities
Maintain good communication with business partners regarding master data requests
Qualifications:
University Degree (preferred in Business Administration or Information Management)
3+ years formal Data Management & Data Quality experience
