Title: BI Data Analyst
Description:
Job Details
Description
Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Reports to: Manager BI & Data Integrity
Based at: 9 Napoleon Rd., Barrie, Ontario
Job Purpose: The Business Intelligence (BI) Data Analyst (BI Data Analyst) manages in-house data models, prediction models and systems to ensure high levels of accuracy and integrity. This includes planning, designing, developing, implementing, supporting, and optimizing all BI data models, meta-data and prediction models. The successful candidate must have management skills to drive projects to completion on schedule with team members and mid-level business professionals.

Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities:
Technical implementation and ongoing management and continuous improvement of data models, meta-data models, mining models, and machine learning models which include regression, classification and unsupervised learning.
Collaborate with BI group and department leads in delivering a working prediction models to meet business objectives for forecast accuracy.
Oversees the machine learning architecture resulting in the delivery of production prediction model results to business stakeholders.
Driven from business requirements, architects, implements and builds solutions to assist in the generation of prediction models that add value to the business and partner with stakeholders from the business for successful deployment.
Leads the BI group in the creation and maintenance of machine learning tools, meta-data, prediction models, validation/testing of models, model change management and model design methodology. Rationalizes new model requires to avoid excessive complexity and assist other business analysts in use and application of model.
Provide input into the development of model testing strategies and plans to ensure models are always up to date and relevant. Validate that developed solutions align with defined business objectives.
Provide technical documentation and technical support for existing models, meta-data catalogs, or other tools. Maintain a library of model documents, templates, or other reusable knowledge
Develop statistical methods for evaluating information accuracy and ensure data published in BI solutions meets business expectations for data quality.
Analyze and resolve end user problems related to databases and data warehouses, reports in a timely and accurate fashion, and provides end user training where required.
Contribute to the strategic direction of the BI platform, the creation of the BI roadmap, the selection of new tools, and the overall integrity of model delivery. Expand knowledge of broader range of Business Intelligence products and tools

Education and Experience:
University degree in computer science, mathematics, finance, statistics or equivalent experience.
A master’s degree in any of these and/or a core data science curriculum is highly desired.
Strong understanding data analysis, SQL queries, advanced statistics, machine learning and business intelligence report applications required.
Proficient with the design of data models, prediction models, and implementation user machine learning solutions based upon business requirements and content knowledge.
Advanced statistics including probability, descriptive statistics, distributions, correlation, inference, T-tests, linear/multiple regression, ANOVA, etc.
Advanced skills in one or more Statistical computing languages such as R/Studio and/or Python/Anaconda.
Experience using predictive machine learning model building packages such as R/Studio CARET and/or Python/Anaconda Sci-kit learn/statsmodels/sciblox.
Solid understanding of model building activities including preprocessing, imputation, unskewing, normalizing, standardizing, removing outliers, and splitting data (training, testing and hold-out).
Ability to diagnose and improve models using statistical model diagnostics such as RMSE, MAPE, AIC, goodness of fit, sensitivity, specificity, receiver operating characteristics, etc.
Previous business experience architecting, implementing, and developing machine learning models considered an asset.
Knowledge of one or more Data Warehouse design methodologies and implementation (Inmon CIF, Kimball Dimensional, Data Vault 2.0) with preference to Kimball or Data Vault 2.0.
Microsoft SQL server knowledge and experience.
SQL language skills (SQL, MDX, DDL, DML, DQL, DCL, ADX, XML)
Knowledge of data governance including meta-data and data modelling.
Prior experience with report writing tools (Business Objects, Crystal Reports, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, Looker, DundasBI, SiSense, Reporting Services) considered an asset.
Intermediate Excel/Access skills, including VBA scripting considered an asset.
Intermediate PowerPoint, Word, Visio skills considered an asset.
Active collaborator and listener with excellent oral, written, presentation, one-on-one and group communication skills.
Demonstrated ability to learn quickly and produce results.
Organized, thoughtful and likes to make a difference by sharing knowledge with others and seeing improvements.
Energetic, positive, driven and independent.
Objective driven yet tactful and respectful of others' contributions.
Thinks broadly, resolves problems, and has ability to see multiple perspectives on issues.
Manages competing priories in an effective and positive manner.
Experience interacting directly with customers to elicit, document, and implement solutions
Demonstrates Intermediate project management skills

Title: Data Integrity Analyst
Description:
Located in Red Deer, Peavey Industries LP is the head office of Peavey Mart, MainStreet Hardware, TSC Stores and Ace Canada.
We are 100% Canadian owned and operated.
Peavey is an engaging workplace. We are proud to promote from within and provide training to make this possible. We offer flex-time and comprehensive benefits.
Peavey Industries is the head office for four farm and ranch retail banners in Canada offering a unique selection of agriculture, farm and ranch, pet, work wear, lawn and garden, hardware and homesteading supplies for those who enjoy a down-to-earth rural lifestyle.
We are committed to Canadians, connected through communities.
We're looking for a Data Integrity Analyst to join our team!
Data Integrity Analyst
Reports to: Supply Chain & Inventory Replenishment Manager
Department: Inventory
Job Purpose: The Data Integrity Analyst is responsible identifying sku set up and replenishment issues, developing documentation and tools to streamline the current sku set up/maintenance process; and measure/report key replenishment KPIs.
Essential Job Results
Be an essential part of the Supply Chain team, working with other teams, to deliver an excellent in-store experience for our customers.
To be a knowledge expert for SKU replenishment settings and processes.
Set data standards and clearly define the range of acceptable values and attributes for SKU data.
Ensure completeness, accuracy and integrity of sku level data.
Be an owner of the replenishment KPI process through the development and reporting of key metrics.
Develop reporting to identify sku set-up issues and extract data directly from the MMS system.
Develop new processes to simplify and streamline the current sku set-up and maintenance procedures.
Use safe work procedures while setting a good example to fellow employees.
Carry out work in a manner that will not create a hazard to themselves or others
Work with co-workers and members of the Safety Committee to help create a safe working environment by making safety suggestions and recommendations
Report and accidents, incidents, near misses, injuries, and/or occupational health concerns to a safety committee member
Follow Peavey Industries L.P. medical and first aid procedures
Positively communicate and demonstrate the company’s Core Values
Included in this list, are any additional tasks as assigned by Supervisor

None
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required
Attention to detail to ensure data accuracy.
Knowledge of the MMS system, Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Power BI.
Knowledge of SQL coding, extracting data from databases and building reporting tools.
Excellent communication skills with ability to work effectively with business partners and all levels of team members.
Self-starter, efficient and organized in a fast-paced exciting environment.
Prioritization, time management and multi-tasking are essential to meet deadlines.
Able to gather information and translate information in business insights that can be easily understood and utilized.
Proficient computer skills.
Job Qualifications
Business Degree or Diploma or relevant experience.
Retail experience considered an asset.
Merchandising or Supply Chain experience considered an asset.

Close vision requirements due to computer work
Use hands and fingers to operate a computer, keyboard reach
Sitting for long periods of time
There is an old saying that people can learn work skills, but cannot learn a good attitude - that has to come from within. If you want to contribute to the success and profitability of the organization, while working alongside a great team, then this may be the role for you!

Title: Sr. Data Analyst
Description:
Auto req ID: 219140BR
Job Description
We are a growing team focused on accelerating consumer demand through data science and advanced analytics. We are aligning global PepsiCo teams to build an impactful analytics portfolio. We work with Shopper Insights, Shopper Marketing, Category Leadership, and Space Engineering resources to support Sales and Marketing plans for global, enterprise, national, and regional customers across the PepsiCo portfolio. This approach allows us to build best-in-class capabilities, develop deep functional expertise, and offer focused programs to drive growth with our customers. The Demand Accelerator team helps PepsiCo connect with consumers and provide our customers with cutting edge data and insights, as well as, personalized solutions to drive incremental growth for both our customers and PepsiCo.

Help us build processes to share our global solutions and solve new and exciting questions with data analysis, advanced analytics, and a love of problem solving. As a member of an Advanced Analytics and Insights team you will help drive actionable insights for our shoppers across the entire PepsiCo portfolio. Your analysis will be used to create new strategies and apply new analytical processes that will be shared with internal PepsiCo teams as well as with major and local global retailers.

Key Responsibilities and Key Accountabilities:

As a Sr. Data Analyst, you will serve as a critical member of the Shopper Insights team helping us advance the thinking and capabilities of PepsiCo across all brands and impact shoppers and consumers across global retailers of all types and sizes. You will operate across a highly-matrixed, multinational organization and help drive the organization’s efforts to drive its strategic advantage through more in-depth analysis of structured, semi-structured and unstructured data. You will also manage the data extract for advanced analytic and capability projects across the globe and PepsiCo brands.

To do well in this role you need a very fine eye for detail, experience as a data analyst, and understanding of the popular data analysis tools and databases such as SQL, SQL Server, R, and Tableau. This individual will be responsible for managing and prepping data streams: Internal Shipments, POS, and consumer data to support different markets
Qualifications/Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, Business, or a related field
3-4+ years of experience with data analytics
Must know how to write SQL and extract data from large and small databases
Ability to evaluate existing tools and databases and provide software solution recommendations
Ability to translate business and technical requirements into non-technical terms
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases
High-level written and verbal communication skills
Provide ad-hoc analysis and deliverables as requested
Experience using Tableau and other Visual Analytics tools
Results oriented with the ability to complete assignments in a timely manner
Proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint with the ability to quickly learn various in-house applications
Detail-oriented with dedication to continuous improvement
Preferred Qualifications:
Ability to function well in a team environment
Ability to prioritize among multiple priorities
Ability to work with minimal supervision
Cross functional experience working with other functions, e.g., Sales, Marketing, and IT functions
Strong analytical skills. Ability to provide insight as well as analysis
Excellent verbal & written communication skills and strong influence management
Basic programming experience in R or Python
Experience with IRI: building ad-hoc reports
Experience using Teradata, Hadoop/hive
Technical experience on data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing
Ability to present quantitative data in an easy-to-understand manner that balances both analytics as well as business implications
Relocation Eligible: Not Eligible for Relocation
Job Type: Regular

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Why join us?
Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor? If so, we would love to tell you our story.At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe. Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

OMERS Products and Technology is looking for Data Engineer passionate about all sides of data analytics and eager to build a data platform for our pension Data engineering team. The individual should be extremely motivated and want to constantly learn and apply new technologies. In this role, the qualified candidate is expected to drive actionable insights; transforming, modelling, processing and extracting value from datasets.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide regular, timely, accurate reports and dashboards
Gathering business requirements and document following Agile Practice
Work with business to prioritize business data needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Collaborate with pension business users to understand their data visualization requirements
Produce engaging data visualization that effectively bring data insights to life
Understand and communicate complex business concerns and solutions in clear and concise manner
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and clean data by reviewing reports
To succeed in this role, you have:
Must have 3+ years of Hands on experience with Tableau Desktop, Tableau Server and Tableau Prep.
Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
Good Understanding of Data Warehouse concepts such as Star Schema and BI architecture.
Ability to design and build reports, dashboards, data visualizations and analytics using Tableau Desktop and Tableau Server.
Ability to write complex queries using SQL.
Proven Hands on experience with Tableau deployment Pipelines.
Good Knowledge and understanding of Data Governance and Security Measures.
Exposure to GCP Cloud Technology is an asset.
Exposure to Big Query and Python is an asset.
Certified in Tableau is an asset.
Good hands on experience working with streaming data.
Have experience in Analyzing the BI needs, interpreting business user requirements and translating them into reports.
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and visualize the data.
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Knowledge of SDLC Process.
Ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently and meet the deadlines
Ability to take initiative, multi-task and work in an agile environment
A team player and motivated self-starter
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical field
Our story:
ABOUT OMERS
Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $109 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2019. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate. OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

Title: CO-OP, Data Science Analyst, Pricing & Promo
Description:

1 Presidents Choice Circle, Brampton, Ontario, L6Y 5S5

1 Presidents Choice Circle, Brampton, Ontario, L6Y 5S5

The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.

Why is this role important?
Data Science Analyst (COOP), Price and Promo Data Science, Data Insights & Analytics
The Data, Insights & Analytics (DI&A) team covers the data-focused spectrum from data governance and management through data engineering. We also cover the data analytics spectrum from ad-hoc database queries through to machine learning models. As Canada’s largest retailer, we are uniquely positioned to leverage data driven insights to deliver the needs of our customers. Our culture – Smart, Nice and Curious operates at the center of everything we do and is a critical part of who we are. Join us help Canadians live life well through the power of data, insights & analytics.

What you will do:
Extract and prepare data using a combination of different tools including SQL, Python and PySpark, Databricks and GCP
Create Python programs and machine learning models to solve business needs
Support the gathering and documentation of business processes related to areas of opportunities
Uncover insights and build strategic recommendations that support objectives for the Inventory management team.
Strictly adhere to legal and compliance guidelines; regarding access and exposure to sensitive and confidential information
What you will bring:
University degree or Master’s degree in an analytical field of study (e.g. Statistics, Economics,
Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Finance)
1-3 years of experience working with large data sets and analytic tools
1-3 years of experience with SQL and Python

A team player and self-starter

Title: Sr Analyst, Business Data
Business Analyst – Data & Analytics
Description:
We are looking for a Senior Business
Analyst for IFRS17 project who can work with finance business, IT teams and
external stakeholders to build the solution for Finance.

You will

Analyze business needs with our users in order to define IT functional
solutions for data integration and consumption.

and priorities, write user stories, groom product and sprint back log with the

Work with architects, developers and testers during the development of the
solution.

Support the development of solutions and the performed analysis.

degree in a field related to data integration.

in business intelligence/ data warehouse environment

About Cognizant Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Do you want to be a part of one of the fastest growing industries worldwide? We're looking for an experienced Data Analyst interested in joining our growing team. The ideal candidate is independent and enthusiastic with a strong desire to learn and grow within the role.
Our culture lends itself to people who are self-starters and able to work well in a collaborative environment. We work hard but we enjoy what we do and we take our lunches very seriously.

RESPONSIBILITIES
The Data Analyst will derive insights from data for EQʼs clients, and will serve as the primary analytics contact for client teams. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.

Responsibilities include:
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in data sets
Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintaining dashboards
Liaising with clients on all data related activities
Trafficking media campaigns and generating campaign reports
Generating reports and providing assistance to the team where needed
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Understand the day-to-day issues that our business faces, which can be better understood with data
Compile and analyze data related to business' issues
Develop clear visualizations to convey complicated data in a straightforward fashion
Requirements
Our goal is to provide our team members with solid learning experiences and an opportunity to be a part of something substantial. The candidate should have:
College or University Degree
At least 1–2 years experience managing clients or accounts
Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent written and communication skills
Strong organizational and time-management skills
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision

This is a full-time position and we offer competitive salary and benefits. The position reports to the Sr. Director, Operations @ EQ Works.
Benefits

Currently remote work due to the pandemic
Health benefits
Tea/Coffee Bar
In-office Snacks
An awesome team to work with!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Smile is the largest provider of reward programs in the world. We reward tens of millions of people every year, and power rewards programs for thousands of businesses around the world. With all this data, we’re looking for a talented Data Analyst to join the growing Data Science team. The ideal candidate is data curious, detail-oriented, great at communication, and loves solving problems. We’ve got big scaling plans in 2020 and beyond - we need amazing talent to achieve our goals and you get to be the one to find them and bring them to Smile!
Requirements
Apply your knowledge of SQL, data modelling, programming, statistics, and mathematics to recognize patterns and answer business questions
Support our long-term data and analytics strategy with respect to data warehousing, data visualization, and self-service reporting
Work closely with Merchant Experience, Product, and Finance teams to identify important questions, define key success metrics, and shape data-informed product/business strategies
Develop strong hypotheses, independently solve problems and influence major business decisions with sound data and reasoning
Perform code reviews and mentoring of more junior analysts on best practices and trade-offs
Immediate Challenges:
Jumping in and getting your hands dirty with large-scale datasets
Thinking about the big picture to help develop our longer-term data strategy
Contributing to the conceptualization of the overall Data strategy at Smile


What we’re seeking:
3+ years of experience in a Data Analyst role or related position
Expert knowledge of SQL for data analysis and drawing insights across large and complex datasets. Bonus if you have knowledge in Python too!
A love of solving complex business problems using your strong analytical skills
Self-motivated and independent, ability to learn and thrive in a fast-paced environment
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to clearly explain technical terms to a non-technical audience
Experience and passion for developing the right metrics and dashboards/visualization


Traits or experience we’d love to see (you don’t need them all to apply!):
Experience with delivering and presenting information to an audience
Hands-on experience with DBT, Snowflake and visualization platforms
Equivalent experience or Post-Secondary education in Computer Science, Software Engineering, statistics, economics, mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline
Benefits
What’s it like to work at Smile.io?
We are a team of smart self-starters who build efficient and unique solutions to problems. You’ll be working with some amazing talent and you'll constantly be pushed to challenge yourself and improve your skills. This starts in the interview process, where you’ll be asked to show us your skills in real-time. It’s not an easy process, but we think you’ll find it rewarding and a great preview to what working here is really like.

As a team, we’re driven by these core values:
Be Humble - think of the team before thinking of yourself. We have no room for massive egos.
Be Hungry - set hard goals, ask lots of questions and learn every day.
Be Human - show empathy towards others, consider the impact of your decisions on other teams.
We collaborate on everything. Our communication tools and our space are designed with this in mind - from physical areas to connect in comfort to Slack channels of all sorts, we enable you to reach out to those around you to make sure you have the information you need to make great decisions.
We know that Smile.io as a business is in constant evolution - the same is true of our people. We’re here to support each other in our growth, so we talk openly about our career goals, hopes & dreams. With such a diverse team of people, we know we can offer you the mentorship, tools and encouragement you need to grow. We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.

Title: Cost Analyst, Data Management and Analytics
Description:
Job Category:
Cost Consulting and Project Management
Opportunity Awaits at Altus Group!
The opportunity
As a result of accelerated growth and our commitment to innovation, Altus is looking for a new Cost Analyst, Data Management and Analytics . In this newly created position, you will be working directly with our Senior Director, David Schoonjan s on this exciting new service line. This is a rare opportunity to utilize your cost consulting education and knowledge in unique ways. Altus Group is working toward creating a robust data warehouse where we will be able to analyze and extract data and value - at scale - for internal purposes as well as a key strategic differentiator within the industry at large. You’ll be the first to ensure that the data is clean, validated and by through working with the team, contributing to building meaningful data visualizations with impact.
Who you are
You are early in your career in Cost Estimating or Quantity Surveying and understand structural, civil, financial, and business needs within the Construction industry. You are looking for a role where you can utilize your core construction knowledge as well as develop your interest in technology. You may even have taught yourself SQL, Python or Tableau. You are analytical and detail-oriented, curious about how things work, how to make them better and can make connections with your colleagues and clients to gain their trust. You may just starting working for a competitor, and you are seeking a step up or in a different direction to your current role, and are looking to work for the leading Cost Consulting business in Canada that continuously looks for ways to add move value to our clients and the industry.
What you will do:
Participate in the collecting, structuring, cleansing and analyzing of Cost related data: You will:
Read and understand construction drawings and specifications at an advanced level.
Review and provide guidance on measurement of project statistics/functional areas
Completion of project descriptions & assumptions
Participate in leveraging the data to drive efficiency and add value: You will utilize:
Practical understanding of construction methodology
Trade/product knowledge
Utilize your ability to prepare and complete trade/elemental take-offs based on preliminary design and construction documents
Understanding of Mechanical & Electrical systems
Understanding of factors influencing construction costs and applying that knowledge to pricing estimates
Support the implementation of strategies which contribute to revenue generation, profitability and growth of the Business Unit. You will:
Maximize the use of appropriate software and technology and teach others how to do the same such as Cost X, Revit and CAD.
Our new Cost Analyst, Data Management and Analytics will have:
The education. You have a degree or diploma in Architecture, Construction or Civil Technology, Construction Management, Quantity Surveying, Building Science, or a related field. You are working towards a PQS designation, CIQS/RICS membership, or LEED accreditation.
1-2 years of hands-on construction industry expertise. You have a basic understanding of construction estimates, contracting, procurement, and scheduling for commercial development projects. You have strong knowledge of CIQS standard method of measurement, both elemental and trade, provincial lien acts, and CCDC standard contract conditions.
Technology skills. You are comfortable with Sharepoint and MS Office, including Project. Ideally, you have hands-on exposure to CostX. You are curious about technology, and may have taught yourself Python, SQL or had some previous exposure to Tableau.
Transparent communication style. You are an outstanding communicator who can clarify ambiguities and present information in a way that is structured and makes sense. You can relay delays and setbacks while managing expectations and retaining the client's confidence.
A results-oriented focus. You can anticipate, understand, and respond to the needs of clients, and you are driven to meet or exceed their expectations. You can innovate solutions to keep the project - and the business - moving forward.
Appreciation for cross-team collaboration. You can influence without authority and roll up your sleeves as a critical member of a cross-functional team.
Come realize your potential at Altus Group!
Altus Group is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment where employees feel valued and respected, and where every employee has the opportunity to realize their potential. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required, and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please contact us at accessibility@altusgroup.com or 416-641-9500.

Title: HR Operations Analyst (Employee Data Mgt)
Description:
This is your opportunity to join AXIS Capital – a trusted global provider of specialty lines insurance and reinsurance. We stand apart for our outstanding client service, intelligent risk taking and superior risk adjusted returns for our shareholders. We also proudly maintain an entrepreneurial, disciplined and ethical corporate culture. As a member of AXIS, you join a team that is among the best in the industry.
BRIEF DESCRIPTION:
Requires strong working knowledge of HR functions (e.g., Compensation, Benefits, Talent Management) combined with deep knowledge of Workday functionality, data structures, and business processes. Ideal candidate will operate in a global fast-paced environment to develop solutions and support HR operations. P rovide hands-on support of operational activities across data, processes, structure, reporting, and testing. The overall objective is to provide advanced Workday expertise for operational support to all HR CoEs and HR Business Partners.
KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Act as the primary contact and subject matter expert for daily Workday operational support
Participate in all Workday projects, BAU, and cyclical HR events (e.g., YE Comp)
Assist in Employee Data Management (e.g., employee lifecycle transactions) and establish appropriate auditing and monitoring of HR data to ensure accuracy
Manage, create and update HR and Workday business process documentation, standard operating procedures, operational guides, end-user documents, quick guides, and FAQs
Support HRIS team and HR operations in regulatory reporting requirements
Assist with testing, controls and documentation alongside release of any new functionality or changes to current configuration environment
Assist with EIBs and all data needs
Assist with all compensation related activities including salary grade configuration, compensation review process and total rewards
DATA:
Provide leadership and governance of all employee and reference data across the HR ecosystem. To Include: (Reference data: Position Management maintenance, Organizational data and structure, Job profile design and attributes); (Employee data: Personal data, Comp data, Benefits data, Payroll data, Talent data etc.)
Expand data audit processes to proactively identify issues in all HR systems and across major business processes. Design and operationalize data integrity checks for completeness, quality and adherence to policy
REQUIRED EDUCATION/TRAINING & EXPERIENCE:
Workday HCM subject matter expert with 1-3 years of Human Resources Operations and Project Management experience
Strong knowledge of HR processes and procedures
Experienced in managing projects (business requirements gathering, time-management/milestone achievement, budget management, development and delivery of communication and change management, interdependencies/matrix management).
Strong oral and written communication skills including executive level presentation skills with the ability to represent Global HR on cross functional projects and make recommendation to key executives. Can present complex information to leadership in a compelling manner.
Forms productive networks with internal and/or external customers and the professional/technical community
Effective influencing and collaborative skills
Works on complex issues where analysis requires an in-depth assessment, considering many variables, and potential consequences and risk to the business
Functions independently with limited work direction. Work is reviewed periodically and on an exception basis. Commits to deliverables with customers and/or management
KEY WORKING RELATIONSHIPS:
CoEs - Compensation, Benefits, Talent Management
HRIT
HR Business Partners
Finance (planning & budgeting)
Vendors
External consultants

Title: CO-OP, Data Science Analyst, Asset Protection
Description:
Lieu:
1 Presidents Choice Circle, Brampton, Ontario, L6Y 5S5
C’est toute une décision que de se joindre à une entreprise. Nous offrons des perspectives d’emploi à des personnes qui, comme vous, sont travaillantes, dynamiques et fiables.
Pourquoi ce role est-il important?
Data Science Analyst (COOP), Asset Protection, Data Insights & Analytics
The Data, Insights & Analytics (DI&A) team covers the data-focused spectrum from data governance and management through data engineering. We also cover the data analytics spectrum from ad-hoc database queries through to machine learning models. As Canada’s largest retailer, we are uniquely positioned to leverage data driven insights to deliver the needs of our customers. Our culture – Smart, Nice and Curious operates at the center of everything we do and is a critical part of who we are. Join us help Canadians live life well through the power of data, insights & analytics.
Why this role is important?
This encompasses analyzing large amounts of data generated at the stores through the Point of Sale system (POS). We mostly work with un-supervised learning methods trying to identify outliers and classifying or scoring transactions according to risk. These scores are later used by the business to investigate malfeasance.
What you will do:
Extract and prepare data using a combination of different tools including SQL, Python and PySpark
Create Python programs and machine learning models to solve business needs
Support the gathering and documentation of business processes related to areas of opportunities
Uncover insights and build strategic recommendations that support objectives for the Inventory management team.
Strictly adhere to legal and compliance guidelines; regarding access and exposure to sensitive and confidential information
Design and build interactive and static data visualizations to provide actionable insights and enable strategic business decisions through data and insights driven storytelling
Build statistical, descriptive and predictive models to support experimentation that are easily understood and replicated
Support the gathering and documentation of such processes
What you will bring:
Working toward a University degree or Master’s degree in an analytical field of study (e.g. Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Finance)
1-3 years of experience working with large data sets and analytic tools
1-3 years of experience with SQL and Python
Working knowledge of machine learning techniques, such as scikit-learn, Keras / Tensorflow
Experience with time-series is an asset
Data mining experience working with a large relational database is an asset
Superb analytical and conceptual thinking skills; to not only manipulate but also derive meaningful interpretations from data
Ability to take initiative, multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment
Strong detail orientation is essential in this role
A team player and self-starter
Comment R é ussir:
Chez Loblaw, nous recherchons toujours des personnes formidables pour continuellement renforcer notre culture. Nous croyons que les gens formidables façonnent nos valeurs, sont authentiques, bâtissent la confiance et créent des liens.
Si cela vous ressemble et que vous êtes ouvert d’esprit, que vous avez une bonne attitude face aux changements et que vous aimez les défis d’un environnement de travail aux détails dynamiques, postulez aujourd’hui.
En outre, nous croyons que la conformité aux lois consiste à faire ce qu'il faut. Le respect de la loi fait partie de notre Code de conduite; il renforce ce que nos clients et nos parties prenantes attendent de nous.
Type d'emploi:
Temps plein
Role:
Poste de travail coopératif (Durée déterminée) (inactif)
Type of Contract:
Loblaw considère que la diversité culturelle du Canada est une source de fierté nationale et un symbole de force. Nous nous sommes donné comme priorité de refléter la diversité croissante du Canada dans les produits que nous vendons, les gens que nous embauchons et notre culture d’entreprise. Des accommodements sont disponibles sur demande pour les postulants et collègues atteints d’un handicap.

Title: Data Analysts - Pipeline Inspection (ILI), All Levels
Description:
Onstream Pipeline Inspection Services Inc is a growing provider of inline inspection services to pipeline operators in Canada and the USA. Due to continued growth, Onstream is now accepting applications for the positions of Data Analysts (ILI, All Levels), based in Calgary, AB. The successful candidates will show a progressive work history of ILI Analysis along with having an analytical background, ability to learn/use proprietary software, and apply technical concepts quickly. This position requires the analysis of data recorded by Onstream Pipeline’s MFL/Caliper/IMU in-line inspection (ILI) tools, correlation to verification measurements, and final report generation.
Key Responsibilities and Duties:
Perform preliminary data quality assessments.
Process and interpret datasets for acceptance.
Interpret MFL and Geometry pipeline inspection data to determine defects location and depth on oil and gas pipelines.
Correlate analysis results to inspection data from previous runs.
Organize and produce reports of ILI tool analysis results as per client requirements.
Interface with clients via telephone, email and in person. Communicate analysis findings and provide support for excavations and measurement results.
Work in a team environment collaborating and sharing knowledge and experiences.
Education / Experience / Certifications:
Degree or diploma in a related field; or equivalent combination of experience and education
Level 1/2/3 MFL/GEO historical certification
3+ years progressive Data Analysis experience in an inline inspection environment (preferred), in MFL, Caliper, or Inertial analysis capacity
Experience and/or training in non-destructive testing (NDT) is an Asset
Knowledge of pipeline safety and compliance regulations (AER/NEB/PHMSA) is required
Skill Required:
Self Driven. Ability to work diligently with minimal supervision
Strong Computer Skills (MS Excel, Word, Adobe Acrobat)
Ability to complete tasks fully in a timely and quality manner
Ability to maintain poise, quality of work and efficiency during busy times
Strong analytical and interpretive skills
Ability to evaluate and prioritize tasks
Ability to maintain concentration throughout work day
Strong social skills for communicating with co-workers and clients
Professional personal presentation
Willingness to work overtime during busy times
Thank you for submitting your Application! Successful candidates will need to pass pre-employment Background Screening. Please note that only those selected for consideration will be contacted.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Benefits:
Casual dress
Dental care
Disability insurance
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
Life insurance
On-site parking
Paid time off
Vision care
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Overtime
Experience:
ILI Data Analysis: 3 years (Preferred)
API 1163 Standards: 3 years (Preferred)
ANSI/ANT ILI-PQ-2017 Standards: 3 years (Preferred)
Education:
AEC / DEP or Skilled Trade Certificate (Preferred)
Location:
Calgary, AB (Required)
Licence:
Level 1 ILI or above (Required)
Language:
English (Required)
Work remotely:
No

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Air
Description:
At Hopper, we’re on a mission to make booking travel faster, easier, and more transparent. We are leveraging the power that comes from combining massive amounts of data and machine learning to build the world’s fastest-growing travel app - one that enables our customers to save money and travel more. With over $235M CAD in funding from leading investors in both Canada and the US, Hopper is primed to continue its path toward becoming the go-to way to book travel as the world continues its shift to mobile.

Recognized as the fastest-growing travel app by Forbes and one of the world’s most innovative companies by Fast Company two years in a row, Hopper has been downloaded over 40 million times and has helped travelers plan over 100 million trips and counting. The app has received high praise in the form of mobile accolades such as the Webby Award for Best Travel App of 2019, the Google Play Award for Standout Startup of 2016 and Apple’s App Store Best of 2015.

Take off with us!

THE ROLE
Hopper is looking for a data-savvy individual to lead data-centric product development and complex business intelligence projects within our core air travel business unit. In this role you would draw powerful insights from our real-time feed of billions of flight search results and archives of several trillion data points. To succeed at Hopper you need the talent, passion, and experience to thrive in a highly performing company.

IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL:

Frame and conduct complex exploratory analyses needed to deepen our understanding of Hopper users.
Partner with product, business and strategy teams to leverage this user understanding to drive product improvements and other initiatives
Use machine learning and big data tools on tremendously large and complex data sets to enhance our data-driven, personalized travel advice
Construct and manage a continuous series of A/B experiments to measure the business impact of both user facing and back end system changes
Conduct research into various aspects of our business and employ statistical and modeling techniques when appropriate to make recommendations to non-technical stakeholders
Create advanced dashboards for product experiment tracking and business unit performance analysis using Amplitude and Tableau
Find effective ways to simplify and communicate analyses to a non-technical audience.

A PERFECT CANDIDATE HAS:

A degree in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or another quantitative discipline
Extremely strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience with data mining, machine learning, statistical modeling tools and underlying algorithms
At least 3 years of professional work experience at a Business to Consumer company
Proven ability to communicate complex technical output to a non-technical audience
A strong passion for and extensive experience in conducting empirical research and answering hard questions with data
Demonstrated expertise with a data visualization tool (Tableau preferred) and project analysis tool such as Amplitude
Skills working with relational databases and SQL, especially Hive and Google Big Query
Experience working with extremely large data sets
Experience in Pandas, R, SAS or other tools appropriate for large scale data preparation and analysis
Proficiency with Unix/Linux environments as well as GCP

BENEFITS

Well-funded and proven startup with large ambitions, competitive salary and stock options
Dynamic and entrepreneurial team where pushing limits is everyday business
100% employer paid medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance plans
Access to a 401k (US) or Retirement Savings Plan (Canada)

Title: Data Analyst - Internal Audit
Business Data Analyst
Description:
David Aplin Group, one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, has partnered with our client to recruit for a Business Data Analyst, based in Calgary, AB.

Our Calgary client requires a Business Data Analyst to design, maintain, analyze and deliver a comprehensive suite of operational reports and analytics utilizing business data and statistical methods to provide insight that will assist with driving business planning, decision-making and initiatives throughout the organization. This is a permanent role.

The Role:
Work with management to elicit, document and analyze reporting needs and requirements
Effectively translate business problems into analysis solutions
Prepare reports and analyze the existing portfolio for trends and performance
Accurately design, build and deliver a comprehensive reporting suite to management
Data visualization to present graphical analysis in a unique and meaningful way
Effectively translate business and project needs into data extraction and manipulation plans
Ability to transform data into business insights and actionable recommendations
Source, extract, clean and transform data to meet project plans
Translate technical terms to non-technical users
Ability to deliver meaningful and impactful reporting that enables insights and solutions
The Ideal Candidate:
8+ years of hands-on business and data analysis experience in a business environment
Stakeholder management
Experience and strong skills with SQL, SSRS, Report Manager, Visual Studio, SharePoint
Advanced experience with Microsoft Stack
Some experience with Power BI
Degree in Statistics, Math, Engineering, Computer Science, Business, Commerce or a related technical field
If you are interested in this position and meet the above criteria, please click the Apply button to send your resume in confidence directly to Meagan Tunley, Consultant, Aplin Information Technology. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

WE APPRECIATE YOUR INTEREST IN DAVID APLIN GROUP.

If this is your first introduction to us, we invite you to become one of our satisfied candidates. David Aplin Group has been Canadian owned since 1975. Our professional consultants are passionate about helping you find a fulfilling job or career and ensuring your complete satisfaction with our process. Our proven track record, nearly 4 decades long, is largely due to our team of highly skilled and successful specialists. Through superior service and a commitment to long-term relationships, we provide deep specialization in core areas for complete recruiting and HR solutions across Canada - all from one source. We look forward to exceeding your expectations!

Learn more about David Aplin Group and view all of our current job opportunities, career tips, and tools at www.aplin.com. #LI-CAL

Title: Equity Data Analyst
Description:
About the Role
Morningstar Research Inc. is a leading provider of independent investment research. Our mission is to create great products that help investors reach their financial goals. We offer an extensive line of Internet, software, and print-based products for individual investors, financial advisors, and institutional clients around the world.
We are currently seeking an Equity Data Analyst (entry level) to join the CPMS product line of our business. The office is located in downtown Toronto, within walking distance of Union Station (subway, GO trains). We provide flexible working hours.
Working with our Equity Data team of Analysts, you will maintain financial databases for equities listed on Canadian and American stock exchanges. The successful candidate will possess analytical skills, solid mathematical and database knowledge and have the ability to work in a team environment.
Job Responsibilities
Responsibilities
Reviewing, analyzing and inputting of press releases and financial reports from public companies
Accumulating, monitoring and reviewing estimates supplied by the brokerage community
Increasing the CPMS equity universe coverage
Participating in projects designed to improve the efficiency of internal processes or enhance the CPMS product line
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree with intermediate level financial accounting courses which focused on consolidations and future income taxes

Canadian Securities Course is recommended

Title: SAP/Systems Master Data Analyst
Description:
Core Responsibilities:
Day-to-day creation and maintenance of SAP Master Data. Define, update and implement master data standards. Validation of master data to ensure they meet standards. Support implementation of Winshuttle & LSMW (Legacy System Migration Workbench) data upload tools. Support ongoing master data clean-up projects. Assist with change management activities. Assist in the investigation, identification and resolution of system issues in relation to master data. Business role testing, user reviews and access request compilations. Manage demand ticket items relating to master data. Coordinate and deliver client training sessions related to use of SAP Master Data. Develop and review process documentation. Troubleshoot and work with stakeholders to provide value and solution-oriented results. Complete work with excellent attention to detail & data accuracy. Generate reports on inputted data to drive strategic decision making. Work with Excel, Word and Access to complete requests and meet business needs. Responsible for client relationship management. Assist in the preparation of information to support audit requirements. Build and maintain effective relationships with stakeholder groups and other master data teams.
Decision Making: Makes decisions using established guidelines, procedures and/or policies, within level of accountability. Applies strong knowledge of SAP application and systems knowledge.
Duties: Performs intermediate to advanced data entry duties. Can support multiple data entry tasks in various systems. Involved in managing confidential and sensitive information. Will be requested to provide guidance to staff once they have a solid background in the work.
Contract length: 15 months

Salary: Up to $39.00 per hour

8 hour shift
Monday to Friday
No weekends

SAP/Master Data: 4 years (Required)

Calgary, AB (Preferred)

Title: Sr. Business Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description
Part Time CFO Services is looking for a Business Data Analyst to join our team working out of our Cobourg, Ontario location.
This is a new role and a new department within a rapidly growing business, so presents an excellent opportunity for the right minded individual to build and create something unique. If you enjoy creating something from the ground up, then this role is for you. The perfect candidate will be interested in developing processes, thrive in an ever-changing environment, and be excited to become the subject matter expert for a growing organization.
The Business Data Analyst will assist the organization in becoming an industry leader in its use and application of data analytics. This exciting new role will be expected to use data, statistical and quantitative analysis, explanatory and predictive models to inform internal and external stakeholders and drive decisions and actions.
What you will be doing:
· Work with all areas of the business to define and standardize data collection across the organization (What needs to be collected and when is it collected)
· Drive the process change required to achieve the standard data collection and management
· Ensuring robust and efficient processes are in place that lead to data being collected consistently and completely from across the organization
· Provide clean accessible data to all in the organization – work with IT to create tools accessible to all stakeholders
· Become the subject matter expert in analytics and predictive analytics for the organization
· Creating tools and resources to communicate data in an accessible and user-friendly way to internal and external stakeholders (e.g. KPIs, scorecards)
· Own the process for internal scorecards and metrics – ensure organization running to a regular schedule
· Provide information to measure & optimize business performance (Cost, Quality & Safety), across all functional areas
· Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure data insights are understood and acted on
· Work with all stakeholders to design additional metrics – what can we and should we measure
· Ensure process is in place to measure, capture and continuously improve the Data & Analytics function within the business
· Measure the return on investment for the business’s investment on data collection and analysis
What we are looking for:
· Completion of a four year degree in a technical field (e.g. Mathematics, Sciences, Statistics, Economics, Financial or Operations Management, etc.) or a combination of equivalent education and experience in a related role.
· Someone who finds real enjoyment working with data, processes, creating new models, statistical analysis and understanding the story behind the numbers
· Five (5) or more years of experience working with large quantities of data, using statistical and predictive analytics and evaluation of information/ data from multiple sources
· Experience with programming, business intelligence software and databases (e.g. Python, R, Matplotlib, Tableau, SQL, MongoDB, Hadoop etc).
· Experience in Process Improvement / Engineering and applying lean principles would be an asset
· Demonstrated experience in creating innovative tools and resources to communicate complex data to various stakeholders
· Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, with the ability to develop and deliver presentations to small and large teams
Why join our team?
· Part Time CFO Services believes in a “work hard/play hard” philosophy, and encourages an environment of continuous professional and personal improvement
· We offer a competitive compensation package, including a health care spending account, annual bonusing and employee stock purchase plan
How to apply
Interested? Applicants are required to provide a detailed cover letter along with their resume.
Please send your cover letter and resume-attention Helen Smith, Financial Controller with answers to the following questions:
1. Why are you interested in working with Part Time CFO Services?
2. What experiences have you had building processes within a business?
3. What do you think is the most exciting part of this role?
Part Time CFO Services is an equal-opportunity and inclusive employer. We welcome qualified applicants from all backgrounds to apply. Accommodations during the recruitment process for persons with disabilities can be arranged at anytime.
We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted
Application deadline: 2020-10-23
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Additional pay:
Bonus pay
Benefits:
Employee stock purchase plan
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday
Experience:
data analyst : 5 years (Required)
business development: 3 years (Preferred)
Education:
Bachelor's Degree (Required)
Location:
Cobourg, ON (Preferred)
Language:
English (Required)
Work remotely:
Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Information Systems Process and Data Analyst
Description:
Description
Job Summary:
As an Information Systems Process and Data Analyst, you are responsible for the design, implementation, and support of service management demand and request processes, tools and data frameworks. You enable collaboration and will work with various business leaders, the Business Relationship Manager (BRM) and other Information Technology teams to ensure the Ledcor IS team processes are tuned for velocity using the underlying ServiceNow platform, and present leadership with data-driven perspectives on performance, gaps and projections. You think ahead and look at the big picture in order to make Ledcor a stronger organization.

Come join our team in Vancouver or Edmonton today!
Essential Responsibilities
Contribute and execute a data management strategy to support our various LIS leaders, managers and teams
Identify and prioritize service areas and portfolios to develop baselines, KPI metrics and reporting
Monitors and coordinates improvements for the request and fulfillment processes
Test and iterate both business request processes and internal IS to ensure fluid and efficient processes
Contributes service descriptions and service-level agreements (SLAs) for specific services to the organization’s service catalog
Perform continual maturity assessments on service delivery processes and outline improvement opportunities or reduction of “waste” processes that will assist in improving velocity
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Business or Management Information Systems
Minimum 5+ years experience in a role of similar capacity or as a business analyst
3+ years of ServiceNow experience or equivalent ITSM service platform
Experience in design and implementation of service workflows
4 years Experience in data analysis, data structuring and visualization.
Experience implementing, tracking, analyzing and improving operational metrics associated with velocity, quality and customer satisfaction
Demonstrated ability and knowledge of interpreting business goals and strategy to derive innovative technology solutions and automation opportunities
Solid understanding of ITIL methodology and agile frameworks
Solid knowledge of the design of service workflows, ITBM modules, Service/Project Portfolio and Service Catalog
Intermediate skills Outlook, Word & Excel, PowerPoint and Visio
Advanced skills in Word & Excel to create and update templates, reports
Solid knowledge of ServiceNow and underlying capabilities
Additional Information:
Company Description
The Ledcor Group of Companies is one of North America’s most diversified construction companies. Ledcor is a company built on a rich history of long-standing project successes.
But when you work for Ledcor, your experience will go far beyond the project. Do you want a career that means more? Join our True Blue team now!
Date Posted
Oct 8, 2020
7008 Roper Road NW, Edmonton, AB, Canada

Title: Product Data Analyst - Supply Chain Management
Description:
At Mitel, you will have the opportunity to help businesses connect, collaborate and provide better experiences for our customers. You will deliver valuable contributions in creating business success within our global organization utilizing your unique attributes, skills and experience.
Please take a moment to look over this opportunity and if interested, feel free to send us your application. If this is not the right opportunity for you, you can also sign up for Job Alerts by creating an account. This will give you a profile that you can use for all future applications, and you will be notified whenever a new position that matches your criteria becomes available.
Overview:
Do you consider yourself an expert with large amounts of data, gathering requirements and building reports with an enhanced focus on process improvement? If so, the Product Data Analyst-Supply Chain Management might be the role for you.
**This position is based in Otttaw.**
Responsibilities
Owns the process from leading requirements working sessions for projects with stakeholders to draw out the business needs and to ensure requirements are aligned with the business objectives
Prepare business requirements documentation, develop process flow models and use cases
Imports large amount of data (product part numbers) from SAP into Excel
Deep dive analysis of data
Validate that the proposed solutions meet the business requirements
Support by conducting business impact and root cause analysis encountered in SAP Master Data
Analyze data to identify opportunities and suggest improvements
Preparing and presenting project proposals and engagement documents
Detailed -oriented to catch potential typos and grammatical errors
Prioritizing tasks in order of importance and planning out processes for the department to follow
Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree ore equivalent work experience
2 to 4 years experience in data analytics preferably in Supply Chain Management
Manufacturing experience (data entry for Bills of Materials, creation of part numbers, working with suppliers, etc)
Skilled in Microsoft Office, to include expert level skillset with Excel
Ability to consolidate diverse business requirements and facilitate realistic, common sense solutions
Ability to perform repetitive tasks with a high degree of accuracy
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong organizational skills
Strong interpersonal skills
Strong attention to detail, able to proofread and spot mistakes
Work independently with minimal supervision
Preferred Requirements
SAP Knowledge of Master data is an asset
APICS Certification
Mitel is committed to providing equal opportunity to all applicants and employees. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, colour, religion or belief, national or ethnic origin, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital or civil status, political affiliation, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the jurisdictions in which we operate.
These protections extend to all management practices and decisions, including recruitment and hiring practices, appraisal systems, promotions, demotions, transfers, compensation changes, training, career development programs, layoffs, and terminations.

Title: Analyste de données de l’expérience client /Customer Experie...
Description:
Role and Responsibilities
Job Description
Analyste de données de l’expérience client
(English follows)
Lorsque vous prenez l’avion, peu importe la destination, il y a de fortes chances que le pilote ait été formé par CAE. Le point focal étant les clients, l’équipe Accélérateur numérique s’engage à rehausser l’expérience de formation afin de s’assurer que les pilotes soient les meilleurs possible.
Voici quelques raisons pour lesquelles les employés aiment travailler à CAE!
Travail significatif qui favorise le perfectionnement professionnel
Possibilité de travailler dans l’industrie technologique et de s’y épanouir
Environnement de travail axé sur la collaboration
Faire partie d’une équipe à haut rendement
Votre mission
En tant que membre de l’équipe de stratégie relative à l’accélérateur numérique, votre mission est de permettre à CAE de prendre des décisions fondées sur des données en créant une infrastructure de mesure, en analysant des données tirées de l’expérience client, et en contribuant activement aux discussions portant sur les sujets liés aux données relatives à l’expérience client.
Votre rôle et responsabilités principales
Être un.e contributeur.trice de la stratégie d’expérience client
Fournir des rapports sur les renseignements utiles pour permettre aux chefs de projet d’optimiser les applications client et d’améliorer l’expérience client.
Élaborer des tableaux de bord et utiliser des visualisations appropriées pour mettre en évidence les IRC et suivre les progrès.
Agir à titre de leader en matière de mise en œuvre et d’entretien des indicateurs de rendement clés.
Collaborer avec des ingénieurs de données pour fournir les exigences relatives aux données et structurer l’information de façon à la rendre utilisable par l’entreprise.
Analyser les données comportementales et encourager l’équipe interfonctionnelle à en tirer profit afin d’offrir une expérience client supérieure.
Être un collègue inspirant et motivant
Partager vos connaissances avec l’équipe et initier des activités de partage des connaissances
Être un agent de changement et un promoteur de la mentalité agile
Contribuer au milieu de travail collaboratif et stimulant
Être en contact avec la communauté d'intelligence artificielle de Montréal et d'ailleurs pour trouver de nouvelles possibilités de collaboration et pour injecter de nouvelles idées dans notre pipeline
Vos qualifications
Niveau élevé d’exactitude, souci du détail et capacité à apprendre de nouveaux outils et technologies rapidement
Aptitude manifeste à intervenir sur des idées et des possibilités avant qu’on ne vous le demande ou d’y être contraint par des événements.
Aptitude à exercer une souplesse et à fonctionner de façon indépendante dans un environnement agile.
Aptitude à formuler des problèmes et des concepts complexes pour un public de gens d’affaires.
Grand sens de l’organisation et capacité à travailler sous pression.
Attitude positive envers l’acceptation de défis et de mandats supplémentaires.
Expérience de conceptualisation et de mise en œuvre d’entrepôts de données avec un accent sur la préparation de données.
Excellentes aptitudes en communication verbale et écrite en anglais et en français.
Compétences techniques
Expérience dans le design et l’implantation d’entreposage de données avec une forte accentuation sur la préparation des données.
Excellentes compétences techniques et analytiques avec un minimum de trois ans d’expérience en tant qu’analyste d’entreprise ou des données.
Aptitude à créer des requêtes SQL et à utiliser PowerBI et Azure DevOps.
Être capable de nettoyer et d’analyser de grands ensembles de données avec les technologies de données appropriées (p. ex., Python).
Avoir acquis une solide expérience en prise de décisions fondées sur des données analytiques et opérationnelles, en analyse de données, et en statistiques.
Posséder des aptitudes d’analyse qui démontrent votre habileté à identifier des modèles récurrents et faire les liens qui sont non-évidents de prime abord.
Expérience du développement de solutions d’expérience client (tableaux de bord, indicateurs de rendement clés, carte de pointage).
Ce que nous avons à offrir
Avantages sociaux : entièrement flexibles pour que vous puissiez choisir ce qui est important
Retraite : Régime de retraite à prestations déterminées et régime enregistré d’épargne-retraite (REER) collectif
Avantages financiers : Régime d’actionnariat et nombreux rabais d’entreprise
Programmes personnels et familiaux : Plan de bien-être physique et prestations de maternité complémentaires
Équilibre travail-vie personnelle : Horaires flexibles et « vendredis californiens » toute l’année
Plaisir au travail : Activités sociales et communautaires tout au long de l’année!
À CAE, il est très important de créer des liens avec les gens. Si vous avez des questions au sujet de cette possibilité de carrière, n’hésitez pas à communiquer avec Sawsan Ghamraoui, spécialiste en acquisition de talents ( sawsan.ghamraoui@cae.com ) ou Arnaud Van de Voorde, vice-président, accélérateur numérique ( arnaud.vdv@cae.com ).
Joignez-vous au moteur de changement à CAE - notre prochain horizon de croissance passe avant tout par l’innovation numérique afin d’appuyer la réussite de nos clients.
******************************************************************************
Customer Experience (CX) Data Analyst
If you’ve taken a plane to any destination in the world, chances are, your pilot was trained by CAE. With its strong customer focus, the Digital Accelerator team is dedicated to elevating the training experience to make pilots the best they can be.
Here are few reasons why folks love working at CAE!
Meaningful work that drives professional development
Ability to enter and grow within the technology industry
Work in a collaborative environment
Be part of a high-performance team
Your Mission
As a member of the Digital Accelerator Strategy team, your mission is to enable CAE to make data-driven decisions through the creation of measurement infrastructure, analysis of experience data, and actively contributing to team discussions on CX data-related topics.
Your Role & Main Responsibilities
Be a contributor to the CX Strategy
Provide key insights reports to enable project managers to optimize their client applications and improve customer experience;
Build dashboards and use appropriate visualizations to showcase KPIs and track progress;
Act as a leader in the definition, implementation and maintenance of key performance indicators;
Work with data engineers to provide data requirements and structure information in a consumable fashion by the business;
Analyze behavioral data and encourage cross functional team to leverage this information to enable a better client experience;
Be an inspirational and motivational colleague
Share knowledge with team members & participate in various learning-sharing activities
Contribute to the collaborative and stimulating work environment
Be a change agent & Agile mindset promoter
Be connected to the industry to know tendencies and suggest innovative ideas
Your Qualifications
Experience in data warehouse design and implementation with an emphasis on data preparation
Excellent technical and analytical skills with a minimum of 3 years’ experience as a business and/or data analyst;
Proficiency creating SQL queries and using PowerBI and Azure DevOps
Comfort cleaning and analyzing large data sets with appropriate data technologies (e.g., Python);
Strong experience in analytical business decision-making, data analytics, and statistics;
Strong analytical skills with the ability to discover patterns in data and figure out puzzling data relationships;
Experience in developing customer experience solutions (dashboards, KPI, scorecard);
Experience in data warehouse design and implementation with an emphasis on data preparation;
Soft skills
High level of accuracy, attention to detail and ability to learn new technologies and tools quickly;
Demonstrated strength in taking action on ideas and opportunities before being asked or forced to by events;
Ability to exercise flexibility and operate independently in an agile environment;
Ability to articulate complex problems and concepts to a business audience;
Strong organizational skills and able to work under pressure;
Positive attitude towards accepting additional challenges and assignments;
Experience in data warehouse design and implementation with an emphasis on data preparation;
Excellent French-English written and verbal communication skills;
What we have to offer
Benefits: fully flexible for you to choose what is important
Retirement: Defined Benefits Retirement Plan & Group Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP)
Financial Perks: Employee Stock Purchase Plan & numerous corporate discounts
Personal and Family Programs: Physical Wellness Plan & Supplementary Maternity Plan
Work-Life Balance: Flextime & California Fridays all year
Fun at work: social and community events all-year round!
At CAE, connecting with people is very important. If you have any questions on this career opportunity, please do not hesitate to contact Sawsan Ghamraoui, Talent Acquisition Specialist ( sawsan.ghamraoui@cae.com ) or Arnaud Van de Voorde, Vice-President, Digital Accelerator ( arnaud.vdv@cae.com ).
Join the engine that is changing CAE, pointing towards the next horizon of growth through digital innovations to support our customers in their success.
Position Type
Regular
CAE thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only those whose background and experience match the requirements of the role will be contacted.
Equal Employment Opportunity
At CAE, everyone is welcome to contribute to our success. With no exception.
As captured in our overarching value "One CAE", we’re proud to work as one passionate, boundaryless and inclusive team.
At CAE, all employees are welcome regardless of race, nationality, colour, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability or age.
The masculine form may be used in this job description solely for ease of reading, but refers to men, women and the gender diverse.

Title: Reporting/Data Analyst
Description:
FNF Canada is a leading service provider to financial institutions in the area of mortgage processing, tax and appraisal services, and title insurance. We pride ourselves on our relentless focus on enhancing the value of our services to our clients through continuous improvement and innovation.
Reporting to the AVP, Business Optimization and Business Intelligence, the ideal candidate will be a client focused, highly professional self starter with demonstrated experience in a similar function. They will also have a positive attitude with a high level of quality workmanship and attention to detail. The incumbent will be required to quickly develop an in-depth knowledge of the FNF Canada’s proprietary National Processing System and become familiar with corollary systems and technologies.
Primary responsibilities:
Design business analysis and data recording systems for use throughout the department
Translate operational requirements or problem statements into key criteria for report creation
Maintain databases and perform updates as necessary to ensure accuracy
Regularly examine data reports to locate and resolve opportunities throughout
Accurately analyze and collect data for various types of business reports
Create business reports that provide insight into key data points
Communicate the results of data analysis in written and verbal form to managers
Support various stakeholders throughout the assigned divisions
Monitor data to identify changes in financial and business trends
Qualifications:
One to three years of experience as a reporting, data, financial or business analyst
Experience in Mortgage and Appraisal Management
Exposure to the Real Estate industry and Lending products in Financial Services is an asset
Ability to work with Business stakeholders to gather and analyze functional Business requirements.
Proven ability to write database code on SQL Server and use database code to create insightful Business Intelligence dahboards.
Knowledge of Qlikview Desktop, Qlikview NPrint, SQL Server Reporting Services is an asset.
Experience in SAP, object-oriented programming and other data analysis programs
Analytical skills that allow for the development of data-driven reports
Demonstrated ability to manage time and prioritize projects to meet deadlines
Ability to use Qlik, SQL and Microsoft Excel to create pivot tables, graphs and charts
Strong written and verbal communication skills to effectively relate data to coworkers
Excellent critical thinking skills to help solve business problems and make decisions
Tendency to pay close attention to small details that could impact results
General knowledge of business operations, objectives, strategies, process and information flow
FNF Canada offers a competitive compensation and benefits package along with career growth opportunities with a Fortune 500 Company.
We thank all candidates for their interest but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Overview
Reporting to the Manager of Research and Innovation, the successful candidate will play a lead role in the assessment and participation in research databases, beginning with the General Medicine Inpatient Initiative (GEMINI). This role will also provide analytical support to researchers and investigators at Michael Garron Hospital. The Senior Database and Research Analyst will work closely with IT, Decision Support, Clinical Programs and individual researchers and investigators.

Master’s degree (completed or in progress) in a related discipline preferred

Content knowledge and proficiency with patient information datasets and systems including DAD and NACRS
Strong data reporting, analytical and presentation skills
Proficient in the use of statistical analysis applications (e.g. SAS)
Experience with SQL is preferred
Demonstrated ability to establish and build effective working relationships
Demonstrated excellent writing and editing skills
Proficient in the use of all Microsoft office products
Demonstrated organizational skills and ability to prioritize workload
Demonstrated ability to work independently, in small groups, and in team environments
Good work and attendance record required
