Title: Senior Analyst, Data Strategy & Operations
Description:
Role: Senior Analyst, Data Strategy & Operations
Reports to: Senior Manager, Data Strategy & Operations
Status: Full Time, Regular
Division: Enercare Home and Commercial Services
Location: Birchmount (Markham)

Reporting to Senior Manager, Data Strategy & Operations, you will play a key role in a highly visible team within the organization to advance our business as we execute our data strategy. This is a great opportunity for an individual with a passion for using data to drive insights, presenting key learnings and delivering transformational outcomes to our business.

You are an inquisitive and intellectually curious individual with advanced analytics experience, excellent communications skills, good business acumen and effective change leadership. With an agile-mindset, you are obsessed with data quality, pragmatic algorithms, as well as enjoy learning our business and operations with a go-and-see approach.

Accountabilities:
Identify and translate data into descriptive or predictive models with actionable insights by performing data cleansing and feature selection effectively as well as developing algorithm with optimized computational cost
Conduct performance tuning of SSIS, ML data models and other data products refresh as appropriate
Design and perform extensive statistical analyses to seek opportunities to improve current operations and financial modelling accuracy
Develop A/B testing framework and test model quality
Create and maintain interactive data visualization through data interpretation and analyses, integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources
Build scenario simulation and other data visualization tools to inform business and operational decision-making processes
Monitor performance of released data products of the team and ensure their timely refresh and re-training as appropriate
Ensure data products and codes released by the team all have completed and up-to-date documentations available to internal stakeholders
Support and enhance of existing reports and dashboards based on evolving business needs
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data wrangling techniques
Support ad-hoc analyses with decision-grade quality
Assist in facilitating hands-on sessions in prioritizing user-stories, designing analytical approaches, running experiments, and assessing data product performance
Prepare compelling, meaningful and memorable messaging and presentations to address business questions (both written and verbal)
Have an open mind and a knack to collaborate effectively across internal and external partners to further capitalize on data assets
Handle ambiguity and apply first principles with structured approaches to solving problems
Apply design- and system-thinking concepts with an agile mindset to create and deploy incremental, viable data products by leveraging tools available in-house and in the open-source ecosystems
Qualifications:
Bachelor degree with exceptional academic standing, and/or master degree(s) in an analytical discipline such as: mathematics, applied science and engineering, physics, computer science, management analytics, data science
5+ years of practical experience in ETL/ELT and database programming
5+ years in VBA, SQL, Python
Experience in modeling and analysis including machine learning, statistical analysis, operations research, management science and data mining
Experience in problem solving and analytical skills to develop creative, unique and pragmatic approaches and solutions to address complex problems
Proven analytical and quantitative skills to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses
Technology experience in one or more of the following: Python, Scala, R, MATLAB, C/C++/C#, Java, Go, Tensorflow; OLAP cube analysis and development in Microsoft SSAS; Microsoft SSIS, Oracle; Data visualization tools such as MS SSRS, Microstrategy, Tableau, Qlikview, Power BI, D3, Apache Dash; NoSQL databases such as Hbase, Cassandra, MongoDB, Redis; Cloud services platform (e.g, Azure, AWS)
Business domain knowledge in one or more of the following: Sales and Marketing; Product Development and Product Management; Call Center Operations; Billing and Collections; Field, Fleet and Supply Chain Operations
Interest in staying current on emerging trends in software development, RPA and advanced analytics
Experience in API design and development is a plus
Experience cleaning, transforming and visualizing large data sets working with various data formats such as unstructured logs, XML, JSON, flat files, audio, image is a plus
Experience developing and using virtualization, container-based and cloud platforms such as Kubernetes, OpenShift, Swarm, Docker is a plus
Experience in SFDC (Salesforce), Click/MS Dynamics, and/or Azure Board/JIRA is a plus
Excellent oral and written communications skills
Experience working in a start-up environment is a plus

Title: Senior Analyst - Data Strategy and Operations
Description:
Come and join one of North America's largest home and commercial services and energy solutions companies! We offer comprehensive benefits, a DC Pension Plan and savings match plan. If you are passionate about joining an organization committed to delivering 5 Star Customer Service, we would love to hear from you.

Role: Senior Analyst, Data Strategy & Operations
Reports to: Senior Manager, Data Strategy & Operations
Status: Full Time, Regular
Division: Enercare Home and Commercial Services
Location: Birchmount (Markham)

Reporting to Senior Manager, Data Strategy & Operations, you will play a key role in a highly visible team within the organization to advance our business as we execute our data strategy. This is a great opportunity for an individual with a passion for using data to drive insights, presenting key learnings and delivering transformational outcomes to our business.

You are an inquisitive and intellectually curious individual with advanced analytics experience, excellent communications skills, good business acumen and effective change leadership. With an agile-mindset, you are obsessed with data quality, pragmatic algorithms, as well as enjoy learning our business and operations with a go-and-see approach.

Accountabilities:
Identify and translate data into descriptive or predictive models with actionable insights by performing data cleansing and feature selection effectively as well as developing algorithm with optimized computational cost
Conduct performance tuning of SSIS, ML data models and other data products refresh as appropriate
Design and perform extensive statistical analyses to seek opportunities to improve current operations and financial modelling accuracy
Develop A/B testing framework and test model quality
Create and maintain interactive data visualization through data interpretation and analyses, integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources
Build scenario simulation and other data visualization tools to inform business and operational decision-making processes
Monitor performance of released data products of the team and ensure their timely refresh and re-training as appropriate
Ensure data products and codes released by the team all have completed and up-to-date documentations available to internal stakeholders
Support and enhance of existing reports and dashboards based on evolving business needs
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data wrangling techniques
Support ad-hoc analyses with decision-grade quality
Assist in facilitating hands-on sessions in prioritizing user-stories, designing analytical approaches, running experiments, and assessing data product performance
Prepare compelling, meaningful and memorable messaging and presentations to address business questions (both written and verbal)
Have an open mind and a knack to collaborate effectively across internal and external partners to further capitalize on data assets
Handle ambiguity and apply first principles with structured approaches to solving problems
Apply design- and system-thinking concepts with an agile mindset to create and deploy incremental, viable data products by leveraging tools available in-house and in the open-source ecosystems
Qualifications:
Bachelor degree with exceptional academic standing, and/or master degree(s) in an analytical discipline such as: mathematics, applied science and engineering, physics, computer science, management analytics, data science
5+ years of practical experience in ETL/ELT and database programming
5+ years in VBA, SQL, Python
Experience in modeling and analysis including machine learning, statistical analysis, operations research, management science and data mining
Experience in problem solving and analytical skills to develop creative, unique and pragmatic approaches and solutions to address complex problems
Proven analytical and quantitative skills to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses
Technology experience in one or more of the following: Python, Scala, R, MATLAB, C/C++/C#, Java, Go, Tensorflow; OLAP cube analysis and development in Microsoft SSAS; Microsoft SSIS, Oracle; Data visualization tools such as MS SSRS, Microstrategy, Tableau, Qlikview, Power BI, D3, Apache Dash; NoSQL databases such as Hbase, Cassandra, MongoDB, Redis; Cloud services platform (e.g, Azure, AWS)
Business domain knowledge in one or more of the following: Sales and Marketing; Product Development and Product Management; Call Center Operations; Billing and Collections; Field, Fleet and Supply Chain Operations
Interest in staying current on emerging trends in software development, RPA and advanced analytics
Experience in API design and development is a plus
Experience cleaning, transforming and visualizing large data sets working with various data formats such as unstructured logs, XML, JSON, flat files, audio, image is a plus
Experience developing and using virtualization, container-based and cloud platforms such as Kubernetes, OpenShift, Swarm, Docker is a plus
Experience in SFDC (Salesforce), Click/MS Dynamics, and/or Azure Board/JIRA is a plus
Excellent oral and written communications skills
Experience working in a start-up environment is a plus
Enercare’s recruitment process includes accommodation for applicants with disabilities. All accommodations will take into account the applicant’s accessibility needs due to disability and are available upon request.

Title: DATA ANALYST - DATA ENGINEERING
Description:
Considering the current affairs, Allstate will be conducting virtual interviews and has made arrangements for new hires to work remotely till its deemed safe to return to office

Through our core values, Opportunity, Flexibility, Community, Diversity and Family, we have worked hard to develop and nurture a culture where employees feel valued, experience personal growth, have career options and truly enjoy the work they do.

Benefits to joining Allstate

Complete Group Benefits Program customizable to your needs

Strong Brand Recognition (listed as best Employer with Kincentric since 2012).

Working within the community and giving back!

Opportunity for career development and growth.

We work a 37.5 hour work week and we are proud to offer work from home opportunities once you have demonstrated knowledge and the required skills.

Our team is growing and we are actively looking to hire Data Analyst to join our Data Engineering team. Reporting to the Manager, Data Engineering, you will have the following responsibilities:

Use primary and secondary data sources to construct and maintain databases.

Transform data into information, and information into insights that will ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions as part of our core deliverables.

Work with cross-functional team members in identifying and prioritizing actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas. This will allow you to gain exposure to all aspects of insurance operations with respect to claims, underwriting and pricing, as well as general areas of business operations such as human resource and marketing.

Work hand in hand with predictive modelers in developing models and identifying strategies that improve the company’s bottom line.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Actuarial Science, Operations Research, Optimization, Economics, Computer Science or a related quantitative discipline

A strong understanding of clustering, classification techniques and predictive modeling concepts

Strong technical skills in SAS and SQL

Minimum 1-3 years of data manipulation and statistical analysis experience, preferably working with large datasets

Technical expertise regarding different data models, database design, data mining and segmentation techniques

Analytical, efficient problem solver and attention to detail with an ability to work independently and creatively

Knowledge of Microsoft Office, experience of R, Python, Tableau or Visual Basic

Excellent written and oral communication skills

Allstate Canada Group has policies and practices that provide workplace accommodations. If you require accommodation please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Allstate Insurance Company of Canada is one of the country's leading producers and distributors of home and auto insurance products, serving Canadians since 1953. The company strives to keep its customers in "Good Hands®" as well as its employees, and is proud to be named a Best Employer in Canada. Allstate Canada is committed to making a positive difference in the communities in which it operates and has partnered with organizations such as MADD Canada, United Way and Junior Achievement. To learn more about Allstate Canada, visit www.allstate.ca . For safety tips and advice, visit www.goodhandsadvice.ca .

For the eighth consecutive year, we are proud to be recognized as a #Kincentric Best Employer!

Title: Supply Chain Data Analyst -3 Months
Description:
A well-known consumer products company in Toronto is looking for an experienced Supply Chain Data Analyst to join their team on a 3 months contract. You’ll working in a fast-paced environment to provide strategic analysis and support.

In this Supply Chain Data Analyst role, responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Analyze supply chain metrics to synthesize insights and help with strategic decision making
Work closely with various stakeholders and business streams to provide financial analysis
Perform data analysis and manipulations on large volumes of data
Structure and execute large-scale data analysis for financial reporting
TMGCT

5+ years of related analytical experience
Expert user of Excel and Power BI Pro
Previous experience using SAP software (specifically SD/MM/FI modules)
Solid understanding of supply chain and inventory
Strong analytical skills using large data sets

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Data Analyst will play a key role in analyzing large amounts of raw information to find patterns that will help improve our company. We will rely on you to build data products to extract valuable business insights. In this role, you should be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data. We also want to see a passion for machine-learning and research. Your goal will be to help our company analyze trends to make better decisions.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Partner with the business to understand their needs, develop hypotheses and deliver quantitative models that drive business decisions.
Create multi-dimensional models across disparate datasets/departments to highlight the bigger picture opportunities for cost/time savings, business growth and improve consumer experience.
Use machine learning and artificial intelligence to go beyond the current state analytics and provide forward looking models that inform business strategy.
Prepare findings using data visualization and storytelling in a way that easily conveys the insights to the business.
Develop data governance, best practices, and processes with BI Tool vendor.
Collaborate on multiple, concurrent, cross-functional projects.
Actively pursue continual learning for him/herself and act in the best interest of our consumers while appreciating the business context of any decisions.
Challenge assumptions to find the best possible way of doing something, rather than being satisfied with how things have been done in the past.

Attributes and Skills:
Strong interpersonal skills. Able to build understanding and trust as well as develop a solid network throughout the organization.
Ability to identify the needs & expectations of others (personal & business) and act upon them to provide mutually acceptable solutions.
Strong organizational skills.
Process oriented. Can easily recognize areas of improvement and develop strategies for implementation.
Excellent problem-solving skills
Thrives in a hands-on, dynamic, agile environment.
Can anticipate and head off problems that can jeopardize deadlines, budgets and user acceptance.
Enthusiasm, to inspire your colleagues (lead by example)
Autonomous, self-motivated and structured

Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in mathematics, statistics, computer science or engineering.
Highly proficient in Python and SQL
Cloud storage and computing Systems such as AWS, Ayla or Domo
Collaboration tools: Jira, Confluence, Slack
Prior experience with Domo, Clararidge, Qlik, Google Analytics, Ayla or in-product edge computing with embedded machine learning algorithms an asset.

Title: Data and Analytics Quantitative Analyst 3157309
Description:
Data and Analytics Quantitative Analyst 3157309
Job Number:
3157309
POSTING DATE: Sep 21, 2020
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-Canada-Quebec-Montreal
EDUCATION LEVEL: Bachelor's Degree
JOB: Other
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Manager
DESCRIPTION
Company Profile
Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.
As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.


Legal and Compliance
The Legal and Compliance Division assists Morgan Stanley in achieving its business objectives in a manner consistent with the Firm’s core values and Global Risk Management Principles, by facilitating and overseeing the Firm’s management of legal, regulatory and franchise risk.

Position Description:
Department Profile
Professionals within the Legal and Compliance Division (LCD) provide a wide range of services to our business units. They might help to structure a complex and sensitive cross-border transaction; advise on a new product introduction; develop a training program or defuse an investor dispute. They preserve the firm’s invaluable reputation for integrity and protect the firm from sanctions with policies and procedures that meet regulatory requirements around the world. They also strive to maintain cooperative relationships with governmental policy makers and the regulatory and self-regulatory agencies that govern the firm’s businesses.

Data & Analytics is a function in the Legal and Compliance Division responsible for designing and optimizing surveillance models, approaches and tools using advanced analytical techniques like supervised and unsupervised machine learning, Natural Language Processing (NLP) and evolving techniques like reinforcement and deep learning as well as graph analytics. The surveillances and other tools help identify suspicious and/or illegal behaviors like money laundering, market manipulation, insider trading, unfair sales or trading practices and other financial crimes.

Primary Responsibilities

Working with members of the Financial Crimes, Compliance, Legal and IT departments to identify, assess and manage risk by evaluating large data sets using various statistical tools.
Making recommendations to improve surveillance and compliance monitoring and testing activities through the development of new risk models, statistical analysis of model thresholds, back testing and other sensitivity and productivity analyses.
Developing and enhancing statistical methodologies and quantitative models to drive efficiency.
Supporting periodic risk assessments through the analysis of data elements related to potential indicators of customer, product or geographic risk and identification of new quantitative factors that can be incorporated into the risk assessment process
Assisting in the creation of key risk and performance indicators in support of the oversight, monitoring and testing program.
QUALIFICATIONS
Skills Required

Master’s Degree in Computer Science Machine Learning, Statistics, Operations Research, Mathematics, Engineering or other highly quantitative field.
At least 2 years of hands-on industry experience in building supervised and unsupervised machine learning based solutions for complex business problems.
At least 2 years of experience of applied statistical analysis (including hypothesis testing, regression analysis, goodness of fit testing) to solve a given business problem.
Knowledge of software design principles and excellent skills in one or more programming languages including Python, R, Java, Scala
Ability to work in a team environment, balance participation on multiple projects and resolve conflicting priorities

Skills Desired

Exposure to deep learning frameworks including PyTorch or Tensorflow
Demonstrated Experience with big data tools such as Hadoop & cloud computing, such as PySpark and cloud machine learning tools.
Familiarity with Financial Markets, with an emphasis on Financial Crimes, Compliance or Fraud analytics.
Knowledge of Graph Databases and Semantic Modelling.

Knowledge of French and English is required.

Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential.

Spotlight on our Montreal Technology Centre: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oo5GaXpCwKs
Video dated October 2019.

Title: Analyst, Master Data Management
Description:
English version to follow
McKesson touche la vie des patients en œuvrant dans pratiquement tous les secteurs des soins de santé dans le but d’améliorer la santé en général. Chez McKesson Canada, nous créons un impact dans la vie de 12 millions de Canadiens, chaque jour. Nous distribuons plus de 35 000 produits à partir de 17 centres de distribution à 6 300 pharmacies de détail, 1 350 hôpitaux, centres de santé longue durée, cliniques et établissements de santé partout au Canada. Toutefois, nous sommes beaucoup plus qu'une entreprise de distribution. Nous avons automatisé 2 500 pharmacies de détail et distribuons annuellement plus de 100 millions de doses de médicaments grâce à nos solutions d'automatisation. Les fabricants, les fournisseurs de soins de santé et les patients comptent sur nous pour une gamme complète de services qui contribuent à la qualité et l'intégrité des soins de santé pour le bénéfice de tous.

Chez McKesson, vous participerez à la création de produits et de solutions qui contribuent à la réalisation de la mission de l’entreprise, soit améliorer la qualité de vie et faire progresser les soins de santé. Travailler ici représente une occasion d’édifier une industrie qui est vitale pour nous tous.
Résumé des fonctions
L'Analyste de la Gestion et de la Gouvernance des Données Maîtres est chargé d’assurer l'exactitude, l'exhaustivité, la cohérence et la conformité des données en fonction des besoins de l'entreprise, et ce, tout en développant et en surveillant via des audits, des contrôles de données, ainsi que la production de manière ponctuelle de divers analyses et rapports. Le rôle consiste de plus à analyser les données et les processus d’affaires actuels, d'identifier les inefficacités, et de faire la proposition de solutions et de plans d’améliorations auprès des parties prenantes de l'entreprise pour des mesures correctives. Le rôle exige d’être en mesure de travailler de manière indépendante et créative pour collecter et analyser les données, évaluer les exigences et mettre en œuvre des solutions pour les problèmes critiques liés aux données de base, tout en assurant l'alignement au sein de toutes les unités d'affaires de McKesson Canada.
Section A – Responsabilités spécifiques

Les devoirs et responsabilités comprennent généralement, mais sans s’y limiter :
Responsable d’assurer la qualité des données de base et de développer de nouveaux moyens de contrôle. Analyser toute non-conformité relative aux objectifs de gouvernance des données maîtres et assurer des mesures correctives au besoin. Développer des rapports et une base de données en utilisant les données SAP et autres systèmes ERP, tout en assurant l’efficacité et l’analyse des processus pour identifier les problèmes nécessitants des correctifs. Élaborer, mettre en œuvre et maintenir une surveillance de la gouvernance et des KPI pour mesurer de manière adéquate les objectifs. Responsable de surveiller et d’assurer le respect des divers processus relatifs aux données maîtres et ce, en ligne avec la vision. Faire la recherche et l’analyse des résultats selon les besoins de l’entreprise. Effectuer diverses analyses et déterminer au besoin des recommandations pour l’amélioration des processus du département. Analyser les données et organiser les informations de manière structurée et significative, et diffuser les informations et les rapports aux parties prenantes concernées. Identifier les solutions commerciales liées aux problèmes de données, et agir à titre de contact clé pour les questions relatives à ces problèmes spécifiques. Orchestrer les différents suivis selon les besoins. Soutenir les efforts et les projets d’améliorations en fournissant des données pour évaluer les opportunités et les possibles ajouts aux bases de données maîtres. Publier les performances des KPI à l’équipe de travail et aux parties prenantes concernées. Soutenir les activités d’intégration de nouveau personnel, ainsi qu’assurer la formation des membres actifs de l’équipe sur les changements de systèmes et/ou de processus. Agir en tant qu’expert en la matière pour la gestion des données de base liées aux fonctions actuelles. Assister aux réunions interdépartementales clés et soutenir la nécessité et l’interprétation des besoins en matière de rapports. Assurer la liaison avec la direction pour informer et communiquer les résultats des initiatives clés. Faire des recommandations au Chef Principal Gestion des données Maîtres concernant les mesures à prendre pour l’amélioration continue des processus dans le cadre de la qualité des données de base. Effectuer toutes autres activités ad hoc au besoin.
Section B – Responsabilités générales
Jouer un rôle dans la résolution des problèmes qui nécessitent une solution inter-fonctionnelle; faciliter les meilleures pratiques d’affaires.
Posséder une autorité décisionnelle et une autonomie visant à résoudre de manière efficace tout problème possible lié à la production, aux processus, ainsi qu’aux problèmes techniques.
Établir des relations interdépartementales avec les autres parties prenantes pour obtenir leur soutien et maintenir des relations positives ayant un impact significatif sur le succès de MDM.
Assurez-vous de respecter et d’adhérer aux politiques et procédures de l’entreprise.
Trouver et mettre en œuvre des opportunités d’amélioration continue tout au long du mandat.
Communiquer efficacement avec les membres de l’équipe pour s’assurer que les besoins opérationnels des clients internes soient satisfaits.
Section C – Exigences du poste
Baccalauréat en commerce, science ou informatique ou expérience professionnelle pertinente.
5-7 ans d’expérience dans le domaine de la gestion et de l’analyse des données.
Compétence en leadership.
Compétence d’influence.
Capacité à travailler dans un environnement en rapide évolution.
Excellentes compétences relationnelles et interpersonnelles.
Excellentes compétences en communication verbale et écrite.
Connaissance de MS Office, Gestion de base de données, outils statistiques, y compris des compétences avancées dans Excel, MS Access, ainsi que SQL et VBA.
Connaissance de SAP / Vistex est considéré comme un atout.
Connaissance de AS400, MBA est considéré comme un atout.
Bilingue français et anglais.
-
McKesson is in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. At McKesson Canada, we touch the lives of 12 million Canadians every day. We carry more than 35,000 products in 17 distribution centers and ultimately provide distribution to 6,300 retail pharmacies, 1,350 hospitals, long-term care centers, clinics and institutions all over Canada. But we're so much more than a distribution company. We've automated 2,500 retail pharmacies and dispense over 100 million doses a year through our automation solutions. Manufacturers, healthcare providers and patients count on us for a full range of services that contribute to the quality and safety of care for us all.

At McKesson Canada, you’ll help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that’s vital to us all.
Job Summary

The Master Data Management & Governance Analyst is responsible to ensure data accuracy, completeness, consistency and conformity according to business requirements, by developing and monitoring audits, data controls, as well as routine and ad-hoc delivery of analytics and reports. This includes performing business process and data analysis, identifying gaps and inefficiencies, and proposing solutions and plans to streamline, as well as following up with business stakeholders for corrective action. The role involves working independently and creatively to collect and analyze data, assess technical requirements, and designing and implementing solutions for critical issues related to master data, all the while ensuring alignment within all McKesson Canada business units.
Section A – Specific Responsibilities

Duties and responsibilities generally include but are not limited to:
Responsible to ensure master data quality and develop new means of data quality control. Analyse any non-compliance to data governance objectives and ensure corrective action is taken Develop reports and database, using data from SAP and other ERP systems, ensure process efficiency and analysis to identify issues requiring resolution Develop, implement and maintain governance oversight and KPI to successfully measure data governance objectives Responsible for monitoring and ensuring the adherence to the master data process vision Investigates and analyzes results from business data needs Perform analysis and propose recommendations for department process improvement Analyze data and organize information in a structured and meaningful way, and circulate information and reports to applicable business stakeholders Identify business solutions related to data issues, defect clarification, and act as key point of contact for application questions and orchestrate follow-up as required Support business improvement efforts and activities by providing data to evaluate opportunities and additions to master databases Publish KPI performance to work team and appropriate stakeholders Support on-boarding activities, as well as coaching team members on system and process changes Act as the subject matter expert for master data management related to current functions Attend key cross-functional meetings and support the establishment and interpretation of management reporting needs Liaise with management to inform and communicate outcome of key initiatives. Makes recommendations to Sr. MDM Manager regarding action towards continuous improvement of processes within the quality of master data Perform other adhoc activities as required
Section B – General Responsibilities
Play a role in resolving issues that require a cross-functional solution; facilitate sharing of best practices.
Has decision-making authority and autonomy to solve production, processes and technical issues and resolve conflicts in an effective manner.
Build cross-functional relationships with Internal Stakeholders to gain support and maintain positive relationships significantly impacting the success of MDM.
Ensure to respect and adhere to company policies and procedures.
Find and implement opportunities for continuous improvement throughout the assigned process
Communicate effectively with applicants to ensure that the operational needs of internal clients are met
Section C – Position Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Business, science or computer science or relevant professional experience.
5-7 years of experience in the field of data management and analysis.
Leadership competency.
Influencing skills.
Ability to work in a fast paced changing environment.
Excellent interpersonal relationship skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Knowledge of MS Office, database management, statistical tools including advanced skills in Excel and MS Access, as well as SQL and VBA
Knowledge of SAP/Vistex, are considered an asset.
Knowledge of AS400, MBA, are considered an asset.
Bilingual French – English.

Worker Type
Regular

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About KOHO
KOHO is a quickly scaling FinTech company backed by leading investors and advisors from around the world. We started KOHO because we believe in doing two things:

Democratizing access to the best financial products and giving everyone a great financial foundation.

Since our journey began 5 years ago, we’ve raised more the $60M, grown the KOHO Collective to over 100 employees and created accounts for more than 250,000 Canadians.

About the Role
We're building a world-class financial product and we need someone to help our growth and operations teams make data-driven decisions. Our team is growing fast, and we’re looking for a Data Analyst who's passionate about our mission and embraces new challenges every day.

The successful candidate will support various KOHO business units including our Finance, Marketing, and Partnership teams, by developing dashboards and other data-related reporting. You’ll spend the majority of your time writing SQL queries, creating data visualizations, and consulting with business-side team members.
Responsibilities
Develop and maintain SQL-based dashboards and reports for KOHO business units
Communicate data insights to a non-technical audience
Define and manage key SaaS business metrics such as ARPU, CAC etc.
Scope and prioritize incoming data requests within your workflow
Coordinate with other data team members on team projects and preserving our data warehouse as the source of truth at KOHO
Desired Skills & Experience
1-3 years of experience in data analysis
Experience identifying, analyzing, and interpreting trends or patterns in complex data sets
Experience writing SQL queries that are simply beautiful
A quick study on business concepts, metrics and KPIs
Ability to choose and develop visual representations of complex data sets to drive business decisions and action
Familiarity with statistical concepts such as probability distributions, correlation and when to incorporate them into data analysis
Deft time management and communication skills
Nice-to-Have Skills
Python (familiarity with libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib)
Git
Finance or SaaS industry experience
Joining the (lovely!) KOHO Team

We invest time and resources into making sure KOHO is as good as the people we hire. Our culture is one of collaboration, creativity, and diverse perspective. Here are some of the reasons we attract the best people:

Balance Your Life - Unlimited PTO, generous vacation, and a lifestyle spending account
Level Up - Access to an in-house certified performance coach
Reach Your Goals - Salary assessments twice a year, annual training allowance
The KOHO Culture - We have won 5 "Great Place to Work ®" awards since 2019

The Fine Print

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and uniqueness at our company.

KOHO is trusted with highly sensitive information. Upon joining the team, you may be asked to undergo security screening including a criminal record check.

Title: Admin/Data Analyst
Description:
Civeo is a global workforce accommodation specialist that helps people maintain healthy, productive and connected lives while living and working away from home. Our unique approach focuses on guest wellbeing, operational efficiency, community building and a property development mindset – making us a leading provider of accommodation solutions.
Due to an employee leave, Civeo is currently seeking interested and qualified candidates to fill a temporary position (3 month term, which may be extended) of Data Analyst HSE, at the Edmonton Head Office (3790-98 Street). Due to Covid-19 restrictions, all Civeo employees are currently working from home. Being an integral member of the Health, Safety and Environment (HSE) Department, the successful candidate will be accountable for directing, coordinating and supporting essential HSE reporting as well as developing and maintaining HSE databases, quality measurements and statistical reporting as it pertains to North American operations. The candidate will also complete basic business analyst tasks such as making recommendations based on data analysis. Short organizational success will be dependent on your ability to: meet established targets, stay focused on business drivers and utilize your proven leadership skills to promote quality products & services within the team. Reporting to the Senior Director of Health, Safety and Environment, this position will be responsible for:
Key Responsibilities
Prepare dashboards and statistical reporting for facility and senior management to isolate and reduce corporate risk and liability.
Oversee the integrity and maintenance of the HSE management software system.
Stay fully informed on major activities and goals of organization to ensure important data needs are anticipated and met.
Create, analyze, and maintain HSE dashboards; utilize and manage data to forecast trends, provide projections, and develop ‘what if’ scenarios to mitigate risks.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns.
Generate, update, and report on statistics (for monthly, quarterly, and annual meetings) on a variety of HSE metrics for the purpose of providing information and/or recommendations.
Proactively assist and collaborate on the functionality and maintenance of the HSE environmental management system and the HSE management software system.
Optimizing statistical efficiency and data quality.
In conjunction with the Sales & Bids Department, provide consultation and conduct the collection of HSE data and information.
Lead the tracking of strategic plan completion; monitor the progress of annual KPI’s and deliverables.
Support development and maintenance of HSE management system documents and processes
Oversee and support administrative duties as required.
Qualifications
Diploma or Degree in Business Administration.
Training in project management will be an asset.
Training in HSE management systems will be an asset.
Experience
A minimum of 3 years’ experience in an administrative, data analyst role.
A minimum of 2 years’ experience in an HSE administrative or advisory role.
Advanced understanding in Excel and Visio; proficient understanding in other Microsoft Office applications.
Understanding of databases such as JDE, Success Factors or MyOSH.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Must possess excellent analytical skills and be able to draw accurate conclusions from the data analyzed.
Strong attention to detail is required given strict expectations for quality work.
Ability to be part of a team and foster an inclusive work environment that respects all aspects of diversity.
Upholds ethics and values; demonstrates integrity; promotes individual and organizational adherence to HSE standards.
[Not translated in selected language]
To apply, please submit resume online to http://civeo.com/people-careers/job-opportunities/
Civeo is committed to the principle of employment equity. We welcome diversity and encourage all who are qualified to express their interest.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Autodata Solutions, a division of J.D. Power, is looking for a Data Analyst to join our London team!
Position Overview:
The primary function of the Automotive Data Analyst is to obtain, compile, analyze, interpret, research, code, and test for presentation all ordering, pricing, and technical information needed by Autodata and Chrome Data Systems from the Automotive Industry. The entry level Automotive Data Analyst 1 must apply highly specialized knowledge of automotive vehicles and the variations of each manufacturer, as well as keep track of numerous details and their inter-relationships to develop a coding structure that makes the Autodata/Chrome Data product display accurate information with every possible set of variables. Each Data Analyst is ultimately responsible to ensure the Autodata/Chrome Data content “Gold Standard”.
Core Job Duties and Responsibilities:

Gain understanding of the department and industry which is necessary to develop personal priorities and timelines and hit deadlines within departmental schedule
Participate in entry and testing updates to company products
Review and analyze source documents from the manufacturer to identify discrepancies, inaccuracies, or missing content.
Accurately enter and/or test incentive vehicle data
Enter and test up to mid-level complexity vehicles for multiple OEM’s
Responsible to help the team achieve established goals, as well as completing individual responsibilities in a timely manner
May work on special projects, depending upon available resources and appropriate skill levels
Receive and respond to customer reports of errors and proactively respond with corrections and status updates in a professional manner
Act as a positive team player
Qualifications:
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Post-secondary education would be an asset
Able to work well under pressure and to excel in a constantly changing environment
Strong self-management and analytical abilities
Very high accuracy and attention to detail is required
Self-motivated and able to work within a team
Computer skills – MS Office, Excel, Word
Time management skills, organized and able to meet deadlines
This role requires flexible hours (including OT) which may at times include early mornings, late nights and weekends
Additional Skills considered an asset:
Experience with Kibana Elasticsearch software or similar query & reporting programs
Strong knowledge of VIN data and how it ties to vehicles
Strong knowledge of Vehicle Ordering and Pricing data
About Autodata
We’re proud of what we do. At Autodata Solutions, we transform complex data into marketing and sales solutions for the automotive industry. When you work for us, you join a team of dedicated professionals who look for new ways to raise the bar. Our corporate culture is results focused, and our offices are informal with the goal of inspiring collaboration and outside-the-box thinking. It takes talent and ambition to meet the challenges of our rapidly evolving market — and that’s all part of the fun.
Competitive salaries
Health benefits (medical, dental, vision, subsidized gym memberships)
Professional growth
Active workplace committees (social, wellness, health and safety, philanthropy)
Discounts (vehicles, accessories, rentals, insurance)
Community outreach opportunities
Fun outings, sports and events
Free coffee (always important) and occasional free food (always the day you’re starting a diet)
For more information about Autodata, please visit our company website at www.autodatasolutions.com
We thank all applicants for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be notified. Autodata Solutions is an equal opportunity employer. We are compliant with AODA legislation; if you require accommodations during the recruitment & selection process, please specify.

Title: Senior Data analyst - Settlements
Description:
This will be a highly experienced and extremely hands-on technologist managing multiple franchise critical programs working closely with senior business stakeholders, Operations staff and other technology partners. This will require a clearly demonstrated experience in re-engineering large-scale enterprise applications along with the management of sizable global teams with constant interactions across multiple organizations including the Front Office Business, Middle Office, Finance and Technology. The successful candidate should have excellent communications skills, while extremely hands-on exposure to the upcoming and trending technologies including Big Data, Micro Services and the Container Technologies to support highly scalable and real-time deployments.
It is a critical senior Business/Data Analyst role in the Markets Operations Technology organization, responsible for delivering state of the art engineering solutions and ensuring alignment/coverage for global Strategy and Book of Work. The candidate is expected to lead global DevOps teams, perform current state and future state analysis and work with the development team to deliver the most optimal architectural solution. The individual will work very closely with Front Office, Middle Office and Back Office Operations & Technology and must have a successful track record in handling large-scale enterprise platforms. The candidate must have consistently demonstrated strategic and forward thinking vision.
The candidate must oversee and actively contribute to developing scalable architectures and data models aligned with the firm’s Enterprise Data Strategy to offer excellent client services and improve revenue streams.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Provide senior technology design and implementation leadership in managing large enterprise platforms.
Should provide strategic documentation w/r/t road maps, process flows, etc.
Ensure resolution of day-day project issues and conflicting workload priorities, escalation as required.
Report on road maps, next steps and issues/risks to stakeholders and sponsors in line with Citi standards.
The role involves an exceptionally detail oriented person with the keen ability to multi-task to meet tight deliverables in a demanding environment. Additionally they must be able to document workflows, identifies areas of improvement, and expand the scope to other regions when needed.
The role involves extensive reconciliation and data management with summarized presentations for senior management. The ability to document business requirements. Interact with technology, operations, and other business areas to develop the project life cycle.
Ability to organize data in a clear and concise way thus allowing for reconciliation and data-mining. Perform data validation, conversion and massaging to Strategic Platform’s format. Ensure data quality and accuracy. Write sql queries for different source databases by interpreting their data models.
Map the data from external sources to Strategic platform. Create and maintain the Strategic platform’s data standards. Identify data exception conditions. Multi-task – Teamwork.
Responsible for applications systems analysis and programming activities. Solves / works a variety of high impact, high-profile problems / projects with considerable business impact through in-depth evaluation of complex business processes, system processes and industry standards. Provides in-depth and sophisticated analysis with interpretive thinking to define problems and develop innovative solutions.
Directly impacts the business by influencing strategic functional decisions through advice, counsel or provided services.
Knowledge, Skills and Experience Required:
A number of years of proven delivery record of large scale, real-time enterprise platforms of high trade volume especially in the back office clearing and settlement environments.
Data Architect in both OLTP/OLAP environments including data modeling, dimensional modeling, Data Mapping, ETL Design/Transformation and Metadata repository.
Strong application development skills in PL/SQL as well as exposure to NoSQL databases. Prior experience dealing with large data sets
Education Level:
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree or equivalent work experience in Computer Science, Information Systems, or other related field
Minimum of 5 years supporting Investment Banking IT projects in a major investment bank
Prior experience and understanding of transaction mechanics and market structure for all major product classes and instrument types: : Equity, Fixed Income (Treasury, Bonds etc), Derivatives (Futures, Options, Swaps, Interest Rate Products, Equity, Credit etc ), Foreign Exchange, Commodities etc

Title: IT Senior Analyst, Master Data Migration
Description:
ABOUT US
At Saputo, we make contributions that matter every day. We’re a growing team of dedicated and passionate people around the world with a longstanding history of excellence. Each of our employees bring their best every day, and together we create the high-quality products our customers and consumers enjoy.
EMPLOYEE BENEFITS
Ensuring the well-being of our employees is our priority. We offer attractive working conditions and benefits to our employees and their families:
Competitive salaries
Advantageous corporate agreements
Full range of group insurance benefits
Group retirement pension plan with employer contribution
Purchase option of company stocks
Group RRSP
Health and wellness program in the workplace
Assistance program for employees and their families
We support employment equity. Saputo strives to embed diversity and inclusion in its operations and invites candidates from all horizons to join its family.

SUMMARY OF TASKS:
As part of the Master Data Shared Services (MDSS) team, this role will primarily support the current Saputo ERP (SAP) implementation. The role includes working with the MDSS team, the overall IT organization, and the business to successfully migrate legacy data into the Saputo Enterprise. In addition to the data migration activities, the role supports the overall MDSS needs including sustainment activities for live divisions, actively participates in governance initiatives, and other IT projects.

The MDSS organization ensures quality of Saputo data throughout the migration and sustainment activities; as a result, focus on excellence is a key quality for candidates aspiring to this position. All members of the MDSS organization integrate into all data related activities to better serve our customers.

Beyond having the right technical skillset, the successful candidate will posses the ability to manage multiple responsibilities in a fast-pace environment, be a self-starter, exercise discipline, communicate effectively, solve problems, and be an excellent team player. This role, like every other role at Saputo exemplifies and promotes the key Saputo values: ownership and commitment, team over self, efficiency through simplification, hands-on approach, family environment, and passion for learning and ongoing improvement.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Responsible for assisting with data migration and governance lifecycle activities for data objects while supporting MDSS operation activities.
Creates and maintains specifications and relevant documentations related to extraction, enrichment, transformation, and data loads.
Works closely with functional process leads and key users in defining specifications, developing transformation tools and resolving errors.
Responsible for data domain build, conversion and error corrections during the ETL load processes, working directly with technical team on design and testing
Senior Analyst oversees extract, data review, mapping, cleansing and construction activities; insuring uniqueness, integrity, accuracy, consistency, and completeness.
Ensure clean and accurate test scripts, test sign-offs, and black-out plans;
Preform business and technical interviews leading to both business and technical decisions.
Responsible for documents coming from these interviews ensuring that all data migration and conversion follows change control and project planning best practices
Identify and raise issues where decisions may be made to influence scope delivery, stay on schedule and on budget
Responsible for status reporting to IT, MDSS, and business teams.
Advocate of Data Governance ensures that any changes to data rules and system changes impacting data is proactively supported and reviewed and them communicated to the Core and Business teams to ensure data quality and minimizing any end to end processes touching Master Data.
Serve as level three support for the MDSS and business operation teams. (Travel up to 30 percent, under normal circumstances).
Supports live divisions as required
QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s in Information Systems or equivalent work experience;
4 - 6 years’ experience with data transformation or System integration
4 - 6 plus years experienced as analysis, profiling, cleansing, and load reconciliation, which include conversions and heavy system integration. Experience with data modeling, replication, web-services, and custom models considered an asset;
Knowledge of data exchange, validation, and loading techniques using tools such as data exchange, iDocs, and EDI.
Excellent English (read, write, speak); French highly desirable; Spanish an asset
Advance knowledge of business applications with a solid understanding of master data domains and their impact on other modules, business processes, and system configuration
Experience operating in a complex, fast-paced, and knowledge sharing environment with interdependencies spanning multiple work-streams, teams, business divisions, geographies, time zones, & languages;
Experience or knowledge of Data Services (BODS), LSMW, BAPIs, database connectors, FTP, SQL, programming languages, and MS office products.
Knowledge of SAP functionality, a great asset and highly desirable
Experience with multiple ERP and other system implementations with strong integration and general information sharing;
Experience with functional requirement gathering and documentation oriented towards implementing new systems and onboarding from other legacy systems;
Experience using multiple database models such as DB2, MS Access, SQL, and Oracle. Knowledge of SAP data model a strong plus
Experience or knowledge of Product Supply Chain within the food industry an asset;
Experience or knowledge of Product Life Cycle management and GDSN processes and asset
PMP, OCP, ICCP, SQL, IBM Information Management Cert, SAP Cert, Lean Six Sigma an asset
Experience with MDM tools a plus (SAP MDG, IBM Infosphere) is a plus.

For 35 plus years Bevertec has been at the forefront of providing top level technology professionals to our clients across the Greater Toronto Hamilton Area, Canada and beyond. Title: Data Analyst - Growth
Description:
About us

One of Canada’s top SaaS startups. We have a dedicated and diverse customer base that operates the most interesting businesses in some of the most amazing places around the world. Checkfront has 80+ employees across Canada but we love to call Victoria, BC our home. We offer a beautiful office space downtown, a quarterly budget for professional development and a competitive Employee Share Option Program; which means when the company wins, we will all win! We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our team to help unlock insights that will impact our business and our popular cloud-based booking and e-commerce application. You’ll get to learn and gain hands-on experience in a team-based, agile-friendly work environment with our unique industry and customers.
You are

You are passionate about data, experimentation and uncovering actionable insights and analysis to drive business decisions. You possess a growth mindset, are a lifelong learner, and are curious by nature, never settling and always striving to understand the “why”.

Our team (Growth) sits at the intersection of marketing and product, driving initiatives that will impact the online self-serve funnel, from acquisition to activation and retention. Reporting to the Sr Director, the Growth Data Analyst role will play an integral part within the Growth team, responsible for providing insights and analysis to leadership and the wider organization to be acted on.
What you will do

Dive into large data sets across the customer life cycle to identify trends, and opportunities to grow the business, from acquisition to activation and retention
Collaborate with Growth, Marketing, and Product identify opportunities and hypotheses for experimentation
Understand what matters most to the business and help the team prioritize accordingly
Partner with the Product and Engineering team to maintain and optimize the data pipeline
Implement proper tracking to successfully analyze results of growth experiments and initiatives
Define our growth analytics function by identifying key metrics and driving the foundation for our road mapping, prioritization and business intelligence.
Build dashboards, reports, and processes for the ongoing analysis, forecasting and monitoring of growth marketing campaigns and initiatives
Perform ad hoc analyses of varying depth to support strategic initiatives and answer questions arising in the day to day business
Communicate and share your insightful data analysis results and recommendations to leaders and stakeholders to be actioned

You bring with you most of the following

Bachelors' or above in CS, Engineering, Physics, Math, Statistics, Business, Economics or similar field
3+ years B2B and/or B2C experience in a growth function for a technology company, ideally in a product management/development or analytics team
Excellent skills and fluency with Excel, SQL, Python, or other analysis tools
Experience and understanding of a SaaS business model and related metrics
A genuine curiosity for how businesses work and how to make them grow
Ability to communicate complex data and concepts in ways that will resonate with leadership and the wider organization
Strong analytical skills with the ability to use data from various sources to draw insights that inform strategy and prioritization
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively with stakeholders with minimal oversight or direction
Experience with data visualization tools, such as Tableau (preferred)
Experience with Google Analytics, Amplitude or other similar tools (preferred)
Experience with A/B testing and results analysis (preferred)
An entrepreneurial spirit and #GSD attitude
You get

Open to remote
A laptop of your choosing (we mainly work in Mac & Linux).
An opportunity to work with the latest technologies available.
A workplace that values work-life balance.
An exciting fast paced environment with plenty of room to learn, excel and impact.
Flexible work hours (we care about results, not how you get them done).
Paid money to do what you love.

We think it is awesome if you live somewhere outside of Canada, but please note the preference for this role is located on the West Coast of BC.

Checkfront acknowledges and respects that we work, learn, and innovate on the unceded Coast Salish Territory of the Lekwungen & WSÁNEĆ nations.

As a company, we are committed to upholding the values of diversity, inclusion, and equity. In pursuit of this, we actively seek new members who will work respectfully and constructively with our team, and challenge the status quo, propelling our company and the community forward.

If you don’t meet all of our requirements exactly or have some gaps in your resume know that we would still love to hear from you! Use your cover letter to tell us about your unique experience - we understand that talent comes from many places and that skills are transferable.

Title: Senior Data/Business Analyst
Description:

The Senior Data/Business Analyst is responsible for understanding the systems and associated data from new data sources in order for Vestrum to maximize the value of the new data. TheSenior Data/Business Analyst will be documenting, communicating and project managing the ETL data migration plan for all new data source projects. Understanding Data Systems and how data is captured

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst
Location: Winnipeg
Role Description:
Wellington-Altus is currently recruiting for a Data Analyst position. The Data Analyst will work with the Wellington Labs team to provide data solutions to power business applications.
In this role, you will work on projects in a growing organization with opportunities to address problems needing creative solutions and models. You will be working on bringing together different data sets from across locations and modeling data to unlock actionable insights that help stakeholders formulate and answer business questions. You will collaborate closely with stakeholders from technical solutions engineering, product programs, vendor operations, support operations, and support experience teams.
As a Data Analyst, you will:
Provide decision-making support for key projects, and research new ways of modeling data to unlock actionable insights or improve processes.
Write and review technical documents, including requirements and design documents for existing and future data systems, as well as data standards and policies.
Partner with non-technical stakeholders to understand their needs, help frame the problem by asking the right questions, and document and prioritize requirements. Communicate results of technical work.
Design, write, and support extract, transform, and load (ETL) processes to automate data collection and manage pipelines.
Your education and qualifications include:
BS degree in Information Management, Computer Science, Statistics or similar.
Experience in AWS administration.
3 years of experience in an analyst or Data Science role.
Experience using SQL to work with multiple datasets.
Experience designing data models and building data structures.
Experience in a language for statistical computing (R, Python/pandas, Stata, etc.).
Conditions of Employment:
Must be legally eligible to work in Canada
A background check, satisfactory to the employer, may be required of the successful applicant prior to commencing employment
Wellington-Altus Private Wealth is strongly committed to equity and diversity within its community and welcomes applications from women, racialized persons, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, and persons of all sexual orientations and genders. Title: Data Analyst - Trauma Services - Temporary Full-Time (202349...
Description:
We currently have a Temporary Full-Time Data Analyst opportunity in the Trauma Services department at our Bayview campus. The temporary full-time contract is until Fall 2022.
Summary of Duties
The incumbent will participate in data collection, patient tracking and chart reviews for the Trauma Quality Improvement Program as well as the Ontario Trauma Registry.
Assignment of other required codes and scales. These include: CPT codes; ICD-10/external causes codes; Procedure codes; AIS 05 injury scaling
Entry of patient data into a computerized relational database from information collected on standardized forms (500-800 fields).
Generation of reports related to performance improvement and patient safety initiatives and statistical tracking.
Qualifications/Skills
Bachelor’s degree in health care related field or related post-secondary diploma in Health Information Management
Demonstrated suitable knowledge of medical terminology, pathology, anatomy, surgical procedures, and medical diagnostic & interventional terminology required. A clinical test will be required
Strong analytical capability with excellent attention to detail
Minimum (2) years’ experience with healthcare-related databases and registries
Computer competency with expert knowledge with Microsoft Office suite of applications including Excel, and PowerPoint. A technical test is required for the prospective candidate
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Strong organizational skills and time management skills
Enthusiasm and ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines in a fast paced environment
Strong people skills are required
An excellent telephone manner and command of the English language is essential
What’s next
Qualified candidates are invited to submit their resume and cover letter (in one document) quoting 202349 to: Human Resources
When submitting your application/resume, include any familiarity you have with the skills and qualifications that relate to those listed in the job posting.
Once you apply, we’ll review your resume and cover letter to determine if your skills and experience match the qualifications for the role. Only qualified candidates will be contacted to move forward in the hiring process. If you are contacted, the process will include one or more interviews and/or assessments and reference checks.Training and education will be provided to successful candidates if needed.
